  • Workation: bis zu 30 Tage pro Jahr im EU-Ausland
  • betriebliche Altersvorsorge: 20 % Zuschuss von rapidmail
  • Weiterbildung: persönliches Weiterbildungsbudget in Höhe von 1.000 € pro Jahr
  • Kinderkrankentage: 5 bezahlte Kinderkranktage für alle Eltern


BIST DU BEREIT FÜR RAPIDMAIL?


Dann starte mit uns in den Recruiting-Prozess!


  • Sende uns Deine Bewerbung.
  • Erstes Kennenlerngespräch mit unserer HR-Managerin: In diesem ersten Videocall lernst Du unsere HR Managerin kennen. Hier geht es darum, mehr über rapidmail und MAILINGWORK zu erfahren und sich über Erwartungen für die Stelle als Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d) auszutauschen. Zudem ist genügend Raum, um Deine Fragen zu klären.
  • Zweites Kennenlerngespräch mit unserem Geschäftsführer: In diesem Videocall triffst Du einen unserer Geschäftsführer. Fokus des Gespräches ist es, einen Einblick in Deine täglichen Aufgaben zu erhalten und Deine Erfahrungen, die Du in dem Bereich bereits machen durftest, zu teilen.
  • Bearbeite eine kleine Testaufgabe: Damit Du Dir ein erstes Bild von Deinen potenziellen Aufgaben machen kannst, erhältst Du eine Testaufgabe.
  • Persönliches Gespräch im Berliner, Chemnitzer oder Freiburger Büro: Die Gespräche mit Dir und Dein Ergebnis der Testaufgabe haben uns neugierig gemacht. Nun sind wir ganz gespannt darauf, ob es auch persönlich funkt. Das Team freut sich darauf, Dich kennenzulernen.
  • Erhalte unser Angebot.


Falls Du vorab noch Fragen zur Stelle oder zu rapidmail / MAILINGWORK hast, sind wir gerne für Dich da. Schreib uns einfach an hr@rapidmail.de.


rapidmail GmbH - Wentzingerstraße 21 - 79106 Freiburg


Jetzt bewerben

Title: Lead Analytics Analyst (f/m/x) - Data Analyst in AFC M&S Global Platform
Description:
Position Overview

Die Deutsche Bank (DB) kann auf eine sehr erfahrene und engagierte Abteilung für die Bekämpfung von Finanzkriminalität (Anti Financial Crime, AFC) zurückgreifen. Diese spielt eine entscheidende Rolle dabei, der Finanzkriminalität bei Geschäftsaktivitäten und globalen Finanzdienstleistungen der DB vorzubeugen und gleichzeitig die Interessen der Bank und der Gesellschaft zu wahren.

Um Finanzkriminalität wirksam zu bekämpfen und flexibel auf Herausforderungen zu reagieren, hat AFC eine Matrixstruktur, die regionale, geschäftsbereichsbezogene und globale Funktionen vereint. Sie teilt sich in die folgenden Kernbereiche auf: Anti-Money Laundering, Sanctions & Embargoes, Anti-Fraud, Bribery & Corruption, Investigations & Intelligence, Monitoring & Screening und Risk Assessment. Teil unseres Engagements ist es, eine enge Zusammenarbeit mit allen Geschäftsbereichen und Unterstützungsfunktionen innerhalb unserer Bank zu stärken.

Was AFC für Sie tun wird

AFC hilft der Deutschen Bank, langfristig Vertrauen und Mehrwert für unsere Kunden, Mitarbeiter*innen und die Gesellschaft zu schaffen. Dabei wenden wir die höchsten Verhaltensstandards an, um den Erfolg der DB bei der Bekämpfung der Finanzkriminalität zu gewährleisten. Wir bieten Ihnen herausfordernde Möglichkeiten, zu lernen, einen Beitrag zu leisten und von Ihrer Reise mit uns zu profitieren. Wir fördern eine offene und integrative Teamkultur mit dem Ziel, eine gesunde, engagierte und gut unterstützte vielfältige Belegschaft aufzubauen und zu erhalten, die in der Lage ist, ihr Bestes zu geben.

Teambeschreibung und Rollendetails

Anti-Financial Crime

Das Management von Risiken im Zusammenhang mit Finanzkriminalität und die Implementierung gültiger und wirksamer Kontrollen, Prozesse und Sicherheitsmaßnahmen haben für die Deutsche Bank höchste Priorität. AFC Monitoring & Screening Global Plattform (GP) ist verantwortlich für die Implementierung der strategischen Transaktionsüberwachungsplattform und die Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden Transaktionsüberwachungs- und Namenslisten-Screening-Systeme. Daten sind die Grundlage für umfassende Kontrollen und ein Schlüsselbereich für die Identifizierung von Risiken im Zusammenhang mit Finanzkriminalität.

Ihre Hauptverantwortlichkeiten

Innerhalb von AFCs GP konzentriert sich die „Intelligence Layer“ Funktion auf die Anwendung erweiterter Analyse Funktionen mit Bezug auf die verwendeten Daten. In dieser Funktion analysieren Sie Daten, und entwickeln daraus Erkenntnisse und Empfehlungen. Sie arbeiten eng mit funktionsübergreifenden Teams zusammen, um Geschäftsanforderungen mit analytischem Fachwissen zu unterstützen. Sie arbeiten mit weiteren Analysten, Dateningenieuren und Wissenschaftlern zusammen, um qualitativ hochwertige Ergebnisse durch die Anwendung fortschrittlicher Analysemethoden auf unsere Daten zu ermöglichen.

Für diese Rolle verfügen Sie über fundierte Erfahrungen in den Bereichen:


Analyse und Zusammensetzung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, um Trends und Muster zu identifizieren
Umsetzung von Geschäftsanforderungen und Risikodefinitionen in anwendbare Analyseaktivitäten und Entwicklung von Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen zur Unterstützung von Anforderungen im Bereich Anti-Financial Crime
Transformation von Daten in verwendbare Formate und standardisierte Protokolle
Fähigkeit, ein ganzheitliches Verständnis der bestehenden Daten und Datenquellen der Bank aufzubauen
Entwicklung von Modellen und Datenvisualisierung
der Zusammenarbeit mit Architekten, Infrastrukturexperten und Dateningenieuren in einem internationalen Umfeld für die Datenanalyse



Ihre Kompetenzen und Erfahrungen


Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder vergleichbare Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen
Erfahrung mit Datenverarbeitungs- und Integrationspipelines in einem Big Data/ETL-Kontext unter Verwendung von GCP, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Shell-Scripting, Testframeworks oder anderen Komponenten aus dem Ökosystem
Sie haben mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Entwicklung mit Python, oder ähnlichen Programmiersprachen mit Fokus auf Big Data und ein fundiertes Verständnis für Data Analytics und statistische Methoden
Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Finanzkriminalität und Banken mit deren Transaktionsprozessen
Sie sind ein Teamplayer und verfügen über eine hohe persönliche Integrität mit sehr guten Englischkenntnissen in Wort und Schrift, Deutsch wünschenswert



Die Stelle wird in Voll- und in Teilzeit angeboten

Was wir Ihnen bieten:

Wir bieten eine breite Palette von Leistungen, die all Ihre beruflichen und persönlichen Bedürfnisse abdecken.


Emotional ausgeglichen Eine positive Haltung hilft uns, die Herausforderungen des Alltags zu meistern – beruflich wie privat. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Beratung in schwierigen Lebenssituationen und Angeboten zur Förderung mentaler Gesundheit.
Körperlich fit Mit Angeboten zur Aufrechterhaltung Ihrer persönlichen Gesundheit und einem förderlichen beruflichen Umfeld hilft Ihnen die Bank, körperlich fit zu bleiben. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie umfangreichen Check-up Untersuchungen, Impfangeboten und Beratung zur gesunden Lebensführung.
Sozial vernetzt Der Austausch mit anderen eröffnet uns neue Perspektiven, bringt uns beruflich wie persönlich voran und stärkt unser Selbstvertrauen und Wohlbefinden. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Unterstützung durch den pme Familienservice, das FitnessCenter Job, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle (bspw. Teilzeit, Jobtandem, hybrides Arbeiten) sowie einer umfangreichen Kultur der Vielfalt, Chancengleichheit und Teilhabe.
Finanziell abgesichert Die Bank sichert Sie nicht nur während Ihrer aktiven Karriere, sondern auch für die Zukunft finanziell ab und unterstützt Ihre Flexibilität sowie Mobilität – egal ob privat oder beruflich. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Beitragsplänen für Altersvorsorge, Bankdienstleistungen für Mitarbeiter*innen, Firmenfahrrad oder dem Deutschlandticket.



Da die Benefits je nach Standort geringfügig variieren, gehen Sie bitte bei konkreten Fragen auf Ihren Recruiter zu.

Die Stelle wird in Voll- und in Teilzeit angeboten.

Bei Fragen zum Rekrutierungsprozess steht Nana Darko gerne zur Verfügung.

Kontakt: Nana Darko (+49(0)175- 6705312 )

Deutsche Bank (DB) benefits from having a highly experienced and dedicated Anti Financial Crime (AFC) function, which performs a crucial role in keeping DBs business operations and global financial services clean from financial crime while serving the interests of the bank and society.

In order to combat financial crime effectively and respond to challenges in a flexible manner, AFC has a matrix structure combining regional, business line and global functional coverage in our core areas of Anti-Money Laundering, Sanctions & Embargoes, Anti-Fraud, Bribery & Corruption, Investigations & Intelligence, Monitoring & Screening, and Risk Assessment. Part of our commitment is to strengthen a strong collaboration with all business lines and support functions within our bank.

What AFC Will Do For You

AFC helps Deutsche Bank generate long-term trust and add value for our clients, staff and society and provide challenging opportunities for you to learn, contribute and benefit from your journey with us. We foster an open and inclusive team culture with the aim to build and maintain a healthy, engaged and well-supported diverse workforce that is equipped to do their best and enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace, whilst applying the highest standards of conduct to guarantee DB´s success in fighting financial crime.

Team- And Role Description

Anti-Financial Crime

The management of financial crime related risks and the implementation of valid and effective controls, processes and security measures has highest priority for Deutsche Bank. AFC Monitoring & Screening Global Platform (GP) is responsible for the implementation of the strategic Transaction Monitoring platform and the further development of the existing Transaction Monitoring and Name List Screening systems. Data is the basis for comprehensive controls and a key area for the identification of financial crime related risk.

Your Main Responsibilities

Within AFCs GP the “Intelligence Layer” has a focus on the application of advanced analytics to the consumed data. As Data Analyst you will be analyzing data and developing insights and recommendations. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to support business requirements with analytical expertise. Collaboration with analysts, data engineers and scientists to enable quality results from the application of advanced analytics methods to our data.

For this role you should have profound experience in the areas of:


collection and analysis of data from various sources to identify trends and patterns
translation of business requirements and risk definitions into actionable analytics activities and developing insights and recommendations to drive business requirements
organizing data into usable formats and standardized protocols
ability to build a broad understanding of the bank's existing data, and data sources
development of models and data visualization
cooperation with architects, infrastructure experts and data engineers on an international framework for data analysis and enrichment



Your Competencies And Experience


You have a degree in computer science, mathematics, physics or comparable qualifications and experience
Experience with data processing and integration pipelines in a big data/ETL context, using Hadoop, Apache Spark, GCP, shell scripting, test frameworks, or other components from the ecosystem
You have at least 3 years of working experience in Python, or similar programming languages with a focus on big data and a sound understanding for data analytics and statistical methods
Experience in the areas of financial crime and banking with their transaction processes
You are a team player and have as well a high level of personal integrity with excellent oral and written English skills, German desirable



This job is available in full and parttime.

What we offer:

We provide you with a comprehensive portfolio of benefits and offerings to support both, your private and professional needs.


Emotionally and mentally balanced A positive mind helps us master the challenges of everyday life – both professionally and privately. We offer consultation in difficult life situations as well as mental health awareness trainings.
Physically thriving We support you in staying physically fit through an offering to maintain personal health and a professional environment. You can benefit from health check-ups; vaccination drives as well as advice on healthy living and nutrition.
Socially connected Networking opens up new perspectives, helps us thrive professionally and personally as well as strengthens our self-confidence and well-being. You can benefit from PME family service, FitnessCenter Job, flexible working (e.g parttime, hybrid working, job tandem) as well as an extensive culture of diversity, equity and inclusion.
Financially secure We provide you with financial security not only during your active career but also for the future. You can benefit from offerings such as pension plans, banking services, company bicycle or “Deutschlandticket”.



Since our offerings slightly vary across locations, please contact your recruiter with specific questions.

In case of any recruitment related questions, please get in touch with Nana Darko.

Contact: Nana Darko (+49(0)175- 6705312 )

Wir streben eine Unternehmenskultur an, in der wir gemeinsam jeden Tag das Beste geben. Dazu gehören verantwortungsvolles Handeln, wirtschaftliches Denken, Initiative ergreifen und zielgerichtete Zusammenarbeit.

Gemeinsam teilen und feiern wir die Erfolge unserer Mitarbeiter*innen. Gemeinsam sind wir die Deutsche Bank Gruppe.

Wir begrüßen Bewerbungen von allen Menschen und fördern ein positives, faires und integratives Arbeitsumfeld.

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are seeking an organised and self-motivated Data Analyst to work embedded in our Marketing Data team, one of our cross-functional Data teams to help shape the development of one of the world's leading FinTech products.

As a Senior Data Analyst you will enable our Marketing team to make data-driven decisions. You will monitor, measure and analyse the effectiveness of your marketing teams’ initiatives, as well as help drive the strategy of your stakeholder teams. You are here to establish a data-mindset and thereby to foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement. You will work in a cross functional setup, working closely with other analysts, engineers, scientists and marketing managers.

In This Role, You Will


Help us set the right goals: Develop clear and measurable targets based on an initiatives’ scope.
Be a strategic partner for Senior Leadership: Driving end to end high complexity analysis on a strategic level in which the business domain is critical to drive overall company success.
Stakeholder management: Be an internal go-to-person for your teams when it comes to data related questions.
Evaluate initiatives: Support Marketing experimentation & testing initiatives; design test plans, obtain cross-functional alignment, execute robust analysis, and deliver actionable insights. Share these learnings through clear documentation and concise and empathic communication.
Contribute to self-serve data platform: Help building the right analytics foundations ,by pairing up with technical peers, so our marketing teams can interact with data and extract the right insights themselves.
Provide monitoring tools: Build the dashboards your team looks at every week to make sure they are impacting our company OKRs.
Improve data literacy of organisation: Educate teams to become independent when it comes to data access and understanding function led training and team wide workshops to foster data driven culture.
Be part of our data-community: Collaborate with a broad range of analytics teams at N26 to utilise shared platforms, insights and innovations.


What You Need To Be Successful


5+ years of experience, within the Marketing or Product Analytics field.
Strong understanding of statistical methods used in the analysis of experimental and observational data.Highly experienced with SQL and Python/R for analytics
Experience working with one or more common data visualisation tools (Tableau, Metabase, Looker, Superset, etc)Good presentation skills and communication skills.
Having experience in high growth startups managing topics like lifecycle, marketing strategy, engagement or subscription would be a plus.
Experience with Customer Data Platforms (eg. Braze, Treasure Data) would be a plus.
Having experience in quantitative research would be a plus.
Having experience in fintech would be a plus.


What’s In It For You


Accelerate your career growth by joining one of Europe’s most talked about disruptors 🚀.
Employee benefits that range from a competitive personal development budget, work from home budget, discounts to fitness & wellness memberships, language apps and public transportation.
As an N26 employee you will have access to a Premium subscription on your personal N26 bank account. As well as subscriptions for friends and family members.
Vacation days vary depending on your location of work. Additional day of annual leave for each year of service.
A high degree of autonomy and access to cutting edge technologies - all while working with a friendly team of peers of diverse nationalities, life experiences and family statuses.
A relocation package with visa support for those who need it.


Who We Are

N26 has reimagined banking for today’s digital world. Technology and design empower everything we do and it’s how we are building the global banking platform the world loves to use.

We've eliminated physical branches, paperwork, and hidden fees for an elegant digital experience and supreme savings. Giving people the power to live and bank their way is what gets us out of bed in the morning and inspires the work that we do.

We are headquartered in Berlin with offices in multiple cities across Europe, including Vienna and Barcelona, and a 1,500-strong team of more than 80 nationalities.

Sounds good? Apply now for this position.

N26 is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

As a Senior Data Analyst you will enable our Marketing team to make data-driven decisions. You will monitor, measure and analyse the effectiveness of your marketing teams’ initiatives, as well as help drive the strategy of your stakeholder teams. You are here to establish a data-mindset and thereby to foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement. You will work in a cross functional setup, working closely with other analysts, engineers, scientists and marketing managers.

In This Role, You Will

  • Help us set the right goals: Develop clear and measurable targets based on an initiatives’ scope.
  • Be a strategic partner for Senior Leadership: Driving end to end high complexity analysis on a strategic level in which the business domain is critical to drive overall company success.
  • Stakeholder management: Be an internal go-to-person for your teams when it comes to data related questions.
  • Evaluate initiatives: Support Marketing experimentation & testing initiatives; design test plans, obtain cross-functional alignment, execute robust analysis, and deliver actionable insights. Share these learnings through clear documentation and concise and empathic communication.
  • Contribute to self-serve data platform: Help building the right analytics foundations ,by pairing up with technical peers, so our marketing teams can interact with data and extract the right insights themselves.
  • Provide monitoring tools: Build the dashboards your team looks at every week to make sure they are impacting our company OKRs.
  • Improve data literacy of organisation: Educate teams to become independent when it comes to data access and understanding function led training and team wide workshops to foster data driven culture.
  • Be part of our data-community: Collaborate with a broad range of analytics teams at N26 to utilise shared platforms, insights and innovations.

What You Need To Be Successful

  • 5+ years of experience, within the Marketing or Product Analytics field.
  • Strong understanding of statistical methods used in the analysis of experimental and observational data.Highly experienced with SQL and Python/R for analytics
  • Experience working with one or more common data visualisation tools (Tableau, Metabase, Looker, Superset, etc)Good presentation skills and communication skills.
  • Having experience in high growth startups managing topics like lifecycle, marketing strategy, engagement or subscription would be a plus.
  • Experience with Customer Data Platforms (eg. Braze, Treasure Data) would be a plus.
  • Having experience in quantitative research would be a plus.
  • Having experience in fintech would be a plus.

What’s In It For You

  • Accelerate your career growth by joining one of Europe’s most talked about disruptors 🚀.
  • Employee benefits that range from a competitive personal development budget, work from home budget, discounts to fitness & wellness memberships, language apps and public transportation.
  • As an N26 employee you will have access to a Premium subscription on your personal N26 bank account. As well as subscriptions for friends and family members.
  • Vacation days vary depending on your location of work. Additional day of annual leave for each year of service.
  • A high degree of autonomy and access to cutting edge technologies - all while working with a friendly team of peers of diverse nationalities, life experiences and family statuses.
  • A relocation package with visa support for those who need it.

Who We Are

N26 has reimagined banking for today’s digital world. Technology and design empower everything we do and it’s how we are building the global banking platform the world loves to use.

We've eliminated physical branches, paperwork, and hidden fees for an elegant digital experience and supreme savings. Giving people the power to live and bank their way is what gets us out of bed in the morning and inspires the work that we do.

We are headquartered in Berlin with offices in multiple cities across Europe, including Vienna and Barcelona, and a 1,500-strong team of more than 80 nationalities.

Sounds good? Apply now for this position.

N26 is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Title: Senior Data Analyst / Data Engineer (f/m/x) – Trade Finance
Description:
Position Overview

About the job - Deutsche Bank Technology in Berlin

DB Technology is a global team of tech specialists, spread across multiple trading hubs and tech centres. We have a strong focus on promoting technical excellence – our engineers work at the forefront of financial services innovation using cutting-edge technologies.

Our Berlin location is our most recent addition to our global network of tech centres and growing strongly. We are committed to building a diverse workforce and to creating excellent opportunities for talented engineers and technologists. Our tech teams and business units use agile ways of working to create #GlobalHausbank solutions from our home market.

Trade Finance and Lending (TF&L) is one of the leading business departments in the Corporate Bank working with clients around the globe. It has great dependency on IT platform to service the Bank’s clients. The group is working on technology refresh of their IT platform to enable new services for customers as well as to achieve next level of business processes automation.

In-house IT team already achieved great success designing, building and rolling out into production its strategic platform for TF&L business. Based on that success there is a further desire to build towards our strategic architecture.

Your primary focus will be to design and build the central data platform: analytics/MIS/BI and data model for TF&L business of the Bank.


> You love this job but feel you cannot tick 100% of the boxes? Send us your CV anyway!



Your Key Responsibilities


Work closely with business stakeholders and product owner to define MIS solution roadmap and requirements
Design, build and maintain MIS dashboards and data feeds; consolidate multiple datasets into datamarts and metrics for the business users and the clients of the bank
Define and maintain org-level central data model for TF&L business, evolve it to support project goals but keep it consistent for the future
Partner with data engineering teams to align the data platform technical roadmap with MIS requirements
Support audit, regulatory requests and management teams with data investigations, deep dives and ad-hoc analysis



Your Skills And Experiences


Experience in data analysis and data interpretation, good hands-on SQL knowledge (ClickHouse is a plus), experience in BI Tools, e.g. Tableau (preferred), Power BI, Looker etc. Python is a plus.
Understanding of dashboard design and data visualisation principles
Business requirements analysis and management skills; relevant experience in the banking sector is a plus
Strong communication skills, stakeholder management, communication with groups of SMEs, making decisions in a group setting
Experience in data modelling, logical and physical data models, protocol formats; experience in modelling tools e.g. Legend, Power Designer is a plus
Knowledge of data architecture, data pipelines, ELT/ELT, data quality controls
Fluent written and spoken English – you will communicate a lot on your job as part of a global team



What We Offer

We provide you with a comprehensive portfolio of benefits and offerings to support both, your private and professional needs.


Emotionally and mentally balanced A positive mind helps us master the challenges of everyday life – both professionally and privately. We offer consultation in difficult life situations as well as mental health awareness trainings.
Physically thriving We support you in staying physically fit through an offering to maintain personal health and a professional environment. You can benefit from health check-ups; vaccination drives as well as advice on healthy living and nutrition.
Socially connected Networking opens up new perspectives, helps us thrive professionally and personally as well as strengthens our self-confidence and well-being. You can benefit from PME family service, FitnessCenter Job, flexible working (e.g parttime, hybrid working, job tandem) as well as an extensive culture of diversity, equity and inclusion.
Financially secure We provide you with financial security not only during your active career but also for the future. You can benefit from offerings such as pension plans, banking services, company bicycle or “Deutschlandticket”.



Since our offerings slightly vary across locations, please contact your recruiter with specific questions.

This job is available in full and parttime.

In case of any recruitment related questions, please get in touch with Kilian Weber.

Contact Kilian Weber: +49 (30) 340 73087

Wir streben eine Unternehmenskultur an, in der wir gemeinsam jeden Tag das Beste geben. Dazu gehören verantwortungsvolles Handeln, wirtschaftliches Denken, Initiative ergreifen und zielgerichtete Zusammenarbeit.

Gemeinsam teilen und feiern wir die Erfolge unserer Mitarbeiter*innen. Gemeinsam sind wir die Deutsche Bank Gruppe.

Wir begrüßen Bewerbungen von allen Menschen und fördern ein positives, faires und integratives Arbeitsumfeld.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Role

My client are seeking a talented Data Engineer to join their growing team. You will play a key role in designing, building, and maintaining our data pipelines and infrastructure. This role requires a strong understanding of PostgreSQL databases and experience working with cloud platforms.




Responsibilities

Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for ingesting, transforming, and loading data from various sources into our data warehouse.

Optimize PostgreSQL databases for performance and scalability.

Develop and maintain SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Work with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) to provision and manage data storage, compute resources, and containerized applications.

Write code in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) to automate data engineering tasks.

Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and software engineers to ensure data quality and accessibility.

Document data pipelines, schemas, and procedures.

Stay up-to-date on the latest data engineering and cloud technologies.




Qualifications

Strong expertise in PostgreSQL, including database design, administration, performance tuning, and security.

Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Experience with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) for data storage, compute resources, and services (e.g., S3, DynamoDB, Redshift, Aurora, Athena).

Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash).

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Ability to manage complex projects and interact effectively with other teams.




Bonus Points

Interest in working on providing solutions to environmental sustainability.

Experience with database change management systems like Liquibase, Flyway etc

Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Kafka).

Experience with data warehousing concepts (e.g., dimensional modelling, slowly changing dimensions etc).

Certifications in cloud platforms or data engineering tools (e.g., AWS Certified Data Engineer).

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Description Overview

Perrigo Company is dedicated to making lives better by bringing Quality, Affordable Self-care products that consumers trust everywhere they are sold. Help us do it.




As the Business Intelligence Manager you will play a pivotal role in owning data collection and reporting of the local business, being a critical partner to the Local and Cluster leadership team. Reporting to the Head of CS&I and BI DACH, you will partner with the local team to deliver best in business understanding for the local market.




Location: Can be based in our Vienna office/Stuttgart office or Germany remote




Scope of the Role

Enable delivery of Business Goals & Commercial Strategy for the Country

A key partner delivering data reporting to the local & cluster leadership team to support delivery of business goals
Primary responsibility to retrieve, combine, structure & summarise sales (sell in, sell out & DVRP) data from commercial teams, creating dynamic dashboards that show actionable insights
Collaboration with key stakeholders to gather requirements & understand business needs (Central, CS&I, marketing, Sales & key retailers, Data providers)

Develop Leading Business Intelligence Principles

Data partner for CS&I teams to support working through commercial challenges and opportunities
Data visualisation expert.
Create reports & dashboards through various tools, including but not limited to PowerBI & Excel that serve the business needs.
Interpret local & central systems, mapping data together to facilitate ‘One Perrigo’ source of truth across functions
Identify automation & process improvement opportunities, working with technical teams to implement solutions. Set up connections to underlying databases (e.g. SAP, Salesforce, IRI, Nielsen, IQVIA) & build data models that map sources together in a SQL Datawarehouse.

Build Capability & Enable Success

Optimise processes & tools for maximum efficiency and impact
Support local team in their transformation from Excel dependency to dynamic/visual dashboard capability, enabling more data-driven decision making. Provide local advice & coaching.
Lead deployment, training & adoption of deployed dashboards/reports, providing continuous improvement of user adoption & sophistication of insights
Proactive contributor across the CSCI Business Intelligence community contributing share & re apply
Key partner to the cluster, central and local CS&I community, working to build community capability




Experience Required

5 years+ experience of business analytics with data visualization building specific experience
Fluency in written and spoken English and German is essential
Preference for experience with IRI/Nielsen or other syndicated data sources
Preference for experience with sales force or alternative CRM system
Proven experience managing analytically rigorous corporate programs
Proven history of designing and building reports & dashboards in Microsoft Power BI, or other similar data visualisation tools




***Please send your CV in English***

Title: Data Analytics Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Title: Data Analytics Engineer (m/w/d)

Salary: €65,000 - €80,000 per annum

Sector: IT, Technology, Data Engineering




Jobzusammenfassung:

Data Analytics Engineer (m/w/d) – Remote (Deutsch C1 erforderlich)

Für ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Digital Services suchen wir einen erfahrenen Data Analytics Engineer (m/w/d), der in einem agilen, remote arbeitenden Team datengetriebene Lösungen für verschiedene Geschäftsbereiche entwickelt und die Digitalisierung vorantreibt.




Deine Aufgaben:

Entwicklung und Implementierung von Datenlösungen mit Fokus auf Azure Synapse, SQL (MySQL, MS SQL), DAC-Paketen sowie API-Implementierungen (REST, GraphQL)
Arbeit an der zentralen Datendrehscheibe, um alte Systeme mit neuen Eigenentwicklungen und cloudbasierten Services zu verknüpfen
Analyse von Geschäftsdaten und Entwicklung prädiktiver Modelle zur Unterstützung von datenbasierten Entscheidungen
Unterstützung bei der nachhaltigen Überführung von Softwaresystemen in den neuen .NET (C#) Tech-Stack
Identifizierung technischer Chancen und Risiken durch Einbringen eigener Erfahrungen
Erstellung von Tests und Dokumentationen (arc42) für entwickelte Funktionalitäten




Dein Profil:

3+ Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics und als Data Engineer
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Python, SQL, NoSQL, Data-Warehouse-Technologien, Statistik und Mathematik
Expertise in Azure Data Services und Power BI
Sichere Anwendung von Statistik- und Analysemethoden
Hohes Maß an Selbstständigkeit und die Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Systeme schnell zu verstehen
Analytische Fähigkeiten, um Risiken und Schwachstellen zu erkennen
Wertschätzung für Softwarequalität und kontinuierliche Reduzierung technischer Schulden
Zertifizierung als Azure Data Engineer oder Bereitschaft, diese zu erlangen
Wohnsitz in Deutschland oder Österreich




Nice to Haves:

Erfahrung mit weiteren Programmiersprachen wie C# und Java
Kenntnisse in Machine Learning oder Künstlicher Intelligenz




Wir bieten:

Attraktives Gehaltspaket mit Bonuszahlungen
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und 100 % Remote-Arbeit
Individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Moderne Arbeitsumgebung mit einer starken Fokussierung auf neue Technologien




Bewerbungsprozess:

Drei Runden: HR-Interview, Technische Challenge, Gespräch mit dem Entwicklerteam

Du möchtest Teil eines agilen Teams werden und die Digitalisierung aktiv mitgestalten? Dann bewirb dich jetzt!




Kontakt:

Ralph Biedermann Consultant | Data & AI | Permanent Solutions

Email: r.biedermann@zabelglobal.com

Phone: +49 170 653 91 01

Website: www.zabelglobal.com

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics (Attribution & Paid Search)
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value…)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Previous experience in marketing attribution and paid search.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.
Show more

The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will

  • Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
  • Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value…)
  • Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
  • Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
  • Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
  • Mentor others in the skills needed for this role

Who You Are

  • 5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
  • Previous experience in marketing attribution and paid search.
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
  • Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
  • Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
  • Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Nice to have

  • Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus

How We Set You Up For Success

  • Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
  • Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
  • Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
  • Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
  • Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies

And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Are you ready to change the market?

We are a product company developing a multi-national debt collection platform. Our company has experienced significant growth and we need to continue improving our infrastructure, processes and policies to form a reliable foundation for further growth.

To do this, we are looking for a Senior BI Analyst to join our team. In this role you will work with a dedicated BI squad, collaborate closely with a set of stakeholders, like heads of Collection, Finance, Partnerships, Operations departments.

Become a part of our strong and international team that is transforming the traditional debt collection industry with innovation and a drive for excellence.

What You Can Do With Us


be a key contributor to PAIR Finance’s growing BI landscape
collaborate with our departments to understand their business requirements and transform data into actionable insights
analyse PAIR Finance’s financial processes and derive data-driven solutions and KPIs, always taking the business context into consideration
design, develop, and maintain complex reports, dashboards, and visualizations using Power BI and Python
work with data engineers to integrate data from various sources into the data warehouse and ensure data integrity and quality
create on-demand analytic reports


What You Should Bring For It


4–6 years of working experience in Business Intelligence and/or Data Analysis, preferably in a startup
a passion for learning and improving your skills
good Power BI skills (Power Query / DAX)
ability to translate data into easy-to-understand business insights
proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation
strong Python skills to implement and support in-house analytics, automated reporting tools and ETL scripts (Python experience is a critical requirement)
self-motivated, thrive in a fast-paced, project-oriented environment and can meet deadlines under tight time constraints
strong in analytics, structured and data-driven
excellent communicator in English, German is a plus


Transparency, Execution, Ownership, Customer Centricity, Innovation and Integrity are important to us and we at PAIR Finance embody these values. Do you find yourself in these values? Then become part of our team and complement us with your individual motivation and character!

Our Offer For You


We offer visa sponsorship
Thriving, financially stable company
Strong experienced international team to support and mentor you along the way, smooth onboarding process
International team of 30+ nationalities with professionals and experts
Flat hierarchy, transparent and appreciative feedback culture, monthly all hands meetings, annual feedback and evaluation cycle, regular 1-on-1s with your lead
Well-structured onboarding process as well as supportive and welcoming colleagues
Personal learning & development budget as well as German and English language courses
Good salary for your strong performance
Unlimited employment contract, flexible working hours and 28 vacation days for your work-life balance
Company pension plan, partly covered Deutschlandticket (public transport) and access to “Corporate Benefits” voucher platform to ensure your full well-being
Fun company summer and Christmas parties as well as regular team events
This role is based in Berlin, and we have a hybrid working policy. Modern office near Zoologischer Garten is complete with fresh fruit, muesli and drinks for a comfortable and enjoyable workplace


Who is your contact person?

Your contact person for this position is Ekaterina Semenova . If you have any questions, please contact us directly by email (jobs@pairfinance.com). For more information about PAIR Finance, please take a look at our website and our careers page. We look forward to hearing from you!

About Us

We are rethinking debt collection with our digital debt collection solution, characterized by our high customer orientation and efficiency standards. By using artificial intelligence, we are combining technology with behavioral science and so we are able to contact customers individually and in a simple way throughout the entire collection process.

Strengthened by one of the most renowned private equity firms in the fintech sector, Pollen Street, as well as partnerships with other investors such as Zalando Payments and finleap, PAIR Finance offers an excellent opportunity to dive deep into and actively shape the fintech industry.

PAIR Finance is an equal-opportunity employer. We value a diverse team and an inclusive culture. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, or disability.

For more information about PAIR Finance, visit www.pairfinance.com/ and www.pairfinance.com/karriere/ and www.trustpilot.com/review/www.pairfinance.com

Do you want to find out more about PAIR Finance and the position? We are happy to answer your questions and also to receive your application!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Position : Data Engineer (Python & AWS Serverless) - Full-time | Potsdam




Location: Potsdam, Germany (Hybrid)




Salary: 70k-85k




About Us:




We specialize in cutting-edge technology development and consulting. We pride ourselves on delivering customized software solutions for complex systems, applying state-of-the-art approaches in data analysis, artificial intelligence, and modelling.

We are currently seeking a Data Engineer to join our growing team If you have a passion for software integration, enjoy working in a collaborative and dynamic environment, and want to contribute to innovative projects, we’d love to hear from you!




Your Role

Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines using Python and AWS services like Lambda, S3, and Glue.
Automate data processing and workflows, ensuring efficient, secure data systems.
Collaborate with teams to design data lakes, and warehouses (e.g., Redshift), and optimize data workflows.
Troubleshoot, monitor and improve the performance of data infrastructure.




Your Qualifications

Proficient in Python for data processing and automation.
Experience with AWS Serverless Stack (Lambda, S3, Glue, Kinesis).
Knowledge of ETL processes, data modelling, and databases.
Fluent in English; German is a plus.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices for automated deployment.

Show more

Location: Potsdam, Germany (Hybrid)


Salary: 70k-85k


About Us:


We specialize in cutting-edge technology development and consulting. We pride ourselves on delivering customized software solutions for complex systems, applying state-of-the-art approaches in data analysis, artificial intelligence, and modelling.

We are currently seeking a Data Engineer to join our growing team If you have a passion for software integration, enjoy working in a collaborative and dynamic environment, and want to contribute to innovative projects, we’d love to hear from you!


Your Role

  • Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines using Python and AWS services like Lambda, S3, and Glue.
  • Automate data processing and workflows, ensuring efficient, secure data systems.
  • Collaborate with teams to design data lakes, and warehouses (e.g., Redshift), and optimize data workflows.
  • Troubleshoot, monitor and improve the performance of data infrastructure.


Your Qualifications

  • Proficient in Python for data processing and automation.
  • Experience with AWS Serverless Stack (Lambda, S3, Glue, Kinesis).
  • Knowledge of ETL processes, data modelling, and databases.
  • Fluent in English; German is a plus.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices for automated deployment.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir sind ein globales und schnell wachsendes Specialty Pharmaunternehmen mit einem außergewöhnlichen, nachhaltigen Geschäftsmodell. Unsere Mission: DIE Plattform für etablierte und vertraute Markenprodukte diverser Therapiegebiete und Indikationen zu sein und deren Verfügbarkeit in höchster Qualität als wichtiger Partner der innovationsgetriebenen Pharmaindustrie für den Weltmarkt zu sichern!

Wir haben ein gemeinsames Ziel: Die Gesundheit und das Leben der Menschen zu verbessern. Deshalb denken wir nicht in Kategorien mit schnellen Effekten, sondern wollen mit unserem Tun und Handeln mehr bewirken – langfristig und verlässlich.

All das geht nur mit Menschen, die ihren Beruf nicht einfach nur ausüben, sondern selbst etwas erreichen wollen. Wir sind dabei so erfolgreich, weil wir unsere Kolleginnen und Kollegen entwickeln und fördern und ihnen die Freiräume und Flexibilität gewähren, die sie für ihre tägliche Arbeit benötigen. Wenn Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte sein wollen, freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!

Ihre Aufgaben


Sie unterstützen unsere Fachbereiche bei der Auswertung und der Interpretation von Daten
Sie erstellen aussagekräftige Power BI Reports, um komplexe Daten verständlicher und präsentierbar zu machen
Sie unterstützen bei der Konzeption und Weiterentwicklung unsere Daten Plattform auf Basis von Microsoft Fabric
Sie sind Ansprechpartner:in rund um analytische Fragestellungen für unsere Fachbereiche
Sie arbeiten eng mit unseren externen Dienstleistern zusammen und übernehmen Steuerungsaufgaben


Ihr Profil


Sie haben einen Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mathematik oder Betriebswirtschaft oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Sie haben bereits 3-5 Jahre Erfahrung im BI Umfeld und in der Nutzung von Power BI
Sie bringen fundierte Kenntnisse im Bereich multidimensionaler und tabular Datenmodellen auf Basis des Star Schema Konzeptes mit
Sie sind versiert im Umgang mit SQL und DAX
Erfahrung in der Administration / Management des Power BI Service runden Ihr Profil ab
Sie kommunizieren sicher in der deutschen und englischen Sprache


Unser Angebot


Agilität sowie deutliches und kontinuierliches Unternehmenswachstum
Direkte und offene Unternehmenskultur
Interne und externe Fortbildungen
Firmenevents
Mehr Flexibilität: Ortsunabhängige Arbeitsmodelle mit definierten Präsenztagen möglich


Bitte nutzen Sie für Ihre Bewerbung ausschließlich die "Jetzt bewerben!" Funktion.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Company: IU International University of Applied Sciences
Description:
Join us on the mission of democratising education and playing a key role in advancing the education journey for more than 2¹⁷ learners around the globe.

We are currently looking for a Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d) to join our platform analytics team.

This position is available as a full-time role at our IU office locations or remotely (must reside in Germany or the UK).

Your tasks


Be a core member of the Lecturing > Course Coordination team where you will be analysing vast staffing > recruiting demand data.
You will identify relevant information for our business and communicate the generated insights including interpretation to various stakeholders. In doing so, you ensure that practical recommendations for action are derived from the data collected.
You create automated reporting solutions - primarily working with SQL and visualizing your analyses in PowerBI.
You maintain our existing reporting landscape and continuously develop it.
You monitor the relevant KPIs of the department and you act as a sparring partner for our stakeholders.
You handle these tasks as part of an agile remote team in a dynamic corporate environment.
You mentor other analysts within the team in effectively utilizing Python for advanced data analysis.
You utilize your expertise in advanced analytics to evolve the traditional reporting and analytics processes, thereby contributing significantly to the methodological growth of the business.


Your Profile


Several years of experience in Business Intelligence, Analytics and Data Analytics.
Advanced knowledge in Excel, SQL and Python/R programming with a keen interest for further development.
Experience working with large datasets and Power BI.
Strong business sense, analytical abilities, and a goal-oriented approach to analyses and optimization measures.
Proficient in stakeholder management, able to effectively communicate data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Appreciation for fast, efficient processes in an agile environment.
Excellent communication skills in English > German (minimum B2) to collaborate with various stakeholders.


What We Offer


Design your ideal career and pathway: Explosive growth enables great opportunities. Tell us your dream career, and we will help you make it a reality.
Work from home, work from anywhere: We blur the lines between local and remote by embracing collaborative > video meeting technologies. Working from abroad for a while sounds good to you? No problem thanks to our WorkFlex benefit.
Flexible working times: It’s your call. We trust you will get things done.
Up level your education: Enjoy free up-skilling courses, language courses > discounted degree courses. There is always something new to learn!
Get a good rest: We push ourselves every day to go above and beyond. But we also take the time to recharge our batteries: with 30 days of annual vacation for all employees. Need some time off? How about a sabbatical?
Fruit baskets are yesterday, today we go for benefits that really count! Whether it's a job bike, employee discounts, company pension plan or net wage optimization: we're constantly working to get the most out of it for you.


Be part of our Lecturer > Course Coordination Team! Our team is focusing on efficient resource planning whilst securing the on-time staffing of all IUG-wide courses.

You find yourself in this profile and are looking for a new challenge? Then apply online now via our career portal.

If you have any further questions, please feel free to contact Rebecca (rebecca.moore@iu.org)

Please only apply via the application tool, no applications via email will be accepted.

You can find more information at www.iu.org.

Words are followed by deeds: We take our "Culture Of Everyone" very seriously and would like to point out once again that you are welcome to join us, regardless of your origin, religion, gender, age or sexual orientation. Even if you have a disability, our doors are open to you. We look forward to a diverse coexistence here at the IU!

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Jobbeschreibung

Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d)

ÜBER UNS

Bei Oetker Digital begleiten wir Unternehmen der Oetker-Gruppe auf ihrem Weg in die digitale Zukunft. In enger Zusammenarbeit definieren wir, was digitale Unternehmenstransformation für jedes einzelne Unternehmen bedeutet. Unser Ziel ist es, mithilfe von Daten, Technologie und Talenten messbaren Geschäftswert und Wirkung zu schaffen und so den Weg in eine digitale Zukunft zu ebnen. Wir unterstützen viele beliebte Marken wie Dr. Oetker, Radeberger und Coppenrath & Wiese.

Mit unserem Team von rund 100 talentierten Mitarbeiter:innen und diversen Teams in unserem Berliner Hauptquartier pflegen wir eine offene und positive Lernkultur.

DIE ROLLE

Als Senior Data Analyst bei Oetker Digital übernimmst du eine zentrale Rolle bei datenbasierten Entscheidungen und der Strategieentwicklung. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit Teams und Geschäftspartnern unserer Gruppenunternehmen tauchst du tief in die Geschäftsbereiche und -prozesse ein. Mit deinem Know-how stellst du dabei die richtigen Fragen, analysierst Datensätze, gewinnst wertvolle Erkenntnisse und erstellst auf der Basis unserer Daten Modelle. So unterstützt du unsere Marken maßgeblich bei ihrem Wachstum und Erfolg im digitalen Zeitalter.

DEINE AUFGABEN


Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Business Stakeholder der Oetker Gruppe, um deren Strategien, Bedürfnisse und Ziele zu verstehen
Aufbau und Pflege enger Beziehungen zu wichtigen Geschäftspartnern, um sicherzustellen, dass die Datenlösungen mit den Geschäftszielen übereinstimmen
Als Berater fungieren und durch gezielte Fragen tiefe Einblicke in die Geschäftsbereiche und -prozesse gewinnen
Analysieren von Datensätzen, um verwertbare Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen und datenbasierte Entscheidungsfindung zu unterstützen
Entwicklung und Implementierung statistischer Modelle zur Lösung komplexer Geschäftsprobleme
Kommunikation von Erkenntnissen in überzeugender und verständlicher Form zur Unterstützung datenbasierter Entscheidungsfindung
Übersetzen komplexer Daten in klare, umsetzbare Erkenntnisse z.B. durch Data Storytelling


Stellenanforderungen

WAS DU MITBRINGST


Mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse oder Beratung, vorzugsweise in einem geschäftlichen Kontext, vorzugsweise im Consulting
Bachelor- oder Master-Abschluss in einem verwandten Fachgebiet (z. B. Wirtschaft, Statistik, Mathematik, Informatik)
Kenntnisse in SQL und/oder Python zur Datenanalyse und -modellierung
Erfahrungen mit Cloud-Plattformen zur Datenspeicherung und -verarbeitung, Erfahrungen mit BigQuery sind von Vorteil
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung und Software wie Power BI oder Tableau
Eine proaktive und kollaborative Denkweise zusammen mit der Fähigkeit, effektiv in funktionsübergreifenden Teams zu arbeiten
Ausgezeichnete analytische Fähigkeiten und Problemlösungskompetenz verbunden mit Erfahrungen, komplexe Ideen klar zu kommunizieren
Du lernst gerne, arbeitest praxisorientiert, übernimmst Verantwortung und willst etwas verändern
Fließende Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch


WAS** **WIR BIETEN


Modernes und hundefreundliches Büro im Herzen Berlins
Hybrides Arbeitsmodell mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten für eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance
Wir arbeiten in funktionsübergreifenden und internationalen Teams und veranstalten regelmäßig Firmen- und Teamevents
28 Tage bezahlter Urlaub, plus Weihnachten und Silvester, sowie die Möglichkeit, zusätzlichen unbezahlten Urlaub zu nehmen
10 bezahlte Krankheitstage für Kinder pro Jahr
Jährliches Lern- und Entwicklungsbudget für den Kauf von Bildungsressourcen von bis zu 1.500 €
Ausrüstung nach deiner Wahl: Macbook oder Lenovo, sowie weitere Geräte für die Einrichtung im Home-Office
Bezuschusste Mitgliedschaft im Urban Sports Club oder BVG Deutschland Ticket
Unterstützung beim mentalen Wohlbefinden, einschließlich Einzelsitzungen, durch unseren Partner Likeminded
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge und persönliche Unfallversicherung
Unternehmensrabatte bei einer Vielzahl von externen Partnern
Show more
HTML:
Jobbeschreibung

Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d)

ÜBER UNS

Bei Oetker Digital begleiten wir Unternehmen der Oetker-Gruppe auf ihrem Weg in die digitale Zukunft. In enger Zusammenarbeit definieren wir, was digitale Unternehmenstransformation für jedes einzelne Unternehmen bedeutet. Unser Ziel ist es, mithilfe von Daten, Technologie und Talenten messbaren Geschäftswert und Wirkung zu schaffen und so den Weg in eine digitale Zukunft zu ebnen. Wir unterstützen viele beliebte Marken wie Dr. Oetker, Radeberger und Coppenrath & Wiese.

Mit unserem Team von rund 100 talentierten Mitarbeiter:innen und diversen Teams in unserem Berliner Hauptquartier pflegen wir eine offene und positive Lernkultur.

DIE ROLLE

Als Senior Data Analyst bei Oetker Digital übernimmst du eine zentrale Rolle bei datenbasierten Entscheidungen und der Strategieentwicklung. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit Teams und Geschäftspartnern unserer Gruppenunternehmen tauchst du tief in die Geschäftsbereiche und -prozesse ein. Mit deinem Know-how stellst du dabei die richtigen Fragen, analysierst Datensätze, gewinnst wertvolle Erkenntnisse und erstellst auf der Basis unserer Daten Modelle. So unterstützt du unsere Marken maßgeblich bei ihrem Wachstum und Erfolg im digitalen Zeitalter.

DEINE AUFGABEN

  • Analysieren von Datensätzen, um verwertbare Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen und datenbasierte Entscheidungsfindung zu unterstützen
  • Entwicklung und Implementierung statistischer Modelle zur Lösung komplexer Geschäftsprobleme
  • Kommunikation von Erkenntnissen in überzeugender und verständlicher Form zur Unterstützung datenbasierter Entscheidungsfindung
  • Übersetzen komplexer Daten in klare, umsetzbare Erkenntnisse z.B. durch Data Storytelling

Stellenanforderungen

WAS DU MITBRINGST

  • Mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse oder Beratung, vorzugsweise in einem geschäftlichen Kontext, vorzugsweise im Consulting
  • Bachelor- oder Master-Abschluss in einem verwandten Fachgebiet (z. B. Wirtschaft, Statistik, Mathematik, Informatik)
  • Kenntnisse in SQL und/oder Python zur Datenanalyse und -modellierung
  • Erfahrungen mit Cloud-Plattformen zur Datenspeicherung und -verarbeitung, Erfahrungen mit BigQuery sind von Vorteil
  • Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung und Software wie Power BI oder Tableau
  • Eine proaktive und kollaborative Denkweise zusammen mit der Fähigkeit, effektiv in funktionsübergreifenden Teams zu arbeiten
  • Ausgezeichnete analytische Fähigkeiten und Problemlösungskompetenz verbunden mit Erfahrungen, komplexe Ideen klar zu kommunizieren
  • Du lernst gerne, arbeitest praxisorientiert, übernimmst Verantwortung und willst etwas verändern

WAS** **WIR BIETEN

  • Bezuschusste Mitgliedschaft im Urban Sports Club oder BVG Deutschland Ticket

Title: Senior People Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Senior HR Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders) to join the People Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

About the People Analytics team:


Data Infrastructure & Architecture: We design and maintain the data warehouse (AWS or BigQuery), integrating new systems to enhance our analytic capabilities while ensuring data privacy compliance.
Reporting and Visualization: Define and standardize People KPIs across local teams, and deliver automated reporting solutions via Tableau or other BI tools for effective data visualization.
Advanced Analytics & Data Science: Discover and communicate meaningful patterns in people data, using analytics and data science models to provide actionable insights.
Purpose and Mission: Enable senior leaders to make data-driven decisions, enhance employee experience, and improve business performance through comprehensive data analysis.
Long-term Goals: Aim for global reporting of key metrics with high accuracy, simplify complex HR and business challenges, and integrate data insights into daily decision-making.
Collaborative Approach: Work closely with local People Analytics teams to align metrics and reporting standards, ensuring a unified approach to data management.
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with People Analytics teams, CHROs, P&C leaders, People Partners, and Senior Leaders for strategic decision-making based on reliable data.
Value Addition: Harmonize data across global teams, creating a single source of truth for reliable and consistent leadership decisions.


About the role:


Data Warehouse Management: Design, build, and maintain the architecture and infrastructure of our data warehouse, ensuring system integration and data compliance.
KPI Standardization: Define and align People KPIs across local teams, and implement automated reporting solutions for streamlined data visualization and analysis.
Analytics and Insights: Use advanced analytics to uncover meaningful patterns in people data, and develop data science models that provide actionable insights.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Gather requirements from CHROs and other stakeholders, translate these into actionable plans, and serve as the primary contact for people data.
Global Reporting: Collaborate with local teams for global reporting of key metrics, ensuring a unified and reliable data source for strategic decisions.
Training and Adoption: Provide training and support to drive the adoption of new BI tools and reporting practices, enhancing overall data literacy and user experience.


What you need to be successful


Background working in similar People/HR data-driven role (3+ years of experience, a must)
Advanced SQL and knowledge about data pipelines
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science or other technical fields
Proven, direct experience with Tableau and demonstrate storytelling capabilities
Data visualization artist, able to create new and engaging ways of visualizing People data


Nice to have:


Worked in cross functional teams and can manage senior stakeholders
Fundamental understanding of statistics and basic principles of data analysis


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Online Canteen, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Are you ready to change the market?

We are a product company developing a multi-national debt collection platform. Our company has experienced significant growth and we need to continue improving our infrastructure, processes and policies to form a reliable foundation for further growth.

To do this, we are looking for a Senior BI Analyst to join our team. In this role you will work with a dedicated BI squad, collaborate closely with a set of stakeholders, like heads of Collection, Finance, Partnerships, Operations departments.

Become a part of our strong and international team that is transforming the traditional debt collection industry with innovation and a drive for excellence.

What You Can Do With Us


be a key contributor to PAIR Finance’s growing BI landscape
collaborate with our departments to understand their business requirements and transform data into actionable insights
analyse PAIR Finance’s financial processes and derive data-driven solutions and KPIs, always taking the business context into consideration
design, develop, and maintain complex reports, dashboards, and visualizations using Power BI and Python
work with data engineers to integrate data from various sources into the data warehouse and ensure data integrity and quality
create on-demand analytic reports


What You Should Bring For It


4–6 years of working experience in Business Intelligence and/or Data Analysis, preferably in a startup
a passion for learning and improving your skills
good Power BI skills (Power Query / DAX)
ability to translate data into easy-to-understand business insights
proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation
strong Python skills to implement and support in-house analytics, automated reporting tools and ETL scripts (Python experience is a critical requirement)
self-motivated, thrive in a fast-paced, project-oriented environment and can meet deadlines under tight time constraints
strong in analytics, structured and data-driven
excellent communicator in English, German is a plus


Transparency, Execution, Ownership, Customer Centricity, Innovation and Integrity are important to us and we at PAIR Finance embody these values. Do you find yourself in these values? Then become part of our team and complement us with your individual motivation and character!

Our Offer For You


We offer visa sponsorship
Thriving, financially stable company
Strong experienced international team to support and mentor you along the way, smooth onboarding process
International team of 30+ nationalities with professionals and experts
Flat hierarchy, transparent and appreciative feedback culture, monthly all hands meetings, annual feedback and evaluation cycle, regular 1-on-1s with your lead
Well-structured onboarding process as well as supportive and welcoming colleagues
Personal learning & development budget as well as German and English language courses
Good salary for your strong performance
Unlimited employment contract, flexible working hours and 28 vacation days for your work-life balance
Company pension plan, partly covered Deutschlandticket (public transport) and access to “Corporate Benefits” voucher platform to ensure your full well-being
Fun company summer and Christmas parties as well as regular team events
This role is based in Berlin, and we have a hybrid working policy. Modern office near Zoologischer Garten is complete with fresh fruit, muesli and drinks for a comfortable and enjoyable workplace


Who is your contact person?

Your contact person for this position is Ekaterina Semenova . If you have any questions, please contact us directly by email (jobs@pairfinance.com). For more information about PAIR Finance, please take a look at our website and our careers page. We look forward to hearing from you!

About Us

We are rethinking debt collection with our digital debt collection solution, characterized by our high customer orientation and efficiency standards. By using artificial intelligence, we are combining technology with behavioral science and so we are able to contact customers individually and in a simple way throughout the entire collection process.

Strengthened by one of the most renowned private equity firms in the fintech sector, Pollen Street, as well as partnerships with other investors such as Zalando Payments and finleap, PAIR Finance offers an excellent opportunity to dive deep into and actively shape the fintech industry.

PAIR Finance is an equal-opportunity employer. We value a diverse team and an inclusive culture. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, or disability.

For more information about PAIR Finance, visit www.pairfinance.com/ and www.pairfinance.com/karriere/ and www.trustpilot.com/review/www.pairfinance.com

Do you want to find out more about PAIR Finance and the position? We are happy to answer your questions and also to receive your application!
Show more

Title: Lead Data Analyst (d/f/m) Salesforce
Description:
Benefits:


Opportunity to use top-notch technology within the ad-tech industry.
3 months onboarding program to get to know the other starters and all the departments.
Mentor program to ensure your further development within the company.
International teams with a strong focus on innovation, feedback and fun.
Hybrid workplace policy: Come to the brand new office in the heart of Berlin or work from home.
EU workation program: Join your colleagues to work in one of their coworking venues in Spain or Croatia.
Monthly lunch club and quarterly after work events.
German and English language classes with teachers onsite in Berlin and Spain as well as tandem language learning program.
30 days vacation.
Health insurance package.
Urban Sports Club membership or Lunch vouchers.
BVG transportation ticket.


Responsibilities:


You help the team to understand the connection between their analytics and the business context.
As an expert in data analytics, you challenge existing practices and identify areas for improvement.
You are responsible for monthly and quarterly reporting, supporting sales and other marketing stakeholders for their strategic decisions.
You improve reports and dashboards to track KPIs related to market performance and campaign effectiveness.
You define and extract valuable insights from complex marketing datasets and hold presentations about it.


Your profile:


Minimum of 5 years work experience in data analytics.
Minimum of 2 years of work experience in a role that holds presentations about key findings in data analytics.
Have been involved in strategic decision making.
Experienced with visualization tools.
Proficient in Excel.
Proficient with extracting data from & data analytics with Salesforce.
Experience with A/B testing, marketing budget optimization, user acquisition, conversion/purchase prediction, recommendation system, marketing mix modelling (MMM), attribution, bidding automation, lift tests, or geo tests.


Please send your CV to Nathalie; if you have any questions feel free to call/Whatsapp/Signal/Telegram/SMS: +4915733914408.
