  • You define and extract valuable insights from complex marketing datasets and hold presentations about it.

Your profile:

  • Minimum of 5 years work experience in data analytics.
  • Minimum of 2 years of work experience in a role that holds presentations about key findings in data analytics.
  • Have been involved in strategic decision making.
  • Experienced with visualization tools.
  • Proficient in Excel.
  • Proficient with extracting data from & data analytics with Salesforce.
  • Experience with A/B testing, marketing budget optimization, user acquisition, conversion/purchase prediction, recommendation system, marketing mix modelling (MMM), attribution, bidding automation, lift tests, or geo tests.

Please send your CV to Nathalie; if you have any questions feel free to call/Whatsapp/Signal/Telegram/SMS: +4915733914408.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Role

My client are seeking a talented Data Engineer to join their growing team. You will play a key role in designing, building, and maintaining our data pipelines and infrastructure. This role requires a strong understanding of PostgreSQL databases and experience working with cloud platforms.




Responsibilities

Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for ingesting, transforming, and loading data from various sources into our data warehouse.

Optimize PostgreSQL databases for performance and scalability.

Develop and maintain SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Work with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) to provision and manage data storage, compute resources, and containerized applications.

Write code in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) to automate data engineering tasks.

Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and software engineers to ensure data quality and accessibility.

Document data pipelines, schemas, and procedures.

Stay up-to-date on the latest data engineering and cloud technologies.




Qualifications

Strong expertise in PostgreSQL, including database design, administration, performance tuning, and security.

Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Experience with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) for data storage, compute resources, and services (e.g., S3, DynamoDB, Redshift, Aurora, Athena).

Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash).

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Ability to manage complex projects and interact effectively with other teams.




Bonus Points

Interest in working on providing solutions to environmental sustainability.

Experience with database change management systems like Liquibase, Flyway etc

Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Kafka).

Experience with data warehousing concepts (e.g., dimensional modelling, slowly changing dimensions etc).

Certifications in cloud platforms or data engineering tools (e.g., AWS Certified Data Engineer).

Title: Analytical Consultant (Fixed-Term Contract)
Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Hamburg, Germany; Berlin, Germany; Frankfurt, Germany; Munich, Germany.Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in media analytics, advertising sales, digital media and marketing, consulting, or financial analysis.
Experience in data analysis and visualization (e.g. Google Sheets and Slides), scripting (e.g. SQL) and dashboard development (e.g. Looker Studio).
Experience in translating data into business recommendations, creating and delivering insights-based presentations or business cases with recommendations and aligned with customers goals.


Preferred qualifications:


Experience working as an Analytical Consultant or in similar analytical, data-focused roles.
Experience in advertising from either the advertiser, agency, or other media owner side.
Experience working closely with multiple stakeholder and cross-functional teams and influence key stakeholders (internally and externally) across all levels.
Ability to communicate in English and German fluently as this is a customer-facing role that requires interactions in German with local stakeholders.


About The Job

Being an Analyst at Google is about much more than simply crunching numbers – it’s about finding compelling insights within data and using your exceptional business and communication skills to translate those insights into action. As one of the masterminds behind our strategic planning, forecasting and analysis, you’ll spend your time digging into big, complex data sets. The data will not remain inert in your hands, however, since you’ll use your critical thinking, problem solving and communication skills to influence and drive thoughtful and well-informed decision making with our most senior business leaders within the organization, and potentially some of our biggest clients.

This Fixed-Term Contract is effective from December 2024 through September 2026, with the position located in Germany.

Digital First, a sector within Germany Large Customer Sales (LCS), is home to a variety of customers, from Travel to Media and Entertainment and many digital players. Our mission is to drive the success and sustainable growth of our Digital First customers through innovation, diversity, and a customer-first mindset.

The Insights and Analytics team within Digital First empowers our customers in achieving their business and marketing goals by providing them with data-driven bases for decision-making. The team uses business acumen combined with analytical and storytelling skills to partner closely with a variety of internal and external stakeholders and support the transformation and shifts required to be successful in an ever changing market environment. The team leverages Google's internal search data and external market data, to uncover actionable insights, driving informed decision-making and fostering mutual growth for our customers and Google.

Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities


Conduct comprehensive bespoke analyses for our high-priority customers to uncover hidden opportunities to optimize their online advertising ROI.
Consult with clients as a strategic consultant, clearly presenting data-driven insights and recommendations that align with their business goals.
Streamline processes by developing scalable templates, dashboards and scripts (together with gCare Insights). Develop compelling narratives to deliver insights at scale for a wider customer base.
Empower clients and partners by creating internal dashboards and reports to democratize insights and by delivering training and guidance on using Google's data tools and APIs.
Work seamlessly with diverse teams and stakeholders to drive successful outcomes for clients (e.g. measurement specialists).



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics (Attribution & Paid Search)
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value…)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Previous experience in marketing attribution and paid search.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.
Show more

Title: Lead Analytics Analyst (f/m/x) - Data Analyst in AFC M&S Global Platform
Description:
Position Overview

Die Deutsche Bank (DB) kann auf eine sehr erfahrene und engagierte Abteilung für die Bekämpfung von Finanzkriminalität (Anti Financial Crime, AFC) zurückgreifen. Diese spielt eine entscheidende Rolle dabei, der Finanzkriminalität bei Geschäftsaktivitäten und globalen Finanzdienstleistungen der DB vorzubeugen und gleichzeitig die Interessen der Bank und der Gesellschaft zu wahren.

Um Finanzkriminalität wirksam zu bekämpfen und flexibel auf Herausforderungen zu reagieren, hat AFC eine Matrixstruktur, die regionale, geschäftsbereichsbezogene und globale Funktionen vereint. Sie teilt sich in die folgenden Kernbereiche auf: Anti-Money Laundering, Sanctions & Embargoes, Anti-Fraud, Bribery & Corruption, Investigations & Intelligence, Monitoring & Screening und Risk Assessment. Teil unseres Engagements ist es, eine enge Zusammenarbeit mit allen Geschäftsbereichen und Unterstützungsfunktionen innerhalb unserer Bank zu stärken.

Was AFC für Sie tun wird

AFC hilft der Deutschen Bank, langfristig Vertrauen und Mehrwert für unsere Kunden, Mitarbeiter*innen und die Gesellschaft zu schaffen. Dabei wenden wir die höchsten Verhaltensstandards an, um den Erfolg der DB bei der Bekämpfung der Finanzkriminalität zu gewährleisten. Wir bieten Ihnen herausfordernde Möglichkeiten, zu lernen, einen Beitrag zu leisten und von Ihrer Reise mit uns zu profitieren. Wir fördern eine offene und integrative Teamkultur mit dem Ziel, eine gesunde, engagierte und gut unterstützte vielfältige Belegschaft aufzubauen und zu erhalten, die in der Lage ist, ihr Bestes zu geben.

Teambeschreibung und Rollendetails

Anti-Financial Crime

Das Management von Risiken im Zusammenhang mit Finanzkriminalität und die Implementierung gültiger und wirksamer Kontrollen, Prozesse und Sicherheitsmaßnahmen haben für die Deutsche Bank höchste Priorität. AFC Monitoring & Screening Global Plattform (GP) ist verantwortlich für die Implementierung der strategischen Transaktionsüberwachungsplattform und die Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden Transaktionsüberwachungs- und Namenslisten-Screening-Systeme. Daten sind die Grundlage für umfassende Kontrollen und ein Schlüsselbereich für die Identifizierung von Risiken im Zusammenhang mit Finanzkriminalität.

Ihre Hauptverantwortlichkeiten

Innerhalb von AFCs GP konzentriert sich die „Intelligence Layer“ Funktion auf die Anwendung erweiterter Analyse Funktionen mit Bezug auf die verwendeten Daten. In dieser Funktion analysieren Sie Daten, und entwickeln daraus Erkenntnisse und Empfehlungen. Sie arbeiten eng mit funktionsübergreifenden Teams zusammen, um Geschäftsanforderungen mit analytischem Fachwissen zu unterstützen. Sie arbeiten mit weiteren Analysten, Dateningenieuren und Wissenschaftlern zusammen, um qualitativ hochwertige Ergebnisse durch die Anwendung fortschrittlicher Analysemethoden auf unsere Daten zu ermöglichen.

Für diese Rolle verfügen Sie über fundierte Erfahrungen in den Bereichen:


Analyse und Zusammensetzung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, um Trends und Muster zu identifizieren
Umsetzung von Geschäftsanforderungen und Risikodefinitionen in anwendbare Analyseaktivitäten und Entwicklung von Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen zur Unterstützung von Anforderungen im Bereich Anti-Financial Crime
Transformation von Daten in verwendbare Formate und standardisierte Protokolle
Fähigkeit, ein ganzheitliches Verständnis der bestehenden Daten und Datenquellen der Bank aufzubauen
Entwicklung von Modellen und Datenvisualisierung
der Zusammenarbeit mit Architekten, Infrastrukturexperten und Dateningenieuren in einem internationalen Umfeld für die Datenanalyse



Ihre Kompetenzen und Erfahrungen


Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder vergleichbare Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen
Erfahrung mit Datenverarbeitungs- und Integrationspipelines in einem Big Data/ETL-Kontext unter Verwendung von GCP, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Shell-Scripting, Testframeworks oder anderen Komponenten aus dem Ökosystem
Sie haben mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Entwicklung mit Python, oder ähnlichen Programmiersprachen mit Fokus auf Big Data und ein fundiertes Verständnis für Data Analytics und statistische Methoden
Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Finanzkriminalität und Banken mit deren Transaktionsprozessen
Sie sind ein Teamplayer und verfügen über eine hohe persönliche Integrität mit sehr guten Englischkenntnissen in Wort und Schrift, Deutsch wünschenswert



Die Stelle wird in Voll- und in Teilzeit angeboten

Was wir Ihnen bieten:

Wir bieten eine breite Palette von Leistungen, die all Ihre beruflichen und persönlichen Bedürfnisse abdecken.


Emotional ausgeglichen Eine positive Haltung hilft uns, die Herausforderungen des Alltags zu meistern – beruflich wie privat. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Beratung in schwierigen Lebenssituationen und Angeboten zur Förderung mentaler Gesundheit.
Körperlich fit Mit Angeboten zur Aufrechterhaltung Ihrer persönlichen Gesundheit und einem förderlichen beruflichen Umfeld hilft Ihnen die Bank, körperlich fit zu bleiben. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie umfangreichen Check-up Untersuchungen, Impfangeboten und Beratung zur gesunden Lebensführung.
Sozial vernetzt Der Austausch mit anderen eröffnet uns neue Perspektiven, bringt uns beruflich wie persönlich voran und stärkt unser Selbstvertrauen und Wohlbefinden. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Unterstützung durch den pme Familienservice, das FitnessCenter Job, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle (bspw. Teilzeit, Jobtandem, hybrides Arbeiten) sowie einer umfangreichen Kultur der Vielfalt, Chancengleichheit und Teilhabe.
Finanziell abgesichert Die Bank sichert Sie nicht nur während Ihrer aktiven Karriere, sondern auch für die Zukunft finanziell ab und unterstützt Ihre Flexibilität sowie Mobilität – egal ob privat oder beruflich. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Beitragsplänen für Altersvorsorge, Bankdienstleistungen für Mitarbeiter*innen, Firmenfahrrad oder dem Deutschlandticket.



Da die Benefits je nach Standort geringfügig variieren, gehen Sie bitte bei konkreten Fragen auf Ihren Recruiter zu.

Die Stelle wird in Voll- und in Teilzeit angeboten.

Bei Fragen zum Rekrutierungsprozess steht Nana Darko gerne zur Verfügung.

Kontakt: Nana Darko (+49(0)175- 6705312 )

Deutsche Bank (DB) benefits from having a highly experienced and dedicated Anti Financial Crime (AFC) function, which performs a crucial role in keeping DBs business operations and global financial services clean from financial crime while serving the interests of the bank and society.

In order to combat financial crime effectively and respond to challenges in a flexible manner, AFC has a matrix structure combining regional, business line and global functional coverage in our core areas of Anti-Money Laundering, Sanctions & Embargoes, Anti-Fraud, Bribery & Corruption, Investigations & Intelligence, Monitoring & Screening, and Risk Assessment. Part of our commitment is to strengthen a strong collaboration with all business lines and support functions within our bank.

What AFC Will Do For You

AFC helps Deutsche Bank generate long-term trust and add value for our clients, staff and society and provide challenging opportunities for you to learn, contribute and benefit from your journey with us. We foster an open and inclusive team culture with the aim to build and maintain a healthy, engaged and well-supported diverse workforce that is equipped to do their best and enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace, whilst applying the highest standards of conduct to guarantee DB´s success in fighting financial crime.

Team- And Role Description

Anti-Financial Crime

The management of financial crime related risks and the implementation of valid and effective controls, processes and security measures has highest priority for Deutsche Bank. AFC Monitoring & Screening Global Platform (GP) is responsible for the implementation of the strategic Transaction Monitoring platform and the further development of the existing Transaction Monitoring and Name List Screening systems. Data is the basis for comprehensive controls and a key area for the identification of financial crime related risk.

Your Main Responsibilities

Within AFCs GP the “Intelligence Layer” has a focus on the application of advanced analytics to the consumed data. As Data Analyst you will be analyzing data and developing insights and recommendations. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to support business requirements with analytical expertise. Collaboration with analysts, data engineers and scientists to enable quality results from the application of advanced analytics methods to our data.

For this role you should have profound experience in the areas of:


collection and analysis of data from various sources to identify trends and patterns
translation of business requirements and risk definitions into actionable analytics activities and developing insights and recommendations to drive business requirements
organizing data into usable formats and standardized protocols
ability to build a broad understanding of the bank's existing data, and data sources
development of models and data visualization
cooperation with architects, infrastructure experts and data engineers on an international framework for data analysis and enrichment



Your Competencies And Experience


You have a degree in computer science, mathematics, physics or comparable qualifications and experience
Experience with data processing and integration pipelines in a big data/ETL context, using Hadoop, Apache Spark, GCP, shell scripting, test frameworks, or other components from the ecosystem
You have at least 3 years of working experience in Python, or similar programming languages with a focus on big data and a sound understanding for data analytics and statistical methods
Experience in the areas of financial crime and banking with their transaction processes
You are a team player and have as well a high level of personal integrity with excellent oral and written English skills, German desirable



This job is available in full and parttime.

What we offer:

We provide you with a comprehensive portfolio of benefits and offerings to support both, your private and professional needs.


Emotionally and mentally balanced A positive mind helps us master the challenges of everyday life – both professionally and privately. We offer consultation in difficult life situations as well as mental health awareness trainings.
Physically thriving We support you in staying physically fit through an offering to maintain personal health and a professional environment. You can benefit from health check-ups; vaccination drives as well as advice on healthy living and nutrition.
Socially connected Networking opens up new perspectives, helps us thrive professionally and personally as well as strengthens our self-confidence and well-being. You can benefit from PME family service, FitnessCenter Job, flexible working (e.g parttime, hybrid working, job tandem) as well as an extensive culture of diversity, equity and inclusion.
Financially secure We provide you with financial security not only during your active career but also for the future. You can benefit from offerings such as pension plans, banking services, company bicycle or “Deutschlandticket”.



Since our offerings slightly vary across locations, please contact your recruiter with specific questions.

In case of any recruitment related questions, please get in touch with Nana Darko.

Contact: Nana Darko (+49(0)175- 6705312 )

Wir streben eine Unternehmenskultur an, in der wir gemeinsam jeden Tag das Beste geben. Dazu gehören verantwortungsvolles Handeln, wirtschaftliches Denken, Initiative ergreifen und zielgerichtete Zusammenarbeit.

Gemeinsam teilen und feiern wir die Erfolge unserer Mitarbeiter*innen. Gemeinsam sind wir die Deutsche Bank Gruppe.

Wir begrüßen Bewerbungen von allen Menschen und fördern ein positives, faires und integratives Arbeitsumfeld.

Die Deutsche Bank (DB) kann auf eine sehr erfahrene und engagierte Abteilung für die Bekämpfung von Finanzkriminalität (Anti Financial Crime, AFC) zurückgreifen. Diese spielt eine entscheidende Rolle dabei, der Finanzkriminalität bei Geschäftsaktivitäten und globalen Finanzdienstleistungen der DB vorzubeugen und gleichzeitig die Interessen der Bank und der Gesellschaft zu wahren.

Um Finanzkriminalität wirksam zu bekämpfen und flexibel auf Herausforderungen zu reagieren, hat AFC eine Matrixstruktur, die regionale, geschäftsbereichsbezogene und globale Funktionen vereint. Sie teilt sich in die folgenden Kernbereiche auf: Anti-Money Laundering, Sanctions & Embargoes, Anti-Fraud, Bribery & Corruption, Investigations & Intelligence, Monitoring & Screening und Risk Assessment. Teil unseres Engagements ist es, eine enge Zusammenarbeit mit allen Geschäftsbereichen und Unterstützungsfunktionen innerhalb unserer Bank zu stärken.

Was AFC für Sie tun wird

AFC hilft der Deutschen Bank, langfristig Vertrauen und Mehrwert für unsere Kunden, Mitarbeiter*innen und die Gesellschaft zu schaffen. Dabei wenden wir die höchsten Verhaltensstandards an, um den Erfolg der DB bei der Bekämpfung der Finanzkriminalität zu gewährleisten. Wir bieten Ihnen herausfordernde Möglichkeiten, zu lernen, einen Beitrag zu leisten und von Ihrer Reise mit uns zu profitieren. Wir fördern eine offene und integrative Teamkultur mit dem Ziel, eine gesunde, engagierte und gut unterstützte vielfältige Belegschaft aufzubauen und zu erhalten, die in der Lage ist, ihr Bestes zu geben.

Teambeschreibung und Rollendetails

Anti-Financial Crime

Das Management von Risiken im Zusammenhang mit Finanzkriminalität und die Implementierung gültiger und wirksamer Kontrollen, Prozesse und Sicherheitsmaßnahmen haben für die Deutsche Bank höchste Priorität. AFC Monitoring & Screening Global Plattform (GP) ist verantwortlich für die Implementierung der strategischen Transaktionsüberwachungsplattform und die Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden Transaktionsüberwachungs- und Namenslisten-Screening-Systeme. Daten sind die Grundlage für umfassende Kontrollen und ein Schlüsselbereich für die Identifizierung von Risiken im Zusammenhang mit Finanzkriminalität.

Ihre Hauptverantwortlichkeiten

Innerhalb von AFCs GP konzentriert sich die „Intelligence Layer“ Funktion auf die Anwendung erweiterter Analyse Funktionen mit Bezug auf die verwendeten Daten. In dieser Funktion analysieren Sie Daten, und entwickeln daraus Erkenntnisse und Empfehlungen. Sie arbeiten eng mit funktionsübergreifenden Teams zusammen, um Geschäftsanforderungen mit analytischem Fachwissen zu unterstützen. Sie arbeiten mit weiteren Analysten, Dateningenieuren und Wissenschaftlern zusammen, um qualitativ hochwertige Ergebnisse durch die Anwendung fortschrittlicher Analysemethoden auf unsere Daten zu ermöglichen.

Für diese Rolle verfügen Sie über fundierte Erfahrungen in den Bereichen:

  • Analyse und Zusammensetzung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, um Trends und Muster zu identifizieren
  • Umsetzung von Geschäftsanforderungen und Risikodefinitionen in anwendbare Analyseaktivitäten und Entwicklung von Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen zur Unterstützung von Anforderungen im Bereich Anti-Financial Crime
  • Transformation von Daten in verwendbare Formate und standardisierte Protokolle
  • Fähigkeit, ein ganzheitliches Verständnis der bestehenden Daten und Datenquellen der Bank aufzubauen
  • Entwicklung von Modellen und Datenvisualisierung
  • der Zusammenarbeit mit Architekten, Infrastrukturexperten und Dateningenieuren in einem internationalen Umfeld für die Datenanalyse


Ihre Kompetenzen und Erfahrungen

  • Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder vergleichbare Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen
  • Erfahrung mit Datenverarbeitungs- und Integrationspipelines in einem Big Data/ETL-Kontext unter Verwendung von GCP, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Shell-Scripting, Testframeworks oder anderen Komponenten aus dem Ökosystem
  • Sie haben mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Entwicklung mit Python, oder ähnlichen Programmiersprachen mit Fokus auf Big Data und ein fundiertes Verständnis für Data Analytics und statistische Methoden
  • Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Finanzkriminalität und Banken mit deren Transaktionsprozessen
  • Sie sind ein Teamplayer und verfügen über eine hohe persönliche Integrität mit sehr guten Englischkenntnissen in Wort und Schrift, Deutsch wünschenswert


Die Stelle wird in Voll- und in Teilzeit angeboten

Was wir Ihnen bieten:

Wir bieten eine breite Palette von Leistungen, die all Ihre beruflichen und persönlichen Bedürfnisse abdecken.

  • Emotional ausgeglichen Eine positive Haltung hilft uns, die Herausforderungen des Alltags zu meistern – beruflich wie privat. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Beratung in schwierigen Lebenssituationen und Angeboten zur Förderung mentaler Gesundheit.
  • Körperlich fit Mit Angeboten zur Aufrechterhaltung Ihrer persönlichen Gesundheit und einem förderlichen beruflichen Umfeld hilft Ihnen die Bank, körperlich fit zu bleiben. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie umfangreichen Check-up Untersuchungen, Impfangeboten und Beratung zur gesunden Lebensführung.
  • Sozial vernetzt Der Austausch mit anderen eröffnet uns neue Perspektiven, bringt uns beruflich wie persönlich voran und stärkt unser Selbstvertrauen und Wohlbefinden. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Unterstützung durch den pme Familienservice, das FitnessCenter Job, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle (bspw. Teilzeit, Jobtandem, hybrides Arbeiten) sowie einer umfangreichen Kultur der Vielfalt, Chancengleichheit und Teilhabe.
  • Finanziell abgesichert Die Bank sichert Sie nicht nur während Ihrer aktiven Karriere, sondern auch für die Zukunft finanziell ab und unterstützt Ihre Flexibilität sowie Mobilität – egal ob privat oder beruflich. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Beitragsplänen für Altersvorsorge, Bankdienstleistungen für Mitarbeiter*innen, Firmenfahrrad oder dem Deutschlandticket.


Da die Benefits je nach Standort geringfügig variieren, gehen Sie bitte bei konkreten Fragen auf Ihren Recruiter zu.

Die Stelle wird in Voll- und in Teilzeit angeboten.

Bei Fragen zum Rekrutierungsprozess steht Nana Darko gerne zur Verfügung.

Kontakt: Nana Darko (+49(0)175- 6705312 )

Deutsche Bank (DB) benefits from having a highly experienced and dedicated Anti Financial Crime (AFC) function, which performs a crucial role in keeping DBs business operations and global financial services clean from financial crime while serving the interests of the bank and society.

In order to combat financial crime effectively and respond to challenges in a flexible manner, AFC has a matrix structure combining regional, business line and global functional coverage in our core areas of Anti-Money Laundering, Sanctions & Embargoes, Anti-Fraud, Bribery & Corruption, Investigations & Intelligence, Monitoring & Screening, and Risk Assessment. Part of our commitment is to strengthen a strong collaboration with all business lines and support functions within our bank.

What AFC Will Do For You

AFC helps Deutsche Bank generate long-term trust and add value for our clients, staff and society and provide challenging opportunities for you to learn, contribute and benefit from your journey with us. We foster an open and inclusive team culture with the aim to build and maintain a healthy, engaged and well-supported diverse workforce that is equipped to do their best and enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace, whilst applying the highest standards of conduct to guarantee DB´s success in fighting financial crime.

Team- And Role Description

Anti-Financial Crime

The management of financial crime related risks and the implementation of valid and effective controls, processes and security measures has highest priority for Deutsche Bank. AFC Monitoring & Screening Global Platform (GP) is responsible for the implementation of the strategic Transaction Monitoring platform and the further development of the existing Transaction Monitoring and Name List Screening systems. Data is the basis for comprehensive controls and a key area for the identification of financial crime related risk.

Your Main Responsibilities

Within AFCs GP the “Intelligence Layer” has a focus on the application of advanced analytics to the consumed data. As Data Analyst you will be analyzing data and developing insights and recommendations. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to support business requirements with analytical expertise. Collaboration with analysts, data engineers and scientists to enable quality results from the application of advanced analytics methods to our data.

For this role you should have profound experience in the areas of:

  • collection and analysis of data from various sources to identify trends and patterns
  • translation of business requirements and risk definitions into actionable analytics activities and developing insights and recommendations to drive business requirements
  • organizing data into usable formats and standardized protocols
  • ability to build a broad understanding of the bank's existing data, and data sources
  • development of models and data visualization
  • cooperation with architects, infrastructure experts and data engineers on an international framework for data analysis and enrichment


Your Competencies And Experience

  • You have a degree in computer science, mathematics, physics or comparable qualifications and experience
  • Experience with data processing and integration pipelines in a big data/ETL context, using Hadoop, Apache Spark, GCP, shell scripting, test frameworks, or other components from the ecosystem
  • You have at least 3 years of working experience in Python, or similar programming languages with a focus on big data and a sound understanding for data analytics and statistical methods
  • Experience in the areas of financial crime and banking with their transaction processes
  • You are a team player and have as well a high level of personal integrity with excellent oral and written English skills, German desirable


This job is available in full and parttime.

What we offer:

We provide you with a comprehensive portfolio of benefits and offerings to support both, your private and professional needs.

  • Emotionally and mentally balanced A positive mind helps us master the challenges of everyday life – both professionally and privately. We offer consultation in difficult life situations as well as mental health awareness trainings.
  • Physically thriving We support you in staying physically fit through an offering to maintain personal health and a professional environment. You can benefit from health check-ups; vaccination drives as well as advice on healthy living and nutrition.
  • Socially connected Networking opens up new perspectives, helps us thrive professionally and personally as well as strengthens our self-confidence and well-being. You can benefit from PME family service, FitnessCenter Job, flexible working (e.g parttime, hybrid working, job tandem) as well as an extensive culture of diversity, equity and inclusion.
  • Financially secure We provide you with financial security not only during your active career but also for the future. You can benefit from offerings such as pension plans, banking services, company bicycle or “Deutschlandticket”.


Since our offerings slightly vary across locations, please contact your recruiter with specific questions.

In case of any recruitment related questions, please get in touch with Nana Darko.

Contact: Nana Darko (+49(0)175- 6705312 )

Wir streben eine Unternehmenskultur an, in der wir gemeinsam jeden Tag das Beste geben. Dazu gehören verantwortungsvolles Handeln, wirtschaftliches Denken, Initiative ergreifen und zielgerichtete Zusammenarbeit.

Gemeinsam teilen und feiern wir die Erfolge unserer Mitarbeiter*innen. Gemeinsam sind wir die Deutsche Bank Gruppe.

Wir begrüßen Bewerbungen von allen Menschen und fördern ein positives, faires und integratives Arbeitsumfeld.

Title: Senior Data Analyst / Data Engineer (f/m/x) – Trade Finance
Description:
Position Overview

About the job - Deutsche Bank Technology in Berlin

DB Technology is a global team of tech specialists, spread across multiple trading hubs and tech centres. We have a strong focus on promoting technical excellence – our engineers work at the forefront of financial services innovation using cutting-edge technologies.

Our Berlin location is our most recent addition to our global network of tech centres and growing strongly. We are committed to building a diverse workforce and to creating excellent opportunities for talented engineers and technologists. Our tech teams and business units use agile ways of working to create #GlobalHausbank solutions from our home market.

Trade Finance and Lending (TF&L) is one of the leading business departments in the Corporate Bank working with clients around the globe. It has great dependency on IT platform to service the Bank’s clients. The group is working on technology refresh of their IT platform to enable new services for customers as well as to achieve next level of business processes automation.

In-house IT team already achieved great success designing, building and rolling out into production its strategic platform for TF&L business. Based on that success there is a further desire to build towards our strategic architecture.

Your primary focus will be to design and build the central data platform: analytics/MIS/BI and data model for TF&L business of the Bank.


> You love this job but feel you cannot tick 100% of the boxes? Send us your CV anyway!



Your Key Responsibilities


Work closely with business stakeholders and product owner to define MIS solution roadmap and requirements
Design, build and maintain MIS dashboards and data feeds; consolidate multiple datasets into datamarts and metrics for the business users and the clients of the bank
Define and maintain org-level central data model for TF&L business, evolve it to support project goals but keep it consistent for the future
Partner with data engineering teams to align the data platform technical roadmap with MIS requirements
Support audit, regulatory requests and management teams with data investigations, deep dives and ad-hoc analysis



Your Skills And Experiences


Experience in data analysis and data interpretation, good hands-on SQL knowledge (ClickHouse is a plus), experience in BI Tools, e.g. Tableau (preferred), Power BI, Looker etc. Python is a plus.
Understanding of dashboard design and data visualisation principles
Business requirements analysis and management skills; relevant experience in the banking sector is a plus
Strong communication skills, stakeholder management, communication with groups of SMEs, making decisions in a group setting
Experience in data modelling, logical and physical data models, protocol formats; experience in modelling tools e.g. Legend, Power Designer is a plus
Knowledge of data architecture, data pipelines, ELT/ELT, data quality controls
Fluent written and spoken English – you will communicate a lot on your job as part of a global team



What We Offer

We provide you with a comprehensive portfolio of benefits and offerings to support both, your private and professional needs.


Emotionally and mentally balanced A positive mind helps us master the challenges of everyday life – both professionally and privately. We offer consultation in difficult life situations as well as mental health awareness trainings.
Physically thriving We support you in staying physically fit through an offering to maintain personal health and a professional environment. You can benefit from health check-ups; vaccination drives as well as advice on healthy living and nutrition.
Socially connected Networking opens up new perspectives, helps us thrive professionally and personally as well as strengthens our self-confidence and well-being. You can benefit from PME family service, FitnessCenter Job, flexible working (e.g parttime, hybrid working, job tandem) as well as an extensive culture of diversity, equity and inclusion.
Financially secure We provide you with financial security not only during your active career but also for the future. You can benefit from offerings such as pension plans, banking services, company bicycle or “Deutschlandticket”.



Since our offerings slightly vary across locations, please contact your recruiter with specific questions.

This job is available in full and parttime.

In case of any recruitment related questions, please get in touch with Kilian Weber.

Contact Kilian Weber: +49 (30) 340 73087

Gemeinsam teilen und feiern wir die Erfolge unserer Mitarbeiter*innen. Gemeinsam sind wir die Deutsche Bank Gruppe.

Wir begrüßen Bewerbungen von allen Menschen und fördern ein positives, faires und integratives Arbeitsumfeld.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (f/m/d) - Finance
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description

What you will do:


Work closely with the VP of FP&A, Head of Finance Transformation and partner closely with Group Accounting and Controlling teams to design, build, and maintain automated data pipelines and ensure the best-in-class reporting infrastructure.
Implement and maintain automated Segment Reporting for different business units to provide financial visibility and performance tracking across segments.
Automate the delivery of Monthly Lease data to calculate the asset values under customer lease agreements, ensuring accurate tracking of rent payments, asset lifespan, and customer purchases, for key stakeholders providing an efficient self-service reporting.
Develop deep knowledge of ERP data related to financial transactions and resources, use it to ensure adequate usage & design of ERP in collaboration with the Finance Transformation and the Analytics Engineering Guild teams to contribute to the ERP data modelling for the Finance team.
Closely work with Finance leadership, lead weekly meetings with them, ensure quarterly roadmap planning and drive prioritization.



Qualifications

What you should bring:


5+ years of relevant experience business intelligence, analytics with a strong background in finance or accounting domains.
High proficiency in SQL, ETL processes, and familiarity with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Our tech stack includes dbt, Snowflake, Streamlit and Tableau.
Exposure to Python for data analysis (e.g. pandas).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record in automating data pipelines and reporting workflows, especially for monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
Strong ability to analyse financial data, identify patterns, and communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring the delivery of clear, understandable financial reports.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments, with a commitment to financial excellence and innovation.



Additional Information

We're offering:


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Data Analytics Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Title: Data Analytics Engineer (m/w/d)

Salary: €65,000 - €80,000 per annum

Sector: IT, Technology, Data Engineering




Jobzusammenfassung:

Data Analytics Engineer (m/w/d) – Remote (Deutsch C1 erforderlich)

Für ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Digital Services suchen wir einen erfahrenen Data Analytics Engineer (m/w/d), der in einem agilen, remote arbeitenden Team datengetriebene Lösungen für verschiedene Geschäftsbereiche entwickelt und die Digitalisierung vorantreibt.




Deine Aufgaben:

Entwicklung und Implementierung von Datenlösungen mit Fokus auf Azure Synapse, SQL (MySQL, MS SQL), DAC-Paketen sowie API-Implementierungen (REST, GraphQL)
Arbeit an der zentralen Datendrehscheibe, um alte Systeme mit neuen Eigenentwicklungen und cloudbasierten Services zu verknüpfen
Analyse von Geschäftsdaten und Entwicklung prädiktiver Modelle zur Unterstützung von datenbasierten Entscheidungen
Unterstützung bei der nachhaltigen Überführung von Softwaresystemen in den neuen .NET (C#) Tech-Stack
Identifizierung technischer Chancen und Risiken durch Einbringen eigener Erfahrungen
Erstellung von Tests und Dokumentationen (arc42) für entwickelte Funktionalitäten




Dein Profil:

3+ Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics und als Data Engineer
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Python, SQL, NoSQL, Data-Warehouse-Technologien, Statistik und Mathematik
Expertise in Azure Data Services und Power BI
Sichere Anwendung von Statistik- und Analysemethoden
Hohes Maß an Selbstständigkeit und die Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Systeme schnell zu verstehen
Analytische Fähigkeiten, um Risiken und Schwachstellen zu erkennen
Wertschätzung für Softwarequalität und kontinuierliche Reduzierung technischer Schulden
Zertifizierung als Azure Data Engineer oder Bereitschaft, diese zu erlangen
Wohnsitz in Deutschland oder Österreich




Nice to Haves:

Erfahrung mit weiteren Programmiersprachen wie C# und Java
Kenntnisse in Machine Learning oder Künstlicher Intelligenz




Wir bieten:

Attraktives Gehaltspaket mit Bonuszahlungen
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und 100 % Remote-Arbeit
Individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Moderne Arbeitsumgebung mit einer starken Fokussierung auf neue Technologien




Bewerbungsprozess:

Drei Runden: HR-Interview, Technische Challenge, Gespräch mit dem Entwicklerteam

Du möchtest Teil eines agilen Teams werden und die Digitalisierung aktiv mitgestalten? Dann bewirb dich jetzt!




Kontakt:

Ralph Biedermann Consultant | Data & AI | Permanent Solutions

Email: r.biedermann@zabelglobal.com

Phone: +49 170 653 91 01

Website: www.zabelglobal.com

  • Entwicklung und Implementierung von Datenlösungen mit Fokus auf Azure Synapse, SQL (MySQL, MS SQL), DAC-Paketen sowie API-Implementierungen (REST, GraphQL)
  • Arbeit an der zentralen Datendrehscheibe, um alte Systeme mit neuen Eigenentwicklungen und cloudbasierten Services zu verknüpfen
  • Analyse von Geschäftsdaten und Entwicklung prädiktiver Modelle zur Unterstützung von datenbasierten Entscheidungen
  • Unterstützung bei der nachhaltigen Überführung von Softwaresystemen in den neuen .NET (C#) Tech-Stack
  • Identifizierung technischer Chancen und Risiken durch Einbringen eigener Erfahrungen
  • Erstellung von Tests und Dokumentationen (arc42) für entwickelte Funktionalitäten


Dein Profil:

  • 3+ Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics und als Data Engineer
  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in Python, SQL, NoSQL, Data-Warehouse-Technologien, Statistik und Mathematik
  • Expertise in Azure Data Services und Power BI
  • Sichere Anwendung von Statistik- und Analysemethoden
  • Hohes Maß an Selbstständigkeit und die Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Systeme schnell zu verstehen
  • Analytische Fähigkeiten, um Risiken und Schwachstellen zu erkennen
  • Wertschätzung für Softwarequalität und kontinuierliche Reduzierung technischer Schulden
  • Zertifizierung als Azure Data Engineer oder Bereitschaft, diese zu erlangen
  • Wohnsitz in Deutschland oder Österreich


Nice to Haves:

  • Erfahrung mit weiteren Programmiersprachen wie C# und Java
  • Kenntnisse in Machine Learning oder Künstlicher Intelligenz


Wir bieten:

  • Attraktives Gehaltspaket mit Bonuszahlungen
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten und 100 % Remote-Arbeit
  • Individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
  • Moderne Arbeitsumgebung mit einer starken Fokussierung auf neue Technologien


Bewerbungsprozess:

Drei Runden: HR-Interview, Technische Challenge, Gespräch mit dem Entwicklerteam

Du möchtest Teil eines agilen Teams werden und die Digitalisierung aktiv mitgestalten? Dann bewirb dich jetzt!


Kontakt:

Ralph Biedermann Consultant | Data & AI | Permanent Solutions

Email: r.biedermann@zabelglobal.com

Phone: +49 170 653 91 01

Website: www.zabelglobal.com

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
Are you a skilled data engineer, passionate about building data products?

We're seeking a talented individual to join our data team to be part of the foundation for SoSafe's data-driven future, in one of Europe’s most successful cyber security startups. You'll play a pivotal role in shaping our data infrastructure and transforming raw data into actionable insights that power our product and drive business growth.

Your mission



Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines and infrastructure to support our rapid business growth.
Collaborate closely with product, analytics, and other teams to deliver data-driven solutions that power our product roadmap and enhance customer experiences.
Take ownership of the data infrastructure, driving best practices and ensuring data reliability and performance.
Democratize data access by building scalable and secure data delivery mechanisms.
Ensure data pipeline reliability through robust monitoring, alerting, and CI/CD practices.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data engineering, evaluating new technologies and frameworks to enhance our data capabilities.
Actively participate in technical discussions, code reviews, and decision-making processes.
Effectively manage stakeholder expectations and communicate technical concepts clearly.



Your profile



3+ years of experience building and maintaining end-to-end data pipelines using cloud technologies (AWS is preferred)
Strong proficiency in Python, SQL and data engineering tools (e.g Airflow, dbt)
Expertise in data warehousing, data modelling, and ETL/ELT processes
Demonstrated experience with DevOps practices, including infrastructure as code (Terraform) and CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions).
Excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills with a proven ability to build strong working relationships with colleagues.
Strong analytical thinking skills and a solution-oriented mindset.
Thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, with a passion for continuous learning and adaptability to evolving challenges. Proactive self-starter with a strong sense of ownership.
Fluent in English and optionally German.
Bonus points: Experience with CDC tools.



Why Us?

At SoSafe, you'll be part of a cybersecurity team that thrives on innovation, safeguarding organizations against evolving threats and making the digital world a safer place. You will have the opportunity to make a real impact, surrounded by a dynamic and supportive team and environment committed to your professional growth.

What we offer:

Work-Life Balance:



Flexible hours
33 vacation days
Daycare Support



Mobility Support:



Public Transport Subsidy
Swapfiets
EuroRad
Free Parking at HQ



Work Environment:



State-of-the-art tech
Annual company off-site
Networking events
Dog Friendly HQ



Healthcare:



OpenUp
Fitness First



Other Perks:



Company Pension Scheme
Corporate Discounts
Referral Bonus
Learning & Development Allowance



About Us

We are one of the fastest-growing security awareness scale-ups worldwide. By putting people first and focusing on behavioral science, we are disrupting the status-quo of Cyber Security.

Backed by strong VC funding by those such as Highland Europe and Global Founders Capital, we are looking for more motivated team players who will assist us with our ambitious mission and international expansion. At SoSafe, you will take ownership for your work and your growth, taking your career to the next level! If you want to have an impact and are looking to contribute in meaningful ways within an open-minded environment that values diversity and community, SoSafe might just be the right place to work for you!

Are you our next Cyber Security Hero?

Come work with us in our HQ in Cologne, our offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, Paris or Lisbon or at our co-working locations in Dublin, Munich, London or Chemnitz.

Join us on our journey to make the digital world a safer place!
Show more

Title: Product Analyst- (Pandora) (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Product Analyst- (Pandora) (all genders) to join Pandora Product Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Pandora is a leading delivery platform supporting multiple food delivery and Q-commerce brands within Delivery Hero portofolio, operating across 21 countries on three continents and serving millions of monthly active customers.

The Product Analytics Team drives product strategy and innovation by providing actionable insights on customers and products, contributing to business success. Our diverse team of data professionals is based in Singapore and Berlin, working closely with product managers, designers, engineers, and business stakeholders to directly influence product direction. We collaborate with a larger data team, including data engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers, to share knowledge and expertise.

At Pandora Product Analytics, you will have the opportunity to access high volume, rich user behavior data, engage in end to end product development cycles, work on complex product problems, and learn from many experienced data professionals.

The main responsibilities of the Product Analytics Team include:


Experimentation: Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests with a strong emphasis on statistical methods for robust hypothesis validation and accurate impact measurement. A deep understanding of statistical techniques is required for all our experiment analyses.
Product OKRs & Metrics: Define what 'good' looks like by setting up a product metric framework and quarterly OKRs.
Tracking & QA: Define which user behaviors need to be tracked and work with engineers on the implementation and QA.
ETL & Reporting: Building data pipelines and self-service dashboards.
Exploratory Analysis: Drawing insights from data to drive product strategy & roadmap.


What you need to be successful


You’ve completed a degree or above in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, computer engineering or an equivalent education.
3+ years of working experience in Product Analytics, Business Analytics, Marketing Analytics or other relevant data analytics roles
Strong experience in leveraging SQL for analytics (BigQuery experience is a plus)
Proficient with at least one data visualization tool, including but not limited to looker studio (data studio), Tableau, Qlikview, power BI, matplotlib etc.
Experience working with large scale user data (transactional, click stream etc.)
Background in statistics, knowledge about statistical test design and analysis preferably hands on experience in designing and running A/B tests at scale
Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe, Webtrekk, MixPanel, SnowPlow, Piwik, Tealium, Segment etc.)
Ability to clearly communicate analytical findings to relevant stakeholders with effective written and oral communication skills.
Able to operate independently with minimal supervision.
A team player that enjoys working with a diverse team and delivering measurable results.


Nice to have:


Experience with data pipelining tool such as airflow, DBT
Experience or knowledge of machine learning, recommender system, ranking algorithm.
Experience working in a rapidly growing and dynamic product development team


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Online Canteen, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Consultant
Description:
We are Gemma Analytics: a Berlin-based company specializing in generating insights in high-performance data infrastructure. Gemma was founded in early 2020 by two data enthusiasts. Ever since we have helped over 60 companies to become more data-driven and successful. We have a fun, honest, and inclusive work environment. We are always looking for data-minded people we can learn from.

Tasks

You drive the usage of data for our clients, showing and facilitating the value that can be created with data. People love working with you because you find the right balance between quality and speed. You are the communication link between technology and business, and also between C-Level and operational team members. You feel comfortable communicating with all types of stakeholders. Having senior responsibilities, we expect you to build connections with your colleagues and share your knowledge with the team. You have the opportunity to work on difficult problems while helping startups and SMEs to make well-informed decisions based on data. Note that this is a non-remote role in Berlin.

You have the opportunity to work on difficult problems while helping startups and SMEs to make well-informed decisions based on data.

Responsibilities


You understand the most important business KPIs easily after speaking to responsible stakeholders, being a high-quality sparring partner
Currently, the data consultant role is split between analytics engineers and the founder - you shape the role and answer the question of when it makes sense to have dedicated data consultant resources on a project
Currently, the data consultant role is rather reactive - over time, you add proactiveness to the role and act as a sparring partner in how to sell this new role


Requirements

We believe in a good mixture of experience and upside in our team. For this role, related experience is required in addition to a proof of trajectory.

Besides That We Are Looking For The Following


Experience in a fast-paced environment driving projects and track record of managing stakeholders with a good balance between quality and speed
Ability to leverage both SQL and visualization tools to generate insights for our clients
Strong stakeholder-adjusted communication in English in writing and speaking
Business Fluency (C2 or native) in German
Preferred: You have strong expertise in one or more core data areas (e.g. product/marketing/operational/etc. analytics)


Benefits

We are located in Berlin, close to Nordbahnhof. We are currently 17 colleagues and will grow to 23 colleagues in the next 12 to 18 months. Other perks include:


We are a hybrid company that meets in the office twice a week - one common office day and one flexible day
We allow for intra-EU workcations for up to 3 months a year (extra-EU workcations also if this is allowed)
We have an honest, inclusive work environment and want to nurture this environment
We don’t compromise on equipment - a powerful Laptop, extra screens, and all the tools you need to be effective
We will surround you with great people who love to solve (mostly data) riddles
We believe in efficient working hours rather than long working hours - we focus on the output rather than the input
We learn and share during meetups, lunch & learn sessions and are open to further initiatives
We pay a market-friendly salary and we additionally distribute at least 20% of profits to our employees
We are fast-growing and have technology at our core, yet we do not rely on a VC and operate profitably
We have a great yearly offsite event that brings us all together for a full week, enjoying good food, and having a good time (2021: Austria, 2022: Czech Republic, 2023: Germany)


How You'll Get Here


CV Screening
Phone/Coffee/Tea Initial Conversation
Hiring Test
Interviews with 3 future colleagues
Reference calls
Offer + Hired
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant (m/w/d)
Description:
In Machine Learning Reply Germany arbeiten wir mit unseren Kunden an zukunftsweisenden Projekten, für die wir Business Intelligence Consultants suchen, um unsere cloudbasierten Kundenprojekte in verschiedenen Branchen zu unterstützen.

Machine Learning Reply mit seinem Schwesterunternehmen in Italien und über 10.000 Mitarbeitern weltweit ist ein schnell wachsendes Beratungsunternehmen, das sich auf die Lösung von Problemen mit Datenintelligenz und dem richtigen organisatorischen Rahmen als Rückgrat konzentriert.

Unser internationales Team entwickelt maßgeschneiderte End-to-End-Lösungen im Business Intelligence Ecosystem. Dabei decken unsere Projekte den gesamten Lebenszyklus ab, von der anfänglichen Strategieberatung bis hin zur Datenverarbeitung, Modellierung und Visualisierung.

Wenn du gern mit Daten arbeitest und eine Leidenschaft für Data Story-Telling hast, dann komm zu uns!

Aufgaben


Als Business Intelligence Consultant entwickelst du Business Intelligence-Anwendungen für unsere Kunden auf der Grundlage ihrer Herausforderungen und begleitest unsere Kunden durch die gesamte BI-Landschaft, vom Datenzugriff über die Datenmodellierung bis zum Tool-Design
Du bist verantwortlich für die Formulierung von Geschäftsanforderungen und deren Umsetzung in technologische Anforderungen als Teil einer BI-Roadmap und anfänglicher BI-Architekturen
Aus den Quellensystemen unserer Kunden analysierst du die Rohdaten, wandelst sie um und erstellst aussagekräftige Geschäftsanwendungen
In enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Data Scientists, Data Engineers und Solution Architects sorgst du für die reibungslose Implementierung der Projekte
Deine Kommunikationsstärke nutzt du effektiv in Meetings und Workshops, um unsere Kunden durch Business Cases, qualitative Bewertungen und Demos zu überzeugen



Was wir dir bieten


Flexible Arbeitszeiten, ein attraktives Gehalt und ein wettbewerbsfähiges Gesamtpaket (z.B. 30 Tage Urlaub)
Flexible Arbeitsumgebung zwischen Kunde, Reply-Büro und Home Office
Regelmäßige und systematische (externe und interne) Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten.
Profitiere von unserem Team, Lernressourcen, Hackathons und mehr, um deine technische Entwicklung voranzutreiben und eine Präsenz in der Machine-Learning-Community zu haben
Schulungen und Zertifizierungen werden gefördert und bezahlt, um Ihre persönliche Entwicklung voranzutreiben
Zugang zu unserem Mobilitätsprogramm mit Job Rad und Fahrkarten für öffentliche Verkehrsmittel
Zuschuss für die Mitgliedschaft in einem Fitnessstudio Ihrer Wahl
Arbeiten in einem modernen Unternehmen, mit der Dynamik eines Start-Ups und der Sicherheit eines Konzerns. In kleinen, innovativen, internationalen Teams treiben wir den digitalen Wandel voran.
Wir freuen uns auf deinen Master-Abschluss mit einem starken quantitativen und wirtschaftlichen Hintergrund, beispielsweise in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder Informatik
Du bist erfahren im Umgang mit BI-Tools sowie mit der Erstellung von Dashboards (z.B. mit PowerApps, Power BI oder Tableau) und Microstrategy
Sowohl die Daten- und Dimensionsmodellierung als auch die Definition von KPIs (z.B. Aggregationen, Filterung, Sicherheitsgruppen, RLS) sind für dich keine Fremdwörter
Du verfügst über ein ausgeprägtes Verständnis der SQL und relationalen Datenbanken und hast praktische Erfahrung mit der Erstellung und/oder Nutzung von Cloud-basierten Datenbanken
Grundkentnisse über Cloud Analytics und Data Warehousing Services (z.B., Azure Synapse, Amazon Redshift)
Du verfügst über ein umfassendes Verständnis der Datenintegration und -transformation, einschließlich ihrer Ziele und der kritischen Faktoren, die bei der Auswahl des geeigneten Tools zu berücksichtigen sind. Praktische Erfahrung ist von Vorteil (z.B., Apache Spark, Databricks, AWS Glue, etc.)
Erfahrung mit oder Interesse an der Entwicklung von Business Intelligence Use Cases sowie ein gutes Verständnis für die Digitalisierung von BI- und ML-Geschäftsmodellen sind willkommen
Du sprichst fließend Englisch und beherrschen die deutsche Sprache mindestens auf B2-Niveau



Worauf wartest Du noch?

Werde Teil unseres Teams bei Machine Learning Reply in München, Berlin, Hamburg oder remote aus ganz Deutschland!
Show more
HTML:
In Machine Learning Reply Germany arbeiten wir mit unseren Kunden an zukunftsweisenden Projekten, für die wir Business Intelligence Consultants suchen, um unsere cloudbasierten Kundenprojekte in verschiedenen Branchen zu unterstützen.

Machine Learning Reply mit seinem Schwesterunternehmen in Italien und über 10.000 Mitarbeitern weltweit ist ein schnell wachsendes Beratungsunternehmen, das sich auf die Lösung von Problemen mit Datenintelligenz und dem richtigen organisatorischen Rahmen als Rückgrat konzentriert.

Unser internationales Team entwickelt maßgeschneiderte End-to-End-Lösungen im Business Intelligence Ecosystem. Dabei decken unsere Projekte den gesamten Lebenszyklus ab, von der anfänglichen Strategieberatung bis hin zur Datenverarbeitung, Modellierung und Visualisierung.

Wenn du gern mit Daten arbeitest und eine Leidenschaft für Data Story-Telling hast, dann komm zu uns!

Aufgaben

  • Als Business Intelligence Consultant entwickelst du Business Intelligence-Anwendungen für unsere Kunden auf der Grundlage ihrer Herausforderungen und begleitest unsere Kunden durch die gesamte BI-Landschaft, vom Datenzugriff über die Datenmodellierung bis zum Tool-Design
  • Du bist verantwortlich für die Formulierung von Geschäftsanforderungen und deren Umsetzung in technologische Anforderungen als Teil einer BI-Roadmap und anfänglicher BI-Architekturen
  • Aus den Quellensystemen unserer Kunden analysierst du die Rohdaten, wandelst sie um und erstellst aussagekräftige Geschäftsanwendungen
  • In enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Data Scientists, Data Engineers und Solution Architects sorgst du für die reibungslose Implementierung der Projekte
  • Deine Kommunikationsstärke nutzt du effektiv in Meetings und Workshops, um unsere Kunden durch Business Cases, qualitative Bewertungen und Demos zu überzeugen


Was wir dir bieten

  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten, ein attraktives Gehalt und ein wettbewerbsfähiges Gesamtpaket (z.B. 30 Tage Urlaub)
  • Flexible Arbeitsumgebung zwischen Kunde, Reply-Büro und Home Office
  • Regelmäßige und systematische (externe und interne) Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten.
  • Profitiere von unserem Team, Lernressourcen, Hackathons und mehr, um deine technische Entwicklung voranzutreiben und eine Präsenz in der Machine-Learning-Community zu haben
  • Schulungen und Zertifizierungen werden gefördert und bezahlt, um Ihre persönliche Entwicklung voranzutreiben
  • Zugang zu unserem Mobilitätsprogramm mit Job Rad und Fahrkarten für öffentliche Verkehrsmittel
  • Zuschuss für die Mitgliedschaft in einem Fitnessstudio Ihrer Wahl
  • Arbeiten in einem modernen Unternehmen, mit der Dynamik eines Start-Ups und der Sicherheit eines Konzerns. In kleinen, innovativen, internationalen Teams treiben wir den digitalen Wandel voran.
  • Wir freuen uns auf deinen Master-Abschluss mit einem starken quantitativen und wirtschaftlichen Hintergrund, beispielsweise in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder Informatik
  • Du bist erfahren im Umgang mit BI-Tools sowie mit der Erstellung von Dashboards (z.B. mit PowerApps, Power BI oder Tableau) und Microstrategy
  • Sowohl die Daten- und Dimensionsmodellierung als auch die Definition von KPIs (z.B. Aggregationen, Filterung, Sicherheitsgruppen, RLS) sind für dich keine Fremdwörter
  • Du verfügst über ein ausgeprägtes Verständnis der SQL und relationalen Datenbanken und hast praktische Erfahrung mit der Erstellung und/oder Nutzung von Cloud-basierten Datenbanken
  • Grundkentnisse über Cloud Analytics und Data Warehousing Services (z.B., Azure Synapse, Amazon Redshift)
  • Du verfügst über ein umfassendes Verständnis der Datenintegration und -transformation, einschließlich ihrer Ziele und der kritischen Faktoren, die bei der Auswahl des geeigneten Tools zu berücksichtigen sind. Praktische Erfahrung ist von Vorteil (z.B., Apache Spark, Databricks, AWS Glue, etc.)
  • Erfahrung mit oder Interesse an der Entwicklung von Business Intelligence Use Cases sowie ein gutes Verständnis für die Digitalisierung von BI- und ML-Geschäftsmodellen sind willkommen
  • Du sprichst fließend Englisch und beherrschen die deutsche Sprache mindestens auf B2-Niveau


Worauf wartest Du noch?

Werde Teil unseres Teams bei Machine Learning Reply in München, Berlin, Hamburg oder remote aus ganz Deutschland!

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Graduate Data Analyst

London Based – 3 days a week in office




The Impact Team, a global leader in innovative technology solutions, is seeking a bright and enthusiastic Graduate Data Analyst to join our growing team. This role offers an excellent opportunity to kickstart your career in data analytics while contributing to impactful digital transformations for our global clients.




Role Overview

As a Graduate Data Analyst at The Impact Team, you will work alongside experienced professionals to analyse complex datasets, derive meaningful insights, and support data-driven decision-making processes. You'll be involved in projects spanning various industries, with a focus on financial services and digital transformation initiatives.




Key Responsibilities

Collect, process, and analyse large datasets using advanced analytical tools and techniques
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize key performance indicators
Assist in the implementation of data-driven solutions for our clients' business challenges
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including DevOps and cybersecurity specialists
Support the integration of data analytics into our automated threat modelling processes
Contribute to client presentations and reports, translating complex data into actionable insights
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in data analytics and machine learning







Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in STEM, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Python, R, or SQL
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to work effectively in a team environment
Enthusiasm for learning and adapting to new technologies







Desired Skills

Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and their applications
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark)
Understanding of financial services industry trends and challenges
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
Interest in cybersecurity and its intersection with data analytics

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Function: Digital & Technology

Location: Edinburgh, South Gyle (Hybrid)




Salary: £46,000 - £56,000 base depending on experience. Plus the full list of benefits listed below.




Contract: 12 month Fixed Term Contract




Closing Date: 9th of October 2024. Please note, we may close vacancies early where we receive significant numbers of applications, so don’t delay!




As the nation’s leading pub, cider and beer company and the name behind a host of brilliant brands, we’re looking for equally brilliant people to help us on our journey to building a better future.




There’s so much more to HEINEKEN than meets the eye and right now, we’re looking for a new Data Analyst to join our Digital & Technology team!




About the role

The Data Analyst is responsible for maintaining and gathering data requirements for HEINEKEN UK (HUK). You’ll play a leading role in ensuring the global defined data requirements are understood, sourced, assessed and made fit for purpose.




This role will sit in the Data Management team and prioritise the delivery of frameworks, policies and ways of working by utilising data management tools to increase the quality and structure of HUK data.




So, what will you be doing? Here are some of the key accountabilities;

Lead data management requirements in the UK from start to finish, including planning, execution and validation across data exploration, discovery, cataloguing, governance & quality management.
Develop and execute modelling and cleansing plans, including mapping, data migration, transformation, and cleansing activities to support digital products
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify project requirements and define data management goals and objectives.
Evaluate legacy systems and data sources to determine the scope and complexity of the migration and cleansing effort.




Who we’re looking for?

We’re looking for a team player with a keen aye for detail! Ideally you’ll have an understanding of how data is used within a business and it’s impact on the wider company. You’ll often need to facilitate communication between business leaders and the tech teams, so strong communication skills are key.




If you;

Have 5+ years of management experience in a data management-related role.
Understand data management capabilities– especially around profiling, cleansing and data migration
Can effectively manage multiple projects and deliverables.
Have relevant knowledge of data management frameworks
Ideally experience in Supply Chain data




This could be the role for you!




Our ways of working

Our office sites operate a hybrid model. You’ll spend Tuesdays, Thursdays and one other day in the office and two days from home, although but you’re more than welcome to come and work from the office on those days too.




We’re currently gearing up for an exciting move! In 2025, we’ll be relocating from our current location at Broadway Park (on the outskirts of Edinburgh) to a modern, flexible working space in the heart of the city centre.




The move to our new home at 6 St Andrew Square is expected to take place in the second quarter of 2025, subject to detailed planning and relevant approvals. The site will have great transport links and will be just a five minute walk from Waverley station.




So stay tuned, and once you're onboard you'll have access to a SharePoint site with further details during the transition period to the new location.




The Good Stuff!

In addition to your base salary, you’ll also receive:

An annual bonus
Company funded Private Medical Healthcare
Double matched pension (up to 10%)
35 days holiday
A monthly case of our delicious ciders and beers! (low and no alcohol options available)
Comprehensive Opportunities to develop.




You’ll also get the opportunity to get involved with one of our colleague networks where groups of colleagues from all over the business work together to ensure we’re always working towards being a diverse and inclusive company.




The application

If you like what you’ve read and want to explore this opportunity further, please apply before the closing date listed at the top of the advert.




Please note, we may close vacancies early where we receive significant numbers of applications, so don’t delay!




If you need any adjustments made to support your application, for example if you require information in different formats, or if you have any accessibility issues, then we’re more than happy to review our processes – please feel free to get in touch with us as recruitment@heineken.co.uk.




In all likelihood the ideal candidate for this role won’t meet every single requirement in this advert, in fact we all need the opportunity to grow and develop in role. We understand some applicants are less likely to apply to jobs unless they feel they meet every single qualification. The team at HEINEKEN would encourage you to submit an application if the advert has piqued your interest rather than ruling yourself out based on any self-limiting beliefs. You never know, you may be exactly what we’re looking for!




We’ve 150 years of brewing history and are proud of this legacy. Yet we’re sure our best days are ahead of us. Every one of our colleagues has a role to play as we dream big, set bold ambitions, and push the boundaries. We support colleagues on this journey with development opportunities and unique experiences to help them reach their full potential.




Apply today to discover Your Future, Untapped.

Show more
