Title: Customer Data Analyst (Maternity Cover) - Sweaty Betty
Description:
Current employees, please apply in Workday.

We burst onto the scene as the OGs of female-first activewear back in

1998. And since then, we’ve been on a global mission to empower

women through fitness and beyond.

By uniting a global community of women – our sisterhood – together we encourage one another to embrace our bodies and everything we can do with them.

Our sisterhood treats every day like it’s made for moving, and we’re

always pushing to do better too. Like using responsibly sourced

materials, launching our first-ever FemTech collection – designed to

keep you moving through menstruation, maternity and menopause –

and supporting girls from all backgrounds to get into sport through

our Sweaty Betty Foundation.

This is an exciting opportunity to join us as a Customer Data Analyst as we continue our mission to empower women through fitness and beyond. You in?

As a Customer Data Analyst you'll turn complex data into growth opportunities, playing an instrumental role in shaping our customer strategy and tactical trading plans. By translating data into actionable insights, you'll empower our Marketing, Ecomm and Product teams to develop data-driven, customer-centric strategies.

Key Responsibilities


Partner with internal teams to identify and prioritise key customer questions, conducting comprehensive analyses that inform strategic decisions aligned with customer needs and market trends
Analyse customer behaviour, product and transactional data on a weekly and monthly basis to provide actionable insights, identify trends and uncover tactical opportunities
Own the customer segmentation model, leveraging advanced analytics to predict customer behaviours, and lead customer-focused experimentation initiatives to uncover new opportunities
Confidently communicate insights to stakeholders at all levels by employing data storytelling techniques, ensuring that complex data is transformed into clear, engaging and actionable narratives
Proactively develop and improve PBI reports ensuring that complex analyses are understandable and actionable for non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate with the central data team to guarantee data accuracy across by conducting regular validations and deepening our understanding of data logics


Our DEI Commitment

We are working to create a culture and team that represents our mission of empowerment. We want to celebrate our diversity, embody inclusion and create an equitable business. This means doing more and working harder to make the long-lasting changes necessary. We care about our people, our community and world.

We want to stand up for what we believe in and give our people a platform to use their voice. To actively listen and learn from what they have to say. This involves focusing on learning, development, and progression across the business. Being clear on the responsibilities we hold each other and to our community. It also means being committed to equal employment opportunities. Ensuring we consider ALL applicants for jobs and working harder to make our job advertising more inclusive.

Our DEI mission is "to embed diversity, equity and inclusion at the heart of our business. To create a culture of belonging that empowers everyone to be their best authentic self. We commit to celebrating different perspectives and to continuously learning, developing and challenging ourselves and our partners."

We know we're on a journey. And far from perfect. But we want to be a part of the solution to the problem. It might not be comfortable or straightforward. But if we weren't up for doing the hard work and breaking the mould, we wouldn't be Sweaty Betty. We are committed to working across our business and with our DEI committee & DEI Collective to be champions, allies and inclusive, always. Because when we say all, we mean it.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




This is a contract position outside IR35, starting with a 6 month contract.




Overall Ambition




Nando’s is on a journey to Create Lasting Happiness, making a difference to the lives of our people, our customers, and the communities we work in. Originally started in Johannesburg, South Africa, we pride ourselves on creating memorable experiences for everyone involved in Nando’s: from our employees, communities, founders, and suppliers, but most importantly, our customers.




Whilst we always look back on our history and story with pride, the story is still evolving. We have recently been growing our digital capabilities to ensure the Nando’s experience remains relevant to modern-day customers.




You will be joining a tech team that has grown rapidly in the past five years and is determined to enable change within the restaurant industry by bringing innovative thinking and the latest technology tools and practices to solve some of its most complex problems.




The Data and Analysis Team

We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our Data and Analysis team. Our remit is to ensure everyone has the access to the right information at the right time and Nando’s gets the best value out of our data to help achieve our business goals.




Our current focus is extracting insights from the data and creating a single source of accurate, timely data and managed in the best way as we continue to increase our data maturity and advance our predictive analytic capability.




You will be part of our work to support our strategic goals and embed a data-informed attitude for addressing our opportunities and challenges.




What we're looking for

Our Data Analysts work across a wide range of domains, helping our teams make better decisions based on sound data and analysis. They are the "voice of our data". As a Nando's Data Analyst you will help us test and learn about our world better and faster than ever before and draw insights and solutions for using our data in the best way.




In this role, there will be a focus on our product and stock data, but the role will also provide support for other domains, datasets and data consumers.




You will…

Discover patterns in data
Turn raw data into relevant insights
Use data to help other teams to answer their most important questions Interpret and present via the most appropriate medium




Skills required:

You will have proven experience in the following:

Assessing the most effective methods and technologies to approach tasks, with a focus on automating processes where possible
Manipulating and querying data with SQL
Cleansing, modelling data and visualising it using Looker or similar BI tool
Delivering analysis and actionable business insights using Looker or similar tool
Investigating, evaluating, interpreting and classifying data
Applying data analysis, data modelling and quality assurance techniques
Supporting engineering in designing, coding and testing data processing pipelines
Creating and maintaining good documentation around our data and processes to document requirements, data models, data classifications, provenance and solutions
An understanding around data governance and the importance of good data management
Applying typical best practice and standards
Ability to create, store, manage and share your code using different tools ensuring collaboration and visibility of work including maintaining good version control and other principles




You will also display:







Good communication skills to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
A desire to learn new techniques and new tools and support our data maturity journey
An analytical problem-solving approach
Ability to offer ways to improve existing processes and continually communicate and improve data management practices in your teams
A great teamwork attitude
Ability to grasp business process and objectives and how they relate to data activity
Championing of excellent data quality




At Nando’s, everyone is welcome. Inspired by our Southern African heritage we know and value the richness that diversity brings to Nando’s. We’re committed to creating an inclusive and respectful culture for all; including our existing and future Nandocas, partners and suppliers, customers and the communities we are a part of. We deliberately work hard to create an environment where every individual is valued, respected and can ﬂourish regardless of who they are, their background or outlook on life.




We welcome applications from a diverse range of individuals and will consider any reasonable adjustments in order to enable candidates to perform as well as possible during the recruitment process

Show more

  • Applying data analysis, data modelling and quality assurance techniques
  • Supporting engineering in designing, coding and testing data processing pipelines
  • Creating and maintaining good documentation around our data and processes to document requirements, data models, data classifications, provenance and solutions
  • An understanding around data governance and the importance of good data management
  • Applying typical best practice and standards
  • Ability to create, store, manage and share your code using different tools ensuring collaboration and visibility of work including maintaining good version control and other principles


You will also display:



  • Good communication skills to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • A desire to learn new techniques and new tools and support our data maturity journey
  • An analytical problem-solving approach
  • Ability to offer ways to improve existing processes and continually communicate and improve data management practices in your teams
  • A great teamwork attitude
  • Ability to grasp business process and objectives and how they relate to data activity
  • Championing of excellent data quality


At Nando’s, everyone is welcome. Inspired by our Southern African heritage we know and value the richness that diversity brings to Nando’s. We’re committed to creating an inclusive and respectful culture for all; including our existing and future Nandocas, partners and suppliers, customers and the communities we are a part of. We deliberately work hard to create an environment where every individual is valued, respected and can ﬂourish regardless of who they are, their background or outlook on life.


We welcome applications from a diverse range of individuals and will consider any reasonable adjustments in order to enable candidates to perform as well as possible during the recruitment process

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Job Position: Digital Graduate - Data Analyst

Location: Central London

Starting Salary: £26,800

Requirements: Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM subject and experience in analysing data

Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants. 

Change and transformation for the world's most ambitious organisations

Grayce partners with some of the world's most ambitious organisations to help deliver change and transformation.

With over a decade's experience developing and deploying high-performing talent for our FTSE 100 & 250 partners, our Accelerated Development Programme has enabled thousands of talented individuals to launch successful careers. Within this programme you could work in Data, DevOps, InfoSec, Testing or a Hybrid role within these disciplines.

Join us and shape your future!

Why Grayce?

Our Analysts are actively involved in major global transformation programmes across diverse industries.

Opportunity: You'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications, whilst getting hands-on experience working full time on site directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisations.

Delivery: You will work with one client, delivering high quality outcomes during your Grayce tenure, before transitioning to working directly for them. The skills required for exceptional client delivery include natural curiosity, proactivity, adaptability, effective communication and problem solving.

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced Delivery Managers and Technical Trainers. They'll be your go-to, offering support, insights, sharing experiences.

Progression: Starting as an Analyst with the potential to progress into a Lead Analyst after two years, you will pick up invaluable skills and complete a minimum of 6 industry recognised accreditations during your time on the programme.

Accreditations: BCS Foundation, Agile Practitioner, CMI Level 5 plus flexible training budget

What Makes a Great Grayce Analyst 

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: While having STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) background would be an advantage, we're open to applicants from undergraduate backgrounds that have directly handled and manipulated data.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.

 

Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at £26,800 with potential for significant growth in three years

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing
Show more

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
THE COMPANY:

Capax RM is one of the fastest growing executive search businesses in the UK! We cover the entirety of North America & Canada. We offer business critical solutions to blue chip firms from our offices in London and Newcastle.




Our markets include Oracle, Sage, Microsoft and Acumatica. We are a well-known brand and have helped our clients maximise profit and have earnt the right to become a trusted partner to over 10,000 clients. As we push to grow, we have identified the new business software areas we will be entering this year. All of these areas are and will be headed up by the people in the business who have been with us from graduate level.




As we push to grow, we have identified the new business software areas we will be entering this year. All of these areas will be headed up by the people in the business who have been with us from graduate level.




Capax RM is on a mission to become the most well-known brand in the market. Achieving this goal comes from both the people who are already in the business and also the future people who will join us. We put support, progression and professional development at the forefront of everything we do so that our consultants feel empowered to reach their full potential, whether that is Senior Levels of Management, building out new markets or running their own companies through us.




THE ROLE:




*****You do not need any experience for this position!*****




We are looking for an individual that is highly analytical and will enjoy looking at trends and finding patterns in data and reporting on it. If you are highly organised, thorough in your approach and enjoys ‘getting lost in the numbers’ you will thrive in this position. With the growth of the company, this role will eventually grow into a Head of Analytics position. The person in this position will have a direct impact on the performance of the business.

This position will work closely with the Head of Growth and the Senior members of the business. You will get all of the training you need in order to learn on the job and develop in your own career as well as playing an integral part in the growth & development of the business. We’re looking for someone that will embody our core values in particular, 'getting the job done'; 'being market experts'; 'collaboration & support - being human'!




Responsibilities:

Finding trends in data through investigating quality of outreach across the business
Work closely with the Head of Growth to provide insights into the data which will support Consultants’ learning
Organise and manage current reporting across the business
Present findings and insights on all data to stakeholders across the business
Review pre-existing and current data to identify previous trends
Work with the Head of Growth to identify training opportunities to deliver to consultants to support with their development.
Compile and analyze data related to business' issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion
Adhoc tasks as requested




What we are looking for from you:

NO PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE REQUIRED! Preferably this role will be someone who has just graduated
Someone who genuinely enjoys and can adapt to a fast pace working environment
Someone who takes pride in their work and is committed to doing the best job possible
Analytical mindset and for you to ‘get lost in the numbers’
Someone who is thorough and precise in their work
Very strong organisation & time management skills
Excellent verbal and written communication
Show more

Title: TikTok LIVE Data Analyst
Description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. Our focus is to continually champion and optimize TikTok LIVE through working with creators to ensure a creative, fun and safe space for all of our users.

The Regional LIVE Operation Strategy Team leads various cross-functional projects. Our key initiatives include developing strategic plans to drive widespread adoption of LIVE at scale among creators, localizing new product features, creating user engagement strategies, ensuring a positive creator experience through education on the Community Guidelines and best practices, and providing ad hoc analysis and support to cross-functional partners.

Responsibilities:
- Analyzing local and global trends to help improve performance within the EU LIVE team
- Creating and preparing reports and dashboards to help us better identify areas of focus and trends within our ecosystem

Examples of Problems You'll Be Solving:
- What are the best content verticals for us to focus our creator recruitment on?
- Building a prediction model for identifying creators who may be destined for success on our platform
- Which metrics and leading and lagging indicators should we use for our key OKRs?
- How should we best segment our creators and users to have a more meaningful impact on their growth?
- What are the best touchpoints to educate our creators, and when should we activate this education?
- Using statistical tools to simplify complex data sets, helping us better diagnose issues and propose solutions

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Boundless Learning we are empowering our partners to deliver exceptional experiences that expand opportunities for learners around the world. We put learner success at the heart of everything we do, empowering our partners to deliver personalized, learner-centric experiences that boost access and create economic mobility. For 30 years, we've partnered with organizations and corporations around the world to design workforce-aligned experiences. When it comes to online program management, we keep learner success at the heart of everything we do and work hard to deliver positive career outcomes. At Boundless Learning you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with passionate, diverse teams, where your ideas are valued, and your expertise is respected. Join us on this meaningful journey towards transforming education and making a lasting difference in the lives of learners worldwide.




Summary

The Data and Analytics team is a nimble and highly impactful team that provides critical guidance, insights and strategic frameworks to the senior leaders responsible for various functions and business units. As an integral part of the team, the Data Analyst will help extract meaning from large volumes of data necessary to make informed business decisions and help set business vision, strategy and roadmap, through that data analysis. The Data Analyst will focus on all things analytics, including business intelligence tools, multidimensional datasets, and partnering with business leaders to answer business questions. They are responsible for requirements gathering, report design/authoring, ad-hoc analysis, quality assurance and documenting artifacts related to the report development lifecycle. Additionally, the Data Analyst utilizes strong business and technical knowledge to ensure the highest level of service and efficiency for the customer.




General Responsibilities

Specific duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following. Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned.

Execute the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.
Translate general reporting requests from the business into data requirements, acquire data from multiple sources, and develop reports to satisfy the immediate business need, with a strategic focus on anticipating future needs.
Work with business partners to translate data related questions into structured analyses and share findings of analyses in a concise and persuasive manner. • Develop business requirements and process documentation for ad-hoc, on demand, and standard reports.
Build dashboards to measure, track and interpret company KPIs/OKR’s, and identify deviations from objectives.
Leverage sufficient understanding of the business and strategy to provide business recommendations to business units including (but not limited to) Marketing, Business Development, Recruitment Teams, Student Support, Partnerships and Finance.
Collaborate within a team environment to develop relevant and repeatable policies and procedures for preparing business reports and departmental processes.
Define the data elements and data structure that our team should leverage to enable analytical and reporting capabilities for our business development team.
Work with engineering and data warehouse to appropriately capture and store key data points.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.




General Qualifications.

Four (4) years of experience in designing and authoring reports/dashboards using Tableau (or similar tools like Looker, Power BI, Qlik) is required.
Four (4) years of experience writing complex queries using SQL (Preferably Google Big Query).
Experience with Salesforce is highly desired.
Any prior experience with Data Science languages like Python, and/or R is preferred.
Ability to work within a cross-functional team setting and shifting priorities.
Good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to interact with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning organizational levels.
Demonstrated ability to use discretion and make sound decisions.




Supervisory Responsibilities

None.

Title: Media Data Analyst
Description:
Job Overview




This role will be responsible for supporting the media and digital analytics team for PN Europe to deliver maximum value from media performance data to better optimise media testing and investments. This role will include working closely with Mars Media Agencies, Media Activation teams and Media Platforms, to ensure that tests and advanced media measurement is set up with statistical rigour and has results that are actionable within the business. Also, this role is responsible for supporting the team lead on investment scenario planning, utilising MMM results and scaled modelling principles.




Key Responsibilities




Support Media testing agenda and execute advanced media measurement (sales lift studies and Media Mix Modelling interpretation) with key partners.
Work closely with business teams to support analytical needs & fulfill reporting gaps.
Support on data driven investment scenario planning across Pet Nutrition Europe.
Support on Media Platform measurement discussions, partnering with our media agencies.
Support extracting and cleansing data for inputs to models and results ratification.




Key Skills




Experience in R, Python or SQL.
Must have experience in test & learn frameworks, data visualisation, media analytics and creation or utilisation of Marketing Mix Models.
Extensive in marketing analytics, Consumer Insights or customer analytics in a fast-paced environment, experience In FMCG area would be a plus.
Experience working with or at a media agency on campaign measurement.
Good collaboration and storytelling skills, which you will use daily, with external consultants, vendors and Internal stakeholders.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.
Show more
HTML:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:

  • Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
  • Data Analyst - £50,000
  • Business Data Analyst - £67,500
  • Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
  • Business Analysts - £60,000

Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.

  • Microsoft excel - to expert level.
  • Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
  • Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
  • Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.

Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Management Associate




Team Overview: The Investment Operations team consists of two key groups:

Data Management – responsible for maintaining the accuracy, consistency, and appropriateness of investment-related data, as well as developing and implementing the Data Governance Policy.
Portfolio Administration – manages the accurate processing of transactions and ensures effective administration of the investment portfolio, including monitoring lifecycle events.




The Data Management Associate will work within the Data Management team, focusing on the completion of daily operational tasks and the development of processes and controls in collaboration with the Data Management Executive. They will take a proactive approach to improving business-as-usual (BAU) processes while ensuring that daily monitoring tasks are handled with precision. The role also includes involvement in change projects and initiatives outside of regular operations.




Key Responsibilities:

Execute daily monitoring processes with accuracy and attention to detail.
Support the design and maintenance of BAU monitoring procedures using tools like SQL, Power BI, and Excel.
Assist with project work and system testing.
Provide analysis and solutions on various data-related issues with minimal supervision.
Prioritize tasks effectively to meet deadlines while delivering high-quality results.
Ensure team documentation is thorough, complete, and up-to-date.
Offer guidance to internal stakeholders on best practices in data management.
Promote and advocate for data governance principles across the organization while developing your skills in this area.




Candidate Profile:

Essential Skills:

Strong background and experience in Data Management within the financial services industry.
Advanced proficiency in SQL, Power BI, and Excel to create and maintain BAU monitoring processes.
Capable of managing BAU processes independently and training others to a high standard.
Excellent task prioritization skills, ensuring timely delivery with a focus on quality.
Ability to analyze issues and propose corrective actions.
Strong attention to detail in creating and maintaining data documentation.
Eager to enhance data governance knowledge and actively support team initiatives.
2 to 3 years of experience required and a background within financial services, ideally with exposure to alternative investments or similar sectors.




Desirable Skills:

Familiarity with transaction management and/or accounting systems (e.g., eFront, Aladdin, Charles River) and their interactions across business processes.
Experience in identifying process improvements and seeing them through to implementation.
Competence in managing system enhancements or issues from identification to resolution.
Basic understanding of data modelling and database concepts.
Knowledge of data governance principles and best practices.
Familiarity with JIRA is an advantage.

Title: Graduate Analyst / Insights Analyst
Description:
The Role: Graduate Research/Insights Analyst

Location: London

Status: Full Time, Permanent


Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in the United Kingdom, RFI Global doesn't provide Visa sponsorship



Company Overview

RFI Global is the only global data and insights company focusing exclusively on financial services. We empower financial service leaders with the market intelligence they need to drive innovation and accelerate growth.

Partnering with the world's top financial institutions, our expert team delivers tailored insights through a unique hybrid syndicated approach, drawing from over 200,000 consumer and 60,000 business interviews each year.

Role Highlights

The Insights Analyst will be a key member of our dynamic and fast paced analyst team, creating critical business and market insights that our clients rely on to measure and grow performance and direct their strategy.

You will gain experience in analysing primary voice of customer data, secondary macro data, and corporate case studies. This will provide a base from which you will be trained as an expert in financial services insights. This is a fast-paced role where you will be rewarded for your commitment and learning ability.

Importantly, you will see the impact of your work on the largest and most innovative global, regional and national banks.

Key responsibilities:


Analysis of primary consumer data to provide recommendations and propose actions for client's strategic decision-making
Analysis of secondary data (economic, financial etc) to triangulate and contextualise RFI's primary research
Sourcing and analysis of desktop content to deepen competitive insight
Accurate creation and detailed review of sensitive performance metrics used by our clients within core functions of their institutions, and for market updates
Creating presentation decks which tell a compelling story, using data
Cross-functional collaboration with team members, including sales, client services, operations and research teams in our Singapore, London and Sydney offices
Client interaction, including attendance at client meetings and a training roadmap for presenting to clients
Communication of ideas, thinking outside the box and challenging the status quo



Requirements


Have a degree in any discipline
Be a self-starter with a positive attitude
Thrive in a fast-paced environment and be comfortable with a steep learning curve
Be self-motivated and able to work both autonomously and in a team
Enjoy working in an open and collaborative environment
Have a curious mind
Apply critical thinking to every task you take on
Be confident multi-tasking and managing multiple deadlines
Have excellent communication skills


Additionally, the following skills will be highly regarded but are not essential as full on-the-job training will be provided:


Knowledge of or interest in the banking and payments industry or in market research
Experience using Microsoft Office programs, particularly PowerPoint and Excel
Experience with using Q, SPSS, or any other statistical analysis software



Benefits


Salary: Competitive
Great opportunity to work with a global team
25 days annual leave + public holidays + birthday leave + 2 Days Charity Day
Flexible working arrangements
Private healthcare
Regular employee awards
Learning and development budget to help your professional growth
Monthly social events and breakfast
Perkbox
Loyalty Leave
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Purpose of the Role:

At WHSmith our people are at the heart of everything we do. They are the ones that go the extra mile for our customers. The ones that enable our growth. That’s why our BI team is passionate about creating an environment where people can be creative and trailblazing in order to do their best work.




Data and Analytics is key to the success of any retailer and WHSmith is investing and putting analytical innovation at the centre of its business strategy. The role of a BI Analyst will be supporting all areas of the travel organisation with their decisions by providing a range of analytical products.




We are looking for a curious person who can support the organisation with insights derived from the data asset and influence commercial change. The output will range from the production of dashboards to ad-hoc insights to more complex pieces of analytics. This key role would be a great step for any analyst looking to influence key commercial decision makers and build experience of building analytical products in a fast-moving retailer.




What you’ll do:

Plan, design and implement effective dashboards and visualisations as the business transitions to a more automated reporting approach
Taking on the role of a superuser and becoming a key contact for the wider business to create ad-hoc reports and analysis, while continually improving the quality of data insight in existing reports
Working closely with the trading teams to provide ad-hoc analysis, such as insight into trials, promotional changes and detailed variance analysis, all presented in a clear and understandable manner
Developing the weekly Trading Pack, supporting ad-hoc requests and iteration of the pack to meet business needs
Developing and maintaining an interactive portal for 3rd parties to access WHSmith commercial data, delivering income for the business
Providing ad hoc support business teams on analysis, forecasting and format development
Ideate and build analytical products using appropriate mathematical and statistical rigour
Managing technical and non-technical stakeholders and end-users, owning the end-to-end delivery of BI products




Who you are:

Strong analytical background with experience using SQL
You will have experience creating reports and analytics in a reporting tool, such as Power BI or similar
You are curious and enthusiastic with strong interpersonal skills
Confident communicator with the ability to articulate and influence the output of your analysis and challenge both the approach and results where necessary
Proactive self-starter comfortable in a fast-paced and changing environment with an eye for detail
Great stakeholder management
Ability to demonstrate problem solving skills




How we reward our teams

• Hybrid working model

• 4pm Friday finish

• Flexible Working

• Competitive Salary and

• Annual Bonus based on company and personal performance

• 24 days holiday, plus your Birthday off and an opportunity to buy up to 26 extra days leave

• Family Friendly Leave

• Competitive Pension Contribution

• Sharesave Scheme

• Staff Discount Card in stores and online




About us

Celebrating 230 years, we’re proud to have grown and evolved into a globally recognised brand present in over 30 countries around the world, and we’re proud to be that air of familiarity people love and trust on their journey, both in life and through life. As a diverse group of over 12,000 colleagues, we are all on the same journey to a better business through our commitments to our planet, people and the communities we serve.

WHSmith are proud to be an inclusive employer, we want our colleagues to feel welcome, and free to be themselves with us.

Our UK Travel office is based in a buzzing part of central London close to Liverpool Street Station. We are an ambitious team that thrives on pace, collaboration and innovation resulting in a real entrepreneurial culture. It’s perfect for people who are happy to use their initiative and embrace life outside their comfort zone.

Title: Data Analyst - £45-50,000 - Power BI - London
Description:
Data Analyst - £45-50,000 - Power BI - London




Scalexperts have partnered with a London based business who, as part of the beginning of a large scale data transformation, are looking to hire a Data Analyst on a permanent basis. Various departments within the business are keen to do more with their data, with the initial focus of the role involving the development and implementation of various dashboards within PowerBI. The role will also involve some data analysis with SQL, and requirements gathering from cross-functional teams - Marketing, Operations, Technology etc. The end goal of this initial phase is for a self-serve reporting capability to be built. The longer term vision for this role is to provide strategic analysis that aids in decision making whilst also ensuring a high level of data quality and governance across the company.




Although this role involves both analysis and technical work, the emphasis is on the analysis and reporting side with roughly 20% of the role involving SQL coding.




Key Responsibilities:

Working closely with the Head of Data to drive the implementation of the data strategy
Pushing the adoption of PowerBI, taking existing reports/tools and migrating them onto PowerBI using trusted data
Analyse the existing SQL database and ensure that it is fit for purpose, making alterations and recommendations where appropriate
Build frameworks with teams company wide to ensure that requirements for data and reporting are documented
Build strong relationships across the company to ensure the data strategy continues to align with the business strategy and aid in insights driven decision making
Ensure that the data the wider business has access to is of high quality and can be trusted




Key Skills Required:

3-6 years in a data/reporting/insights role, delivering analysis on how a business gathers, reports and stores its data
Previous experience of working with data from external-facing teams ie. sales/marketing
Experience with PowerBI and creating dashboards from scratch
Knowledge of SQL coding - ability to use stored procedures etc
Able to translate technical/data concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Experience presenting findings to stakeholders at all level - this transformation is being closely followed by multiple senior figures within the organisation
Comfortable in taking ownership - the data team is in it's infancy so there will be an onus on being able to adapt, working within a certain amount of ambiguity and providing value to the business despite a low level of data maturity
Experience within a SaaS/B2B company would be highly advantageous




This company are based in central London and operate a hybrid working model with 3 days/week in the office.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a data analyst with experience in issuing processing and looking to work for a growing fintech?

We are seeking a talented Data Analyst with expertise in the payments space.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with complex data sets related to payment transactions, providing crucial insights that will drive business decisions and strategic initiatives. Your analysis will directly influence the efficiency of payment processing and card issuance operations, helping to shape the future of our business.

Job Summary

As a Data Analyst specializing in the payments space for issuer processors, you will play a critical role in analysing and interpreting complex data sets to support decision-making and strategic initiatives. You will be responsible for extracting insights from payment transaction data, identifying trends, ensuring data quality, and providing actionable recommendations to improve business outcomes. Your work will directly impact the efficiency and effectiveness of payment processing and card issuance operations.

Key Responsibilities


Analyse large datasets related to payment processing, card issuance, and customer transactions to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Use statistical techniques and data mining tools to interpret data and generate actionable insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize data and track key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work closely with business units, product managers, and other teams to understand data requirements and business objectives.
Provide analytical support to stakeholders by delivering data-driven recommendations and insights.
Communicate findings and insights effectively through presentations, reports, and visualizations.
Ensure the accuracy, completeness, and consistency of data used for analysis.
Work with data engineers to implement data validation and cleansing processes to maintain high data quality.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and optimization within payment processing and card issuance operations.
Analyse operational workflows to recommend efficiency improvements.
Monitor system performance and data trends to proactively address potential issues.
Ensure data analysis practices comply with industry standards, regulatory requirements, and security protocols.
Assist in preparing data and reports for regulatory audits and compliance reviews.
Proactively identify opportunities for process improvements and implement innovative solutions.
Participate in training and professional development activities to enhance skills and knowledge.


Qualifications


Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the payments industry with issuer processors.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python).
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Knowledge of payment processing system, card issuance, and related services.
Experience with cloud-based data solutions (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and warehouses such as Snowflake, Redshift etc.
Familiarity with modern data architecture such as Lakehouse.
Familiarity with dBT tool for data transformation.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Attention to detail and a commitment to data quality and integrity.
Familiarity with regulatory requirements and security standards in the financial industry.


About Thredd

Thredd is helping to change the face of the Fintech landscape by delivering industry-leading solutions to the payment and finance sectors. At the heart of our capability is our award-winning payments platform (Apex), which powers some of the world's most high-profile challenger banks, disruptors and fintech innovators. When we say we are global, we mean it; the flexibility of our platform has enabled us to work with over 100 clients, in over 60 countries operating across 150 different currencies.

If you want to be at the forefront of financial technologies in a growing business apply now!

Applicants should have the right to work in the UK. We cannot offer Visa sponsorship.

  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python).
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
  • Knowledge of payment processing system, card issuance, and related services.
  • Experience with cloud-based data solutions (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and warehouses such as Snowflake, Redshift etc.
  • Familiarity with modern data architecture such as Lakehouse.
  • Familiarity with dBT tool for data transformation.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
  • Attention to detail and a commitment to data quality and integrity.
  • Familiarity with regulatory requirements and security standards in the financial industry.

About Thredd

Thredd is helping to change the face of the Fintech landscape by delivering industry-leading solutions to the payment and finance sectors. At the heart of our capability is our award-winning payments platform (Apex), which powers some of the world's most high-profile challenger banks, disruptors and fintech innovators. When we say we are global, we mean it; the flexibility of our platform has enabled us to work with over 100 clients, in over 60 countries operating across 150 different currencies.

If you want to be at the forefront of financial technologies in a growing business apply now!

Applicants should have the right to work in the UK. We cannot offer Visa sponsorship.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Data Analyst (Governance)
Description:
WeDo is looking for a Data Analyst for a global company. Our client has been building their internal platform over the last two years, focusing on migration, and is now looking to establish a healthy reporting environment.




You will work with the Data Architect to ensure that master data is maintained. They will work with the business to ensure the governance model is followed.




The successful Data Analyst will have the following;




Proven experience maintaining data systems
SQL experience
Good understanding of Data Governance and its principles
Experience with Azure DevOps preferred
Experience with Dynamics 365 would be preferred
Ideally worked with CRM systems




The client would consider Graduates who are looking for their first role within Data!




This role is hybrid in West London - ideally 1-2 days on site every other week! Paying up to £40k + a host of other benefits.




Unfortunately this role does not offer sponsorship.




If this is of any interest, please apply and I'll be in touch.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: London, United Kingdom

Salary: £30,000




Are you passionate about numbers and strategy? I'm working with a fantastic client in Londonwho is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join their team. This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and enjoys using data to influence business decisions.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse market trends, customer behavior, and competitor pricing to recommend optimal pricing strategies
Develop pricing models and monitor their effectiveness
Work with sales and product teams to align pricing with business goals
Perform scenario analysis to forecast potential outcomes of pricing decisions
Present findings and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders
Assist in improving pricing tools, processes, and methodologies




Key Skills & Experience:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in Excel (advanced) and data analysis tools (Power BI, Tableau, or similar)
Experience with pricing strategies and financial modeling
Ability to interpret large datasets and provide actionable insights
Strong communication skills to present data and recommendations to non-technical stakeholders




What’s in it for you?

Hybrid working options for a better work-life balance
Career growth and professional development opportunities
Opportunity to impact business strategies and profitability directly
Collaborative and forward-thinking team environment




Please send your CV to Jordan.Regan@intellectgroup.co.uk for immediate consideration.

Title: TikTok LIVE Streaming Data Analyst Graduate, UK, 2025
Description:
Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Join us.

We are looking for talented individuals to join us as a graduate in 2025. Graduate programs at TikTok aim to offer students industry exposure and hands-on experience. Watch your ambitions become reality as your inspiration brings infinite opportunities at TikTok.

Join our dynamic team at TikTok LIVE, where we are passionate about revolutionizing the live streaming industry. As a leading platform, we are committed to delivering engaging, data-driven content experiences that resonate with audiences worldwide. We are looking for talented and motivated graduates to help us elevate our live streaming operations through insightful data analysis.

Responsibilities:
1. Data Collection & Analysis: Gather, process, and analyze data from live streaming sessions to identify trends, user behaviors, and key performance indicators (KPIs).
2. User Behavior Analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis of user engagement, retention, and consumption patterns to improve the overall user experience on our platform.
3. Live Streaming Performance Evaluation: Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of live streaming campaigns and events, providing actionable insights to optimize content strategies.
4. Reporting & Presentation: Create detailed reports and presentations that summarize data findings and provide recommendations for enhancing live streaming content and user interaction.
5. Collaboration: Work closely with the live operations, content strategy, and product teams to drive data-informed decisions and strategies.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree or above, graduating in 2025 and available to start in January or May 2025.
- Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a passion for data-driven decision-making.
- Familiarity with data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, or similar.
- Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights.
- Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.

Preferred Qualifications:
- Internship or project experience related to data analysis, particularly in the tech, media, or live streaming industries.
- Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
- A proactive attitude with a strong desire to learn and grow within the industry.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Compensation is one of the key levers for attracting and retaining great talent, yet most companies are struggling to get it right. They simply have no choice but to rely on poor data and unsophisticated tools for their pay decisions. That’s why we created Ravio.

We help some of the world’s most innovative and ambitious companies build stronger teams and reach their goals through better compensation. Our goal is to bring compensation into the modern age by building the ultimate real-time compensation solution. We’re passionate about ensuring everyone is paid what they deserve, no matter their background or circumstances. We believe that when compensation is done right, everyone wins.

Ravio is growing fast, which means you can too. Joining a startup in the early days and scaling it into a global product is one of the most challenging and rewarding experiences a career can offer. If that sounds exciting to you, you’re in the right place.

The Role

Our Operations team acts as the guardian of Ravio’s core benchmarking product - the foundation of our business. We are not only striving to build the world’s largest real-time compensation benchmarking database, but also the best. This means we need to set a new standard when it comes to the quality and consistency of our underlying benchmarking data. This is why our operations team exists.

Benchmarking Ops springs into action the moment a new customer starts onboarding with Ravio. The team oversees the onboarding process from start to finish and is responsible for ensuring that each customer’s data is standardised, anonymised and mapped to our internal framework with an incredibly high level of precision. The team also monitors and upholds data integrity over the course of a customer’s lifecycle with Ravio and works with multiple cross-functional teams to build and improve internal tools and processes.

Working in our Operations team requires a combination of robust analytical skills and strong business acumen. This is a cross-functional job, so being able to communicate clearly and work with a diverse group of stakeholders effectively is key. You also need to be very structured and process-driven in order to succeed in this role.

If this sounds like you and you are ready to help us build a category-defining company with global ambitions, we’d love to hear from you.

Responsibilities


Analyse customer datasets to ensure data completeness and integrity and enrich customer-supplied information with external data to improve signal strength
Validate and fine-tune the results of Ravio’s algorithmic job levelling process, ensuring the data is mapped consistently against our proprietary framework
Monitor and improve existing datasets throughout a customers’ lifecycle with the aim of upholding high data quality and integrity standards
Work cross-functionally with Ravio’s Data Science, Product, and Customer Success teams to build and continuously improve Ravio’s internal processes with the aim of achieving industry-leading data quality and integrity levels as well as delivering great customer experiences


Requirements


Structured thinker who enjoys working with data and has great attention to detail
Strong problem-solving skills and an entrepreneurial mindset
Strong prioritisation and organisational skills
Team player who thrives in a high-growth environment and embraces change
Desire to learn the ins and outs of compensation benchmarking and how Ravio’s technology can help
Advanced knowledge of SQL or general technical skills are a plus


Compensation & Benefits


Level P2: £35,000 - £45,000
Company ownership (everyone gets a meaningful equity stake in Ravio)
25 days paid holiday + bank holidays + 4 wellness days (take them anytime, no questions asked!)
Up to 6% pension matching scheme
£60 a month wellness allowance (Invest in your physical wellbeing, on us)
Private healthcare cover with AXA (we give you the freedom of choice so you can select the best medical professionals for you)
Income protection insurance (for full peace of mind in case you cannot work because of sickness or disability)
20 weeks fully paid parental leave & 8 weeks for non-birthing parent


Compensation Range: £35.5K - £45K
Show more

Compensation Range: £35.5K - £45K

Title: Junior Data & BI Analyst
Description:
Junior Data & BI Analyst:

My client are a leading name in the entertainment space. They are looking to add a Junior Data Analyst to their current team. You will be joining an established data analytics team with senior analysts to guide and mentor you. This is a permanent role based just outside of London. It is also hybrid working.

Requirements:

Proven and extensive experience with SQL.
Proven and extensive experience with Excel.
Proven experience in data visualisation with either Power BI or Tableau.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst.

What will make you stand out:

Proven experience in building dashboards in Tableau.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

If you are interested in the role please apply, to follow up please email Or drop me a message on LinkedIn and I will get back to you ASAP.

HTML:
Junior Data & BI Analyst:

My client are a leading name in the entertainment space. They are looking to add a Junior Data Analyst to their current team. You will be joining an established data analytics team with senior analysts to guide and mentor you. This is a permanent role based just outside of London. It is also hybrid working.

Requirements:

  • Proven and extensive experience with SQL.
  • Proven and extensive experience with Excel.
  • Proven experience in data visualisation with either Power BI or Tableau.
  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst.

What will make you stand out:

  • Proven experience in building dashboards in Tableau.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

If you are interested in the role please apply, to follow up please email Or drop me a message on LinkedIn and I will get back to you ASAP.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a driven and analytical Lead Analyst who thrives on turning data into actionable insights that shape company-wide KPIs. You will work cross-functionally, delivering insights that empower our teams across Marketing, Finance, and Growth to make data-driven decisions.

With your expertise in SQL and dbt you will play a pivotal role in ensuring data is at the heart of our decision-making processes, helping Gopuff achieve its key performance goals.

You Will:


Drive Business Efficiency: Analyse and enhance key metrics across customer acquisition, retention, and revenue generation. Your insights will directly influence how we improve processes, drive customer satisfaction, and optimise cost-efficiency.
Build Data Models for Strategic KPIs: Develop and maintain advanced data models using dbt to provide transparency and clarity into our core business performance metrics.
Deep Dive into Company Performance: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our KPIs are aligned with overall business objectives, identifying areas for improvement and efficiency.
Collaborate Across the Business: Partner with teams across Marketing, Growth, and Finance to ensure your data insights are not only clear but actionable for driving performance improvements.
Problem-Solve with Data: Tackle real-world challenges by using data to provide practical, strategic solutions that enhance how we operate and grow as a company.
Present Data Insights Effectively: Clearly communicate complex analyses and data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring decisions are grounded in data.


You Have:


5+ Years in Data Analytics: Proven experience in a data-driven environment, ideally in a high-growth e-commerce or retail setting.
Expertise in SQL: Advanced skills in SQL for querying large datasets and developing complex reports. Knowledge of Python or R is a plus.
dbt Experience: Strong experience building and maintaining data models using dbt.
Tools Mastery: Familiarity with BI tools such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI, with a strong ability to translate data into strategic insights.
Problem-Solver: A passion for tackling business challenges, with the ability to identify issues and propose actionable, data-driven solutions.
Strong Communicator: Ability to present data insights clearly and persuasively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Curiosity and Drive: A passion for problem-solving and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment. You’ll be excited to dive into our business performance data and uncover opportunities to drive growth.


Benefits:


A high-impact role where you’ll be directly involved in the company’s most critical operations.
Company RSU’s (Company Shares)
Private Medical + Dental cover
Annual performance appraisal and bonus
Employee Discount + FAM membership
Career growth opportunities


Company Summary & EEOC Statement:

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it—stuff happens. But that’s where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we’re assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you’re hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.
