Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Data Analyst.




Job Title: Data Analyst

Job Type: Full-Time/ Contract

Job Location : Montreal




This is a Hybrid role with 3 days in office and 2 days remote




The primary responsibility of this role is to build and maintain various reports and dashboards to track critical metrics and project stats across multiple products. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, visualization, and programming, with a particular emphasis on Python and data engineering principles. Experience with data governance practices would be advantageous.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to track critical metrics and project stats, such as firm-wide encryption status and data-in-transit encryption metrics.
Design and implement complex reporting structures to facilitate data analysis and visualization.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity within reports and dashboards.
Identify and troubleshoot issues with existing reports and dashboards, providing timely resolutions.




Skills and Qualifications

Clear communicator.
Strong sense of ownership and accountability for assigned tasks and projects.
Proven ability to work independently and manage time effectively to meet deadlines.
Meticulous attention to detail, with a focus on delivering high-quality, error-free reports and dashboards.
Proficiency in Python for data analysis and manipulation.
Basic understanding of data engineering principles, including data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
Familiarity with data governance practices and standards would be a plus.




Education and Experience

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Technology, or a related field.




If you feel you are fit for the role or have someone in your circle with the relevant experience then please apply or share your profiles with us at hr@cloudvital.ca

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is a leading alternative asset manager with a global presence and a focus on innovation. They are dedicated to harnessing the power of data to inform investment decisions and optimize performance. Joining their team means becoming part of an organization that values collaboration, innovation, and data-driven strategies.




Job Description:

Our client is seeking a Data Analyst to work closely with their investment teams, leveraging data to inform decision-making and provide insights into business performance. The successful candidate will be proficient in working with large datasets, primarily using Palantir Foundry, and have a keen eye for detail and data accuracy.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and interpret complex datasets to provide actionable insights for investment decisions.
Utilize Palantir Foundry to extract, clean, and manipulate data from multiple sources.
Create and maintain reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to support business and investment teams.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide tailored analytical solutions.
Support data governance and ensure data quality, consistency, and integrity.
Conduct ad-hoc data analyses to answer specific business questions or solve problems.
Present findings and recommendations to key stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Finance, or a related field.
2+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in finance or investment management.
Proficiency in Palantir Foundry is required.
Strong analytical skills and experience working with large datasets.
Advanced knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Experience with Python or R is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present data-driven insights to non-technical audiences.
High attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.




Benefits:

Be part of an innovative team that is shaping the future of investment management through data.
Opportunities for career growth and skill development.
Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits.
Collaborative work environment that encourages professional development.

Title: Data Analyst & BI Specialist
Description:
Who Are We?

UniUni, a North American leader in last-mile logistics, delivers tens of millions of parcels annually in Canada, from Coast to Coast, and is rapidly expanding across the United States. Founded in 2019, UniUni’s tech-driven innovation and crowdsourcing delivery model offers fast, economical, and reliable services to local, national, and international e-commerce clients.




What Do We Offer?

At UniUni, we offer exciting opportunities to our employees to achieve their career goals. If you are ready to join UniUni’s dynamic team, while working hard and having fun doing it, we invite you to apply online and let us know how you can be part of our success story.




Responsibilities：

Quickly understand business needs and translate them into data, develop and optimize logistics data dashboards and data analysis systems, support data-driven operations, and enhance business decision-making efficiency.
Develop diverse data analysis methodologies and produce analytical reports during regular operations and peak periods, deeply analyze and identify business issues, opportunities, and breakthroughs, and collaborate on horizontal optimization.
Collaborate with data product and algorithm teams to build multi-dimensional analysis, offline modeling, and visualization tools to uncover opportunities, identify risks, provide predictive warnings, and evaluate ROI, thereby enhancing data application value.
Utilize industry, business, operational, and experiential perspectives to proactively discover opportunities through business insights, data analysis, and data modeling, formulate methodologies, and propose solutions and implementation plans.




Requirements：

Over 5 years of relevant experience, preferably with a background in Statistics, Mathematics, Information Technology, or Business Analysis.
Extensive experience in commercial analysis with strong business acumen and data sensitivity, capable of developing comprehensive data analysis strategies and solutions, and driving their implementation to achieve results.
Proficient in AWS cloud services and SQL, capable of extracting key results from large datasets, with strong data analysis skills and extensive experience in commercial data analysis and modeling.
Excellent logical thinking and rapid learning abilities, capable of quickly acquiring and adapting to new domain knowledge, adept at deconstructing complex problems and applying analytical methods to solve them in a work setting.
Self-driven with strong teamwork spirit, excellent communication and coordination skills, and ability to communicate and drive projects across functions and departments.




Compensation and Benefits：

The hiring range for this position ranges from CA$70,000 - CA$97,000. Your actual level and salary will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on the following considerations: job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.




All interested applicants are requested to submit a resume. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest but only those selected for the interview process will be contacted.

Title: Power BI Analyst
Description:
About TCS:




Tata Consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 55 years. Its consulting-led, cognitive powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile™ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS has over 615,000 of the world’s best-trained consultants in 55 countries. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $27.9 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2023, and is listed on the BSE and the NSE in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.




Skills and Responsibilities:

•Designing and developing interactive dashboards and reports Collaborating with stakeholders to understand data needs

•Analyzing datasets to uncover trends and insights

•Maintaining data accuracy and integrity within BI systems

•Translating business requirements into technical specifications

•Data analytics proficiency

•Strong knowledge of SQL and data modeling techniques

•Expertise in creating Power BI dashboards

•Critical thinking for effective problem-solving.




Tata Consultancy Services Canada Inc. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). Should you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resource.

Thank you for your interest in TCS. Candidates that meet the qualification for this position will be contacted within a 2-week period. We invite you to continue to apply for other opportunities that match your profile.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
SQL Data Analyst- Healthcare




Aarista Technology is proprietary and vertically integrated technology EMR solutions enable providers to enhance medication adherence through improved access, owned physician network, information sharing, data analytics, and customizable insights.




We are looking for an experience SQL Data Analyst specializing in writing SQL and understanding healthcare data. This person will play a key role on the core product and development team that is working on building our next generation suite of EMR products. As a member of our core product and development team, this person will contribute significantly to the business and clinical requirements designing and implementing various product features using agile methodologies.




Your Role

Full understanding of Aarista Datasets.
Perform impact analysis of existing datasets and new datasets
Collaborate with various teams and other stakeholders build queries to meet requirements.
Test and validate.
Brainstorm with your team to conceptualize and build new features.

You

You are the expert with writing queries using Azure SQL
You have a good knowledge and understanding of relational data modelling methodologies
You are a motivated, enthusiastic person looking for a rewarding position with a great innovative startup and want to achieve big things with us.
You thrive in a team environment but can also work independently.
You are passionate about using your knowledge and skills to solve real healthcare problems and are motivated by understanding the value that your work adds.
A self-starter that can manage their own workload and an ever-growing task list.
A team player and leader.
Problem solving of potential roadblocks which could potentially impact patient care, strategic, and technical goals of the business.
Consistently meeting timelines and deliverables.

Skills Recent experience with healthcare datasets and expert in writing SQL in Azure SQL and/or SQL Server environments




Job Types: Full-time currently hybrid but could change to full-time in office based on companies’ decision.




Pay: Competitive pay and benefits and valuable startup stock options

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview:

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst with additional responsibilities in data

integration and product data syndication to join our team. This role will combine data analysis,

business intelligence development, and data flow management to support our business

initiatives and enhance decision-making processes.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis and Business Intelligence

1. Plan, design, develop, and document SQL views to support various business needs.

2. Create, maintain, and optimize PowerBI dashboards for multiple stakeholders.

3. Provide insights and analysis through data visualization to support business decision-

making.

4. Collaborate with business users to gather requirements and ensure dashboards meet

their needs.




Product Data Syndication

1. Ensure accurate and timely syndication of product data to various partners.

2. Monitor and report on data syndication performance and resolve any issues.

3. Collaborate with internal teams to gather and prepare product data for syndication.




Data Flow Management

1. Oversee the end-to-end process of data flow from source systems to central databases.

2. Implement and maintain ETL processes to ensure data integrity and consistency.

3. Conduct regular audits and data quality checks to ensure accuracy and completeness.

4. Work closely with other departments to address data-related issues and optimize data

flow processes.




Qualifications:

1. 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment.

2. Proven experience in data analysis, SQL, and business intelligence tools like PowerBI.

3. Able to understand and connect applications to data sources (integrations and APIs).

4. Experience with or willingness to learn about product data syndication.

5. Understanding of ETL processes and data flow management.

6. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

7. Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

8. Attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy and integrity.

9. Nice to have: Experience with manufacturing or distribution environments.

Title: Analyst, Data & Analytics
Description:
Permanent Full Time

We are looking for an Analyst, Data & Analytics

As an Analyst Data & Analytics, you will join Canada Life’s Canada Operations, Data Analytics and Reporting team. In this role you will support all Canada Operations teams with the development, implementation, and maintenance of analytics solutions ranging from descriptive and diagnostic to predictive.

The Analyst, Data & Analytics supports decision making, monitors business performance, and provides actionable insights using analytics and statistical techniques.

In this role, you will assist in modelling, analysing, and predicting business processes. You will translate business requirements into data, reporting, and analytics projects, which you will support throughout their entire lifecycle.

What you will do


Translate business needs into data requirements, collect, integrate, clean, explore, model, and analyze large datasets and visualize results and present to business leaders
Build, implement and maintain data models, custom reports, and dashboards
Work with large datasets that are not consistent, clean, or fully modelled
Communicate effectively and demonstrate critical thinking and business acumen.
Define, implement, and monitor metrics and KPIs and ensure ongoing strategic alignment with short and long-term business objectives
Enable effective, efficient working relationships with business partners
Work closely with senior leaders to understand business drivers and enable them to make decisions based on data
Support projects throughout the entire analytics lifecycle
Present and communicate insights and recommendations in a visual and simplified manner


What you will bring


1-3 years of relevant experience and a bachelor’s degree in a related field of study, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Demonstrated experience in working with data analytics tools (SQL, Python), Databases (SQL Server), Cloud (Azure, Databricks), data visualisation tools (Power BI) with experience at creating interactive dashboards
Ability to write efficient SQL and Python queries to extract, integrate, and transform data from multiple sources, and to automate data pipelines
Proficiency in Power BI, Data Modelling, Power Query, and DAX
Experience working with raw data and manipulating large datasets
Good knowledge in data analytics and statistical modelling
Strong communication and presentation skills
Proven ability to learn quickly and independently and handle multiple priorities in a challenging work environment
Experience within the Financial Services sector would be an asset


The base salary for this position is between $54,300.00- $100,000.00 annually. This represents base salary only and does not represent other variable compensation components of our total compensation ( i.e. annual bonus, commission etc). If you are selected to move forward in our recruitment process, your recruiter will be able to discuss additional details of our total rewards program with you.

Career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting, closing dates will vary depending on the search activity. All applications received will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today!

Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.

Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.

Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations. 

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential. 

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Canada Life policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact talentacquisitioncanada@canadalife.com.

Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Tarion is hiring for a full-time, permanent Business Data Analyst to join our Underwriting Department.




Title: Business Data Analyst

Department: Underwriting

Type of Position: Full Time, Contract - 12 Months

Location: 7th Floor, 5160 Yonge Street, Toronto, ON

Reporting to: Manager, Analytics

Work Model: Hybrid – flexible work schedule (All remote work must be completed from your home office within the province of Ontario.)




About Tarion




Since 1976, Tarion has served new home buyers and new homeowners by ensuring that one of their life’s biggest investments is protected. Almost every new home in the province is covered by a new home warranty. This warranty protection is provided by Ontario’s builders and lasts up to seven years. It is backstopped by Tarion. More than 375,000 homes are currently enrolled in the warranty program. Every year about 55,000 new homes are enrolled.




How We Make a Difference




A home is one of life’s biggest purchases. As an independent, not-for-profit organization, Tarion provides Ontario’s new home buyers and owners with peace of mind that their purchase is safeguarded through the province’s new home warranty and protection program.




Almost every new home in the province is covered by a new home warranty. Tarion ensures consumer protection by providing free tools, guides and resources to help homeowners understand their builder’s warranty and navigate warranty claims with confidence.

If a builder does not meet their warranty commitments, Tarion offers guidance to help homeowners ensure they receive the coverage they’re entitled to, and when necessary, steps in to help resolve warranty claims.




This is a hybrid role requiring working two (2) days in the office and three (3) days remotely, per week. (All remote work must be completed from your home office within the province of Ontario.)




About the Role




Tarion’s Analytics team is part of the Underwriting department. The main goal of the group is to provide summarized reports or data to internal and external stakeholders. In addition, the team works closely with our Information Systems department to ensure that the systems meet the department requirements and processes. We strive for service excellence and take pride in the work we do and always look for creative ways to improve our reports and processes.




Responsibilities include:




Prepare financial and operational reports for internal and external stakeholders (including Builders, Surety Companies, Ministries, etc.) on ad-hoc, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual basis.
Work with the data utilizing all business applications – Salesforce, FMS, BuilderLink, custom applications
Gather business requirements for requested data/reports by doing the following:




Determine whether data exists in Datamart and if not work with the developers to ensure that the data is available to report on.
Test the data to ensure accuracy and validity in the reporting tool and ensure data dictionaries are up to date.
Develop required reports that includes data sets, summaries, visualization tools (dashboards, graphs) and analysis




Provide continuous support and assistance with reporting needs to different departments on an on-going basis
Act as SMEs on projects to ensure that Datamarts are up to date with new or changed required data. Determine the impacts to existing reports and requirements to develop new reports.
Work closely with business users from different departments, including Underwriting, Warranty Services, Finance, IS, etc., to ensure data integrity and validity
Stay updated with latest trends, tools and techniques in data analysis




A great candidate for this position will have:




University Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or Information Management
3 – 5 years’ progressive experience working as an operational analyst in financial services or the insurance industry would be an asset
Experience with utilizing a variety of research and data analysis techniques is preferred
Accounting related experience would be beneficial
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Proficiency in SAP Web Intelligence, and/or other Business Intelligence tools
High level of verbal and written communication skills
Ability and keen willingness to work in a team environment with all levels of the organization
Proven experience in solving complex problems
Demonstrated ability to balance multiple priorities in a dynamic environment
Detailed oriented and well-developed organizational skills
Ability to meet tight deadlines
Excellent Customer Service/People Skills
Understanding of company processes and procedures




Why Choose Tarion?




We believe that Tarion’s employees are its most valuable asset. We strive to provide a welcoming work environment.




We offer employees a competitive compensation program, opportunities for learning and development, an employee discount program, access to wellness programs, and a variety of Employee Assistance Program tools and online resources to support well-being.




At Tarion, we believe that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion allows employees to perform at their very best and underpins a culture in which everyone feels they have an equal opportunity to belong and build a career. Tarion is committed to developing and maintaining work environments and practices that ensure equality of opportunity in recruitment, selection and promotion, and to removing systemic barriers so that employees have every opportunity to feel included in the workplace.




If you are a person with a disability and have questions or would like help with your application, please email careers@tarion.com or contact a member of the Human Resources Department.




Application Submissions & Deadline:

Please submit a covering letter and resume with vacancy code BDA092324 by applying online at Join our team!

We believe that Tarion’s employees are its most valuable asset. We strive to provide a welcoming work environment.

Please submit a covering letter and resume with vacancy code BDA092324 by applying online at Join our team!

Title: Data Analyst, Medical - Remote
Description:
Sales Analyst, Medical

Division: Medical Sales

Hours: 40 hours per week, Monday - Friday

Employment type: full-time permanent employment

Job location: Alberta, Saskatchewan, Manitoba, Ontario, or Quebec (remote opportunity)

A little about us

Hi, we’re Aurora Cannabis, and we’re so excited to meet you!

We’re a global cannabis company with operations across Europe and North and South America. We’re driven by our passion to help people improve their lives and have a diverse team who bring their best every day, so Aurora can be the cannabis provider of choice for patients and consumers. We love our work, and we especially love our high quality, innovative brands that make up the Aurora family – from Aurora, Aurora Drift, San Rafael ’71, Greybeard and Whistler.

Our people combined with our collective passion for the industry is what makes Aurora a special place to work and defines what we call our “A-Team”. We are a high-performing team of cannabis experts, innovators, and champions, that work, learn and win together. We think BIG, act BOLD and execute with PURPOSE in all that we do, and will stop at nothing to cultivate the ultimate cannabis experience for our community.


Job summary

This role is crucial in providing reporting solutions, developing predictive models, and uncovering actionable insights, with a particular focus on identifying leading indicators for customer churn and retention. The position involves analyzing large datasets, collaborating with team members to interpret findings, and presenting recommendations for data-driven business strategies. Sound interesting? Here is a little more…

As the Sales Analyst, Medical you will be responsible for:


Develop a comprehensive understanding of cannabis consumers motivated by medical needs.
Analyze large datasets using statistical analysis tools such as Python and R.
Generate reports and visualizations with Excel and Power BI.
Conduct cohort analysis and customer segmentation to understand patient behavior patterns.
Perform churn analysis and develop predictive models for customer retention using machine learning techniques.
Analyze patient feedback and sentiment data to identify areas for improvement.
Collaborate with marketing team to analyze campaign effectiveness and optimize customer acquisition strategies.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business questions into analytical frameworks.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders, using data storytelling techniques to drive decision-making.
Stay current with industry trends and emerging analytics technologies, recommending new tools or methodologies as appropriate.



You’re the ideal candidate if you have…


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance/Economics, Data Science, or a related discipline.
2+ years of experience in data analysis or a related role.
Proven track record of using data analysis to drive business insights and decision-making.
Experience working with large datasets and performing data cleaning, transformation, and analysis.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Power BI and Excel.
Familiarity with statistical analysis and programming languages like Python or R.
Familiarity with predictive modeling techniques and machine learning algorithms.



Bonus points if you have…


Intense curiosity in the pursuit of knowledge.
Strong empathy with customers who have medical needs.
Highly organized with an ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment.
Capable of critical and analytical thinking.
Keen to identify patterns and how to translate the insights into actionable recommendations.
Proficiency in Python and R for statistical analysis and data manipulation.



Why you’ll love working at Aurora


Flexibility: you will enjoy a flexible work environment that is the perfect blend of work and fun! You will be empowered to achieve work-life balance with flexible hours, remote work options, meeting-free-Friday-afternoons and more!
Total Rewards: we will motivate you to go above and beyond with a competitive salary, professional development opportunities, company SWAG, team activities and modern technology.
Team: we are a diverse and global team of cannabis enthusiasts, energetic innovators, fitness gurus, caring parents, foodies and more, with a collective passion to nurture an inclusive environment that helps you grow and provide people better days with cannabis.



Next steps
Apply today by submitting your resume through our website. You can expect your application to be reviewed by our Talent Acquisition Team and we will contact you if we see a fit via email.

Think you’re the ideal candidate but you don’t meet all the requirements? Apply anyways. We would love to review your application to see if you’re the right fit or find you an alternative opportunity. Not the role for you? Share this posting with your network while subscribing to our Talent Community to learn more about upcoming opportunities (hot tip: if you are an Aurora employee, take advantage of the employee referral program by sharing this posting with someone in your network! If they are the successful candidate, you may be eligible for a bonus!).

Diversity and inclusion
At Aurora, we are proud to foster and celebrate a diverse community of professionals! We take pride in nurturing an inclusive culture that empowers our people to be their authentic selves, celebrate their differences and love where they work.

Our diverse community combined with our inclusive culture, is what sets us apart in the industry and equips our A-Team with superpowers – and this is why, we encourage all candidates to apply for job opportunities regardless of race, national origin, colour, religion, age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital and family status, disability, or any other identifying characteristic. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site or alternate format of job posting) during the recruitment and selection process, please do not hesitate to let our team know!

  • Analyze patient feedback and sentiment data to identify areas for improvement.
  • Collaborate with marketing team to analyze campaign effectiveness and optimize customer acquisition strategies.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business questions into analytical frameworks.
  • Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders, using data storytelling techniques to drive decision-making.
  • Stay current with industry trends and emerging analytics technologies, recommending new tools or methodologies as appropriate.


You’re the ideal candidate if you have…

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance/Economics, Data Science, or a related discipline.
  • 2+ years of experience in data analysis or a related role.
  • Proven track record of using data analysis to drive business insights and decision-making.
  • Experience working with large datasets and performing data cleaning, transformation, and analysis.
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Power BI and Excel.
  • Familiarity with statistical analysis and programming languages like Python or R.
  • Familiarity with predictive modeling techniques and machine learning algorithms.


Bonus points if you have…

  • Intense curiosity in the pursuit of knowledge.
  • Strong empathy with customers who have medical needs.
  • Highly organized with an ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment.
  • Capable of critical and analytical thinking.
  • Keen to identify patterns and how to translate the insights into actionable recommendations.
  • Proficiency in Python and R for statistical analysis and data manipulation.


Why you’ll love working at Aurora

  • Flexibility: you will enjoy a flexible work environment that is the perfect blend of work and fun! You will be empowered to achieve work-life balance with flexible hours, remote work options, meeting-free-Friday-afternoons and more!
  • Total Rewards: we will motivate you to go above and beyond with a competitive salary, professional development opportunities, company SWAG, team activities and modern technology.
  • Team: we are a diverse and global team of cannabis enthusiasts, energetic innovators, fitness gurus, caring parents, foodies and more, with a collective passion to nurture an inclusive environment that helps you grow and provide people better days with cannabis.


Next steps
Apply today by submitting your resume through our website. You can expect your application to be reviewed by our Talent Acquisition Team and we will contact you if we see a fit via email.

Think you’re the ideal candidate but you don’t meet all the requirements? Apply anyways. We would love to review your application to see if you’re the right fit or find you an alternative opportunity. Not the role for you? Share this posting with your network while subscribing to our Talent Community to learn more about upcoming opportunities (hot tip: if you are an Aurora employee, take advantage of the employee referral program by sharing this posting with someone in your network! If they are the successful candidate, you may be eligible for a bonus!).

Diversity and inclusion
At Aurora, we are proud to foster and celebrate a diverse community of professionals! We take pride in nurturing an inclusive culture that empowers our people to be their authentic selves, celebrate their differences and love where they work.

Our diverse community combined with our inclusive culture, is what sets us apart in the industry and equips our A-Team with superpowers – and this is why, we encourage all candidates to apply for job opportunities regardless of race, national origin, colour, religion, age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital and family status, disability, or any other identifying characteristic. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site or alternate format of job posting) during the recruitment and selection process, please do not hesitate to let our team know!

Title: Data Analyst (Capital Markets, SQL, Python)
Description:
Role: Data Analyst (Capital Markets, SQL, Python)

Location: Mississauga, ON

Type: Contract

Job Description

The Senior Data Analyst will be a key contributor to the analytical functions in support of the business's strategic decision-making process. With a strong foundation in SQL and Python, the ideal candidate will possess in-depth knowledge and experience in the capital markets or banking domain. This role involves working with large datasets, extracting insights, and providing actionable recommendations to drive business growth and efficiency.

Responsibilities


Develop and maintain complex SQL queries for data analysis and extraction.
Use Python for data manipulation, cleaning, and analysis, leveraging libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and SciPy.
Manage and ensure the integrity of large datasets essential for analysis.
Translate data into meaningful insights that address business questions and opportunities.
Create and automate reports, dashboards, and visualizations using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Present complex analytical findings in a clear, concise manner to stakeholders and executive teams.
Work closely with business units to identify and analyze core business processes and workflows.
Facilitate data-driven decision-making by providing timely, accurate, and relevant information.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including IT, Finance, Risk Management, and Operations to support company objectives.
Communicate complex data concepts and the implications of analyses to a non-technical audience.
Support strategic initiatives through scenario modeling and impact analysis.
Contribute to the development and implementation of new data analysis methodologies.
Maintain an up-to-date understanding of the capital markets or banking industry trends, regulations, and best practices.
Apply domain knowledge to enhance data analysis and interpretation.


Requirements


Minimum of 7 years of experience in a data analysis role within the capital markets or banking sector.
Expertise in SQL and Python is a must.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience with data visualization and business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks and projects.
Understanding of data warehousing and ETL processes.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and machine learning techniques is a plus.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title – Reporting and Innovation Data Analyst

Duration: 10 Months

Location: Montreal, Canada

Pay Rate: CAD $32.59/hr.




Business Overview:

The Client Engagement & Protection organization is tasked with delivering client-centric service in compliance with internal and regulatory frameworks. Within Client Engagement & Protection, the Due Diligence Regulatory Reporting team’s objective is to provide reporting support to all operating teams within Client Engagement & Protection for the Americas ensuring that there are consistent escalations to Management when necessary. In addition to day-to-day reporting requests, the team will be responsible for providing all supporting internal and external audit items ensuring that there is a centralized and cohesive response from the department.




The responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Establish and maintain Client Engagement & Protection (CEP) processes for the Americas CIB platform in compliance with local and company-established regulations
Provide key Due Diligence & Client Service metrics and partner with the Monitoring & Controls teams to ensure effective processes and controls.
Confer with stakeholders for Americas CEP platform in compliance with company established regulations to identify and document requirements.
Analyze information systems (GCARS, FENERGO, etc.), processes (KYC, Client Services, Monitoring and Controls, etc.) and propose customized solutions to improve performance and efficiency for various teams in CEP.
Design, develop, integrate, test and implement information systems business solutions for process automations and performance improvements.
Provide advice on information systems strategy, policy, management, security, service delivery and produce regular reporting and analysis for management on the reporting items and emerging issues.
Act as a liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams for various projects and audit requirements.
Conduct tests to ensure the reliability, accuracy, and functionality of system changes and enhancements in company reporting systems.
Assist in operationalizing existing policies and procedures.
Develop efficient procedures & tools and possess an interest in process redesign.
Provide day to day reporting support across the Americas region as well as assist with any ad-hoc requests.
Support all internal and external audit requests by providing all client related reporting and ensuring the accuracy of all supporting documentation.
Define and provide key reporting metrics to the various stakeholders within Client Engagement & Protection
Develop and produce regular reporting and analysis for management on the regulatory risk items and emerging issues.
Provide analytical support to business and functional management on regulatory matters as needed.




Education and Work:

• Bachelor’s degree in finance, Economics, or other related field of study

• Strong IT Understanding (Power BI, VBA, Power Query, MS Office tools, etc.)

• Prior experience creating and maintaining databases.

• Flexibility and adaptability to new situations and scenarios

• Capability to multi-task, handle multiple projects at one time, and positively manage tight timelines.

• Strong database management & Excel experience

Preferred Qualifications:

• Strong functional expertise in one or more areas (Risk, Legal, Due Diligence, Client Engagement & Protection, Operations)

• Understanding POWERBI, VBA, POWER Query etc.

• Deep understanding of banking regulations and operations

• Proven ability to execute complex projects with large number of dependencies.

• Experience in communicating and producing presentations to senior management.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Bring your Knowledge of Power BI and Data Analysis

To our Information Technology Team




CPA Ontario is currently in search of a Data Analyst who will be responsible for extracting, analyzing, and interpreting financial data from various sources to support strategic decision-making and operational initiatives. As part of our Enterprise Architecture team, you will work closely with other cross-functional departments including IT, Finance and Operations, collaborating with business stakeholders to provide actionable insights and recommendations. As a Data Analyst you will be accountable for understanding data needs, working to design and develop reports and dashboards, and conducting thorough data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.




What You’ll Be Doing:

Working collaboratively with business stakeholders within IT, Business Intelligence and Finance departments and other operational teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.




Extracting, cleaning, and manipulating large datasets from multiple sources including financial databases, CRM systems, ERP systems, and spreadsheets.




Performing analysis of data to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement.




Designing and developing reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to present findings in a clear and concise manner.




Preparing regular and ad-hoc reports and dashboards to communicate findings to stakeholders.




Conducting variance analysis and performance reporting to support budgeting and forecasting processes.




Assisting in the design and implementation of data collection systems and strategies to optimize efficiency and data quality.




Administering, monitoring, supporting and maintaining SQL servers in our environment.




Staying current in industry trends and best practices in data analysis and modeling.




Who You Are:

A post-secondary graduate preferably in information systems, information technology, computer science, or related field.




Experienced in working with databases and ERP systems with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in a Data Analyst role.




Proficient in SQL, Microsoft Excel and data processing tools and software – in particular Power BI.




Proficient in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and SharePoint. Experience with Salesforce or other CRM considered an asset.




Highly organized and able to manage projects and timelines within tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.




Able to work efficiently and effectively as a team member, as well as independently.




An excellent communicator with the ability to convey ideas succinctly and conveying complex findings and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders with ease.




A self-starter with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think analytically about solutions.




Committed to ongoing training and a desire to learn new skills and continually expand upon knowledge and expertise.




What We Offer:

A fast-paced environment. Collaboration, innovation and passionate professionals are at our core. We relentlessly pursue what’s next to unlock the full potential of you and us together.




Flexible work environments. As part of our Hybrid work culture, we provide flexible, remote work options to support you in your career, in addition to in-office teamwork and collaboration.




Diversity and inclusion. We recognize the value in our differences and prioritize inclusivity to bring together the best talent to protect the public, advance the profession and enable CPAs to lead business and society forward.




Ongoing learning and career growth. We want your career to skyrocket. We support career advancement and professional development opportunities with learning investments to promote your future growth. Thrive with us.




Focus on your well-being. With industry leading benefits and wellness programs, including a healthy lifestyle allowance, mental health resources and more, we’re committed to your well-being.




Who We Are:

We protect the public. We advance the profession. We enable CPAs to lead business and society forward. We ensure that our 103,000 members and 18,000 students meet the highest standards of integrity and expertise. We help them stay ahead of global market trends and abreast of regulatory change. CPAs represent a globally recognized, premium designation. Our Chartered Professional Accountants are valued by organizations in all industries for their financial expertise, strategic thinking, management skills and leadership. We believe that success happens when both business and society benefit. For information on the profession visit: cpaontario.ca.




We Appreciate Your Interest In CPA Ontario And This Position:

At CPA Ontario, we are committed to building high-performance teams. Our selection process is thorough, and all candidate applications are reviewed. Should your qualifications and experience meet the requirements of this role, a member of our recruitment team will contact you. We encourage you to set up CPA Ontario job alerts for positions that align to your experience and career goals.




CPA Ontario is an inclusive employer. Accommodation is available under the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require a disability-related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please email accessibility@cpaontario.ca with “Accommodation Required” in the subject line to provide your contact information. A member of the Recruitment team will contact you within 48 hours.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Company Profile:

Join one of the fastest growing companies in Canada! LawDepot is proud to be a seven-time Growth 500 ranked organization and a major player in the Global legal solutions industry. Our mission is to modernize the legal document creation experience by empowering people with fast, easy-to-use, and professional solutions. With over ten million satisfied customers worldwide, over two million monthly website visitors, and billions of dollars saved on legal fees, you will be joining a team that is truly making a difference. At LawDepot, we foster a collaborative and inclusive learning culture that values excellence and diversity. Apply today and become a part of our exciting journey!




Position Overview:

LawDepot.com is currently expanding and looking to recruit a Business Data Analyst in Edmonton, Alberta. Working with the Revenue Operations team, this position will be responsible for performing in-depth analysis of the user behavior on our Checkout pages. This is a full-time permanent position, working 37.5 hours per week with opportunities for a hybrid work schedule.




Primary Responsibilities:

Conduct usage analysis on experiment and non-experiment data to understand customer behavior on the Checkout page
Analyze and understand why customers take certain actions
Develop plans to track Checkout page usage and to improve event reporting
Improve and maintain automated reports
Communicate data analysis results and recommendations
Create new projects based on experiment results
Collaborate with analysts, software developers, and key stakeholders
Deliver data-based recommendations and identify next steps
Discover data trends and findings across different projects & experiments
Review and consult on experiment design and implementation
Build attribution models for website event tracking
Create reports and data visualizations to increase the quality of analysis being delivered
Collaboratively identify relevant KPIs for individual projects, and engagement metrics (usage, renewals, etc.) and how they should be measured
Help Senior Data Analysts with planning future phases for various projects
Create quarterly/annual reports and presentations




Knowledge and Skill Requirements:

Post-secondary education in Business, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or other Analysis related programs
In-depth understanding of relational database structure and principles
Experience with statistical analysis
High level of proficiency with SQL coding, creating reports, and running queries
Knowledge in data analysis and visualizations tools (like Python, R, D3.js, Matplotlib, etc.)
Proficiency using Microsoft Excel (Pivot Tables, Visualizations, Formulas) and Project Management software
Experience conducting financial analysis on large datasets
Knowledge of data mining and segmentation techniques
Ability to work independently and manage complex projects
Ability to summarize complicated analysis and make it easy to understand
Strong interest in data analysis and developing creative solutions to problems




Why You Should Join the LawDepot Team:

Excellent total compensation package
Comprehensive health and dental benefits, plus an additional Health Care Spending Account
Great work life balance (37.5 hour work weeks, flexible schedules, ability to bank hours)
Three weeks paid vacation, plus bonus personal days
Continuous learning opportunities, including LinkedIn Learning subscriptions and training budgets
Company share plan
Free catered lunches for the entire office
Monthly social events for team members to enjoy (think axe throwing, rock climbing, board games, food trucks, trivia contests, and charitable activities)
Casual work environment
Personal offices for focused work and to have your individual space (plus collaborative workspaces for when you want to meet with the team)
Free and easily accessible parking
Southgate Mall, Whyte Ave, and Calgary Trail restaurants are only minutes away
Hybrid working arrangements for that balance between getting work done at home and engaging with others in the office




How to Apply:

Please submit a resume and cover letter by email to career@lawdepot.ca or submit online via our Careers page at https://www.lawdepot.com/career




We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst - co-op - Winter 2025
Description:
Change the future with us.

We are passionate about innovations that mean real progress. We are excited about technologies that still need to be developed. What about you? Do you want to use your curiosity, passion, and creativity to make the lives of millions of people easier and better? Join us as a graduate –either by beginning your career with us or through a co-op placement. Whichever path you take, we’re looking forward to seeing your perspective.

Why you’ll love working for Siemens!


Freedom and a healthy work- life balance– Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.
Solve the world’s most significant problems – Be part of exciting and innovative projects.
Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.
Opportunities to advance your career and mentorship programs on a local and global scale.
Competitive total rewards package
Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education, access to technology and sustaining communities and make a positive impact on the community.
Participate in our celebrations, social events and offsite business events.
Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!
Employee perks and discounts.
Diversity and inclusivity focused.


Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Canada’s Greenest Employers 2023, Canada’s Top Employers for Young People 2024 and Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2022.

What will you do?

Siemens RuggedCom is a leader in the development of rugged communication networking solutions designed for mission critical applications in harsh environments. We are an innovative, rapidly growing company where you'll find an exciting, dynamic work environment and significant opportunity for personal growth.

We are looking for a Data Analyst for our Concord office who would report directly to the Head of Lean & Business Excellence for the Winter Term (Jan - April, 2025); someone with good analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills.

Responsibilities:

This role provides an opportunity to gain experience in data analytics and automation. The responsibilities include developing data processing workflows, automation, visualization, and dashboards.

What will you need to succeed?


Candidates must be either third-year undergraduate students or graduate students pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics with a focus on data analytics.
Having completed at least one co-op term is a strong asset
The ideal candidate will be familiar with or have experience in some or all the following areas:
Python
SQL
Snowflake / dbt
Power BI
Tableau
Interface design concepts such as user experience, information architecture, data modelling, visual design, etc.
Strong communication and written skills
Strong knowledge of MS Excel
Must be available for a 4-month contract starting Jan 2025
Must be available to work on-site at the Concord office an average of 2 days per week.

About Us.

We share our ideas and champion the people behind them.

Siemens Canada is a technology company focused on industry, infrastructure, transport, and healthcare. From more resource-efficient factories, resilient supply chains, and smarter buildings and grids, to cleaner and more comfortable transportation as well as advanced healthcare, the company creates technology with purpose, adding real value for customers since 1912. By combining the real and the digital worlds, Siemens empowers its customers to transform their industries and markets, to transform the everyday for billions of people. Siemens also owns a majority stake in the publicly listed company Siemens Healthineers, a globally leading medical technology provider shaping the future of healthcare. In addition, Siemens holds a minority stake in Siemens Energy, a global leader in the transmission and generation of electrical power. As of September 30, 2023, the company has approximately 4,200 employees from coast-to-coast and 33 office and production facilities across Canada. Siemens Canada has a revenue of ~ CAD $2Billion.

Siemens is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, Siemens Canada will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

By submitting personal information to Siemens Canada Limited or its affiliates, service providers and agents, you consent to our collection, use and disclosure of such information for the purposes described in our Privacy Notice available at www.siemens.ca.

Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour ce poste.

HTML:
Change the future with us.

We are passionate about innovations that mean real progress. We are excited about technologies that still need to be developed. What about you? Do you want to use your curiosity, passion, and creativity to make the lives of millions of people easier and better? Join us as a graduate –either by beginning your career with us or through a co-op placement. Whichever path you take, we’re looking forward to seeing your perspective.

Why you’ll love working for Siemens!

  • Freedom and a healthy work- life balance– Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.
  • Solve the world’s most significant problems – Be part of exciting and innovative projects.
  • Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.
  • Opportunities to advance your career and mentorship programs on a local and global scale.
  • Competitive total rewards package
  • Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education, access to technology and sustaining communities and make a positive impact on the community.
  • Participate in our celebrations, social events and offsite business events.
  • Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!
  • Employee perks and discounts.
  • Diversity and inclusivity focused.

Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Canada’s Greenest Employers 2023, Canada’s Top Employers for Young People 2024 and Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2022.

What will you do?

Siemens RuggedCom is a leader in the development of rugged communication networking solutions designed for mission critical applications in harsh environments. We are an innovative, rapidly growing company where you'll find an exciting, dynamic work environment and significant opportunity for personal growth.

We are looking for a Data Analyst for our Concord office who would report directly to the Head of Lean & Business Excellence for the Winter Term (Jan - April, 2025); someone with good analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills.

Responsibilities:

This role provides an opportunity to gain experience in data analytics and automation. The responsibilities include developing data processing workflows, automation, visualization, and dashboards.

What will you need to succeed?

  • Candidates must be either third-year undergraduate students or graduate students pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics with a focus on data analytics.
  • Having completed at least one co-op term is a strong asset
  • The ideal candidate will be familiar with or have experience in some or all the following areas:
    • Python
    • SQL
    • Snowflake / dbt
    • Power BI
    • Tableau
  • Interface design concepts such as user experience, information architecture, data modelling, visual design, etc.
  • Strong communication and written skills
  • Strong knowledge of MS Excel
  • Must be available for a 4-month contract starting Jan 2025
  • Must be available to work on-site at the Concord office an average of 2 days per week.

Title: Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
About Our Client

This innovative Global technology-based company is looking for a Data Analyst for a full-time/permanent position that is fully remote.

Responsibilities


Analyze large sets of data daily using Looker, Tableau
ETLs, data preparation using different frameworks and SQL
Generate suggestions on how to run the processes/ad monetization more efficiently
Optimize auction floors (Google Ad Manager, SSP/RTB)
Work with stakeholders to prepare reports that will help them on a daily basis
Maintain a set of reports with data being accurate and timely
Visualize data and make it meaningful
Collaborate with engineering team to automate daily routine for better efficiency


Requirements


2+ years of experience in an analytical position of Media-related


Company


Experience with Google Ad Manager and pricing rules optimization
Experience with data analysis methods
Advanced skills in Spreadsheet Software, such as Excel or Google Sheets


required, including SQL (ability to write complex queries and ETLs)


Experience with Business Information Software, such as Tableau or Looker


(with skills in data visualization)


Strong presentation skills, attention to detail, and communication abilities
Experience working in a fast-changing environment, adaptability to the


changes and shifting priorities


Strong analytical, organizational, and task management skills.

Title: Data Analyst, Enterprise
Description:
theScore , a wholly-owned subsidiary of PENN Entertainment , empowers millions of sports fans through its digital media and sports betting products. Its media app ‘theScore’ is one of the most popular in North America, delivering fans highly personalized live scores, news, stats, and betting information from their favorite teams, leagues, and players. theScore’s sports betting app ‘theScore Bet Sportsbook & Casino’ delivers an immersive and holistic mobile sports betting and iCasino experience. theScore Bet is currently live in the Company's home province of Ontario. theScore also creates and distributes innovative digital content through its web, social and esports platforms.

About The Role & Team

On the Data Insights & Analytics team, our mission is to develop high-quality and sustainable data-driven solutions to improve profitability, growth, and the user experience. As an Enterprise Data Analyst, your primary goal will involve making operational improvements to the Data Analytics stack; increasing the performance and stability of the system, improving data quality, and ensuring Data Analysts are upholding best practices in coding and documentation. You’ll work with other Analytics verticals (your stakeholders!) to understand their operational pain points (slow queries, inefficient dashboards, data quality issues, etc.), monitor components of the Analytics stack, and make improvements to our codebase. The ideal candidate has strong SQL and Database Management skills, experience working with a similar tech stack, a passion for data, and an interest in professional sports, betting & eSports.

About The Work

As a key member of our Data Analytics team, you will:


Help enhance the useability and adoption of a data exploration tool across the organization.
Reduce query and model run times, simplify inter-DAG dependencies, and continuously improve on best practices and documentation.
Liaise with analytics engineers to build curated data models and solve related issues.
Assist team members in solving data issues related to both analysis and modeling.
Develop a deep understanding of how users interact with theScore/ESPN Bet apps and websites.
Complete analyses and present clear recommendations to business stakeholders.
Identify opportunities to apply data modeling and advanced analytics techniques to drive insights.
Peer review team's analyses to ensure data and insights shared are accurate and informative.
Mentor Junior Data Analysts.
Work with the leadership team to help define strategy & direction of Analytics at theScore.
Stay on top of emerging trends in media, sports betting, analytics & marketing industries.


About You


University degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business, or related field.
3+ years of experience in analytics, preferably at a digital company.
Strong knowledge of relational databases and SQL.
Experience with data exploration tools such as: Looker, Mode, ThoughtSpot, Tableau, Power BI, and Periscope/Sisense.
Experience with dbt or dbt Cloud.
Experience with modern data warehouses such as: Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake, and Synapse.
A passion and curiosity for solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.
Ability to take complex data and present it in a clear manner to cross-functional groups.
Ability to focus in a fast paced environment and multitask.
Excellent written and oral communications skills.
Knowledge of analysis tools; R or Python packages preferred.


What We Offer


Competitive compensation package
Fun, relaxed work environment
Education and conference reimbursements.
Parental leave top up
Opportunities for career progression and mentoring others


Candidates residing in Ontario requiring special accommodation can email accessibilityoffice@thescore.com

theScore is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability or age.

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing
Description:
theScore, a wholly-owned subsidiary of PENN Entertainment , empowers millions of sports fans through its digital media and sports betting products. Its media app ‘theScore’ is one of the most popular in North America, delivering fans highly personalized live scores, news, stats, and betting information from their favorite teams, leagues, and players. theScore’s sports betting app ‘theScore Bet Sportsbook & Casino’ delivers an immersive and holistic mobile sports betting and iCasino experience. theScore Bet is currently live in the Company's home province of Ontario. theScore also creates and distributes innovative digital content through its web, social and esports platforms.

About The Role & Team

On the Data Insights & Analytics team, our mission is to develop high-quality and sustainable data-driven solutions to improve profitability, growth and the user experience. As a Data Analyst, you’ll work directly with the marketing team to help them leverage data to track performance, make better decisions and ultimately reach their goals. The ideal candidate has strong communications skills, a passion for data, a background in quantitative analysis and an interest in professional sports, betting & eSports.

About The Work

As a key member of our Analytics team you will:


Develop a deep understanding of how users interact with theScore’s apps and websites.
Leverage marketing analytics tools (e.g. Branch, Optimove, Google Analytics) and identify opportunities to apply advanced analytics techniques to drive insights.
Create data models via dbtCloud to assist in database optimization and analyses
Monitor and report on all marketing KPIs and investigate anomalies as they arise.
Analyze and compare quality of paid acquisition and CRM campaigns for media & betting apps.
Answer ad-hoc questions & requests via SQL by leveraging data available in various databases.
Analyze results of betting promotions and recommend improvements & optimizations.
Design, create, execute and measure results from multivariate testing related to marketing activities.
Stay on top of emerging trends in media, sports betting, analytics & marketing industries.
Liaise with business stakeholders to identify data-drive projects and perform deep-dive analyses to provide recommendations and help make impactful, data-driven decisions
Oversee team's analysis to ensure data and insights shared are accurate and informative.
Mentor Junior Data Analysts.



About You


University degree in Business, Economics, Computer Science or related field.
3+ years of related experience.
Demonstrated ability to work with a variety of analytics tools such as, but not limited to: Looker, Mode, ThoughtSpot, Tableau, Power BI, Amplitude, Branch, Sensor Tower, Google Analytics.
Strong knowledge of relational databases and SQL.
Familiarity with analysis tools; R or Python packages are preferred.
A passion and curiosity for solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.
Ability to take complex data and present it in a clear and simple manner.
Ability to focus in a fast paced environment and multitask.
Excellent written and oral communications skills.



What We Offer


Competitive compensation package
Fun, relaxed work environment
Education and conference reimbursements.
Parental leave top up
Opportunities for career progression and mentoring others



Candidates residing in Ontario requiring special accommodation can email accessibilityoffice@thescore.com

theScore is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability or age.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US:

Programmed Insurance Brokers Inc. (PIB) is a leading full-service, multi-line insurance, and financial services agency, established in 1980. As a nationally licensed agency with access to a diverse insurance carrier market and investment firms, PIB offers unique insurance solutions and custom financial services that empower our clients with real choices. Our personalized approach, industry expertise, and commitment to integrity have helped us earn and retain our clients’ trust and confidence over the years.




No matter how small or how large your insurance or financial planning needs are - whether you have a personal or corporate need - we can help you find an insurance or financial solution that will work for you.

Wealth Management & Financial Planning
Commercial Business Solutions
Group Benefits & Group Retirement Services
Life Insurance & Living Benefits
Home & Auto Insurance




RESPONSIBILITIES:




Data Owner

Data types include primarily client based, sales based, revenue and expense related data
Responsible for collecting, organizing and analyzing data across all lines of business with multiple administration systems and disseminating the results to senior leadership and parent company
Collaborate with operational teams within all lines of business to improve data availability
Develop new data dashboards, charts and visual aids to support decision making
Maintain on a regular basis the ingestion of data from administration systems into data analysis tools (Salesforce, PowerBI, PowerQuery, Excel, etc.)
Support the creation of templates and documentation
Handle large volumes of structured and unstructured data
Collaborate with people inside the organization
Participate fully as a member of the team, promote team effectiveness and contribute to a positive work environment
Ad hoc projects and support to the rest of the Finance Team

Modernization Projects

Work closely with the Director, Finance & Process Improvements on all data-related projects
Work in conjunction with the Finance team to improve processes around obtaining and maintaining data to support KPI reporting to senior leadership and the parent company
Develop and maintain tools to support, simplify and automate processes related to interpreting data
Provide recommendations to improve effectiveness and/or efficiency of business processes related to data creation
Respond to ad hoc business inquiries




QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, engineering, science or related field
2+ years’ work experience preferably in a financial/insurance environment
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of products, with emphasis on strong Excel skills (macros, pivot tables, look-ups, and filtering)
Experience with data languages and data visualization (e.g. PowerBI, Salesforce)
Experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques
Proven analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate information with attention to detail and accuracy




BENEFITS AND PERKS:

You will enjoy a very competitive compensation model
A comprehensive employee group benefits package (health, dental, disability, life and travel)
Profit sharing and company pension
Flexibility within the role, hours, and office locations
Wellness Programs and Social Committee to provide team, family and individual collaboration and culture around strategic goals, fun, wellness, health and lifestyle
Committed to diversity, equity and inclusion




APPLY NOW:

PIB is an innovative leader in the insurance industry. Our head office is in Elmira, ON, with subsidiary offices in London and Chatham, ON, Bedford, NS, and Edmonton, AB. Learn more at: www.pib.com.




Navacord, and all our Broker Partners are actively committed to supporting diversity, equity, and inclusion. We serve and recognize and respect human differences and similarities. We value the diversity of people and actively encourage women, indigenous peoples, members of visible minorities, people with disabilities, and lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ2+) persons to apply. We are committed to providing accommodation upon request for applicants and employees with disabilities. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented Data Quality Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for investigating Excel data quality reports, writing basic SQL queries, and utilizing the PPLUS environment to ensure data integrity and accuracy. This role requires a strong analytical mindset, excellent problem-solving skills, and a keen eye for detail. This position involves working closely with various stakeholders to identify data quality issues, conduct root cause analyses, and implement effective solutions to enhance overall data quality. Also, the analyst will help develop and maintain data quality metrics and dashboards, contributing to continuous improvement of our data management processes. Through meticulous analysis and proactive problem-solving, the Data Quality Analyst will support the organization's data-driven decision-making and operational efficiency.

The Work !


Investigate and analyze Excel data quality reports to identify discrepancies and areas for improvement
Write basic SQL queries to extract, validate, and manipulate data if needed
Utilize the PPLUS environment to perform data quality checks and ensure adherence to data standards
Document findings and provide detailed reports on data quality investigations
Assist in the resolution of data quality issues within the Business Unit, collaborating with relevant stakeholders to address and mitigate such issues
Assist in the development and maintenance of data quality metrics and dashboards




Let's Talk About You !


Post-Secondary education in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Management) or 3-5 years work experience in either Business domain or Data domain
Proficiency in Excel: Ability to navigate, analyze, and manipulate large datasets in Excel
SQL Skills: Basic proficiency in writing and executing SQL queries to extract and validate data
Solid understanding of Single Family Residential and retail mortgage products
PPLUS Environment: Experience using the PPLUS environment or a similar loan origination system
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills to document findings and interact with stakeholders
Collaboration: Ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaborate with cross-functional teams

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Background:

TekRek is assisting our client partner to recruit an experienced Senior Data Analyst (6 - Month Contract) in Toronto. Our client is a growth stage Fintech business working with cutting edge technology.




Job Description:

As a data analyst you will be responsible for developing a clear and concise data analysis in partnership with various department heads in the sales, marketing, and product department.
A detailed knowledge of data visualization tools and building out dashboards, especially from a marketing perspective.
Be a key leader in driving the data driven culture, using data to manage strategic business decisions and growth.
Previous experience in a production environment with a detailed knowledge of coding integrity, reliability, and cost. Ideally, a deep technical knowledge using Python.
Drive an agile team that focused on building fast and driving growth.




Requirements:

Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or a similar discipline
3+ years experience in date analytics position, ideally leading or mentoring mid-sized team
Previous experience presenting analyses and business dashboards to a broad non-technical audience
Experience working with tools such as Looker, DBT, AWS, and Databrick would be idea.
Excellent communication skills.

Title: Data Reporting Analyst
Description:
Who We Are?




ONxpress Transportation Partners (ONxpress) were chosen by Metrolinx and Infrastructure Ontario (IO) to enter the Development Phase of the On-Corridor Works project – the largest project in Metrolinx’s GO Expansion.

Unprecedented in its scale and complexity, this multi-billion-dollar capital program will transform the GO regional rail network with electrification, more frequent service, shorter journey times and a more modernized system for the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area.




What is the Opportunity?




ONxpress Civil Contractors Joint Venture (CJV) is looking for a Data Reporting Analyst. This position is based out of our downtown Toronto office.




What you’ll do here:




• Create data models to transform raw data into relevant insights via dashboards, reports and metrics in Power BI

• Rebuild existing dashboards into more dynamic as well as builds new visuals.

• Create, test, and deploy Power BI scripts, as well as execute efficient deep analysis.

• Design and map data models to shift raw data into meaningful insights.

• Search and identify pathways for automation and data efficiency.

• Identify gaps in best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation.

• Use Power BI to run DAX queries and functions.

• Gather data from various sources (Excel, API, database, etc..) to store in a central database or to push to other sources.




What You Bring to the Team:




• College or university degree

• Prior experience in Data-related tasks.

• Experience with Power BI, Power apps and Power Automate.

• Familiar with Power Query, MDX, DAX, Python.

• Analytical thinking for converting data into relevant reports and graphics.




We are an Equal Employer. Should you need any accommodation through the recruitment process, please contact cjv-talentacquisition@onxpress.com We appreciate your interest; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted by our Talent Acquisition Team. We do not accept unsolicited agencies' resumes.
